00347     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180030000028ull);
00348 }
00349 #else
00350 #define CVMX_DFA_ERR (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180030000028ull))
00351 #endif
00352 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00353 #define CVMX_DFA_ERROR CVMX_DFA_ERROR_FUNC()
00354 static inline uint64_t CVMX_DFA_ERROR_FUNC(void)
00355 {
00356     if (!(OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X)))
00357         cvmx_warn("CVMX_DFA_ERROR not supported on this chip\n");
00358     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180037000028ull);
00359 }
00360 #else
00361 #define CVMX_DFA_ERROR (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180037000028ull))
00362 #endif

00608 {

00610         cvmx_warn("CVMX_DFA_SBD_DBG3 not supported on this chip\n");
00611     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180030000058ull);
00612 }
00613 #else
00614 #define CVMX_DFA_SBD_DBG3 (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180030000058ull))
00615 #endif
00616 
00617 /**
00618  * cvmx_dfa_bist0
00619  *
00620  * This register shows the result of the BIST run on the HFA (per-DTC).
00621  * 1 = BIST error, 0 = BIST passed, is in progress, or never ran.
00622  */
00623 union cvmx_dfa_bist0 {
00624     uint64_t u64;
00625     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_s {
00626 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00627     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
00628     uint64_t gfb                          : 4;  /**< BIST results for GFB RAMs (per cluster). */
00629     uint64_t stx3                         : 2;  /**< BIST Results for STX3 RAM(s). */
00630     uint64_t stx2                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX2 RAMs. */
00631     uint64_t stx1                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX1 RAMs. */
00632     uint64_t stx                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX0 RAMs. */
00633     uint64_t dtx3                         : 2;  /**< BIST Results for DTX3 RAM(s). */
00634     uint64_t dtx2                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX2 RAMs. */
00635     uint64_t dtx1                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX1 RAMs. */
00636     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX0 RAMs. */
00637     uint64_t rdf                          : 4;  /**< BIST results for RWB RAMs (per cluster). */
00638     uint64_t pdb                          : 4;  /**< BIST results for PDB RAMs (per cluster). */
00639 #else
00640     uint64_t pdb                          : 4;
00641     uint64_t rdf                          : 4;
00642     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;
00643     uint64_t dtx1                         : 2;
00644     uint64_t dtx2                         : 2;
00645     uint64_t dtx3                         : 2;
00646     uint64_t stx                          : 2;
00647     uint64_t stx1                         : 2;
00648     uint64_t stx2                         : 2;
00649     uint64_t stx3                         : 2;
00650     uint64_t gfb                          : 4;
00651     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
00652 #endif
00653     } s;
00654     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn61xx {
00655 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00656     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00657     uint64_t gfb                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for GFB RAM(s) (per-cluster)
00658                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00659                                                          - 1: BAD */
00660     uint64_t reserved_18_23               : 6;
00661     uint64_t stx                          : 2;  /**< Bist Results for STX0 RAM(s)
00662                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00663                                                          - 1: BAD */
00664     uint64_t reserved_10_15               : 6;
00665     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;  /**< Bist Results for DTX0 RAM(s)
00666                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00667                                                          - 1: BAD */
00668     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
00669     uint64_t rdf                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for RWB RAM(s) (per-cluster)
00670                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00671                                                          - 1: BAD */
00672     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00673     uint64_t pdb                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for PDB RAM(s) (per-cluster)
00674                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00675                                                          - 1: BAD */
00676 #else
00677     uint64_t pdb                          : 1;
00678     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00679     uint64_t rdf                          : 1;
00680     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
00681     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;
00682     uint64_t reserved_10_15               : 6;
00683     uint64_t stx                          : 2;
00684     uint64_t reserved_18_23               : 6;
00685     uint64_t gfb                          : 1;
00686     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00687 #endif
00688     } cn61xx;
00689     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn63xx {
00690 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00691     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
00692     uint64_t mwb                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for MWB RAM(s)
00693                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00694                                                          - 1: BAD */
00695     uint64_t reserved_25_27               : 3;
00696     uint64_t gfb                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for GFB RAM(s)
00697                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00698                                                          - 1: BAD */
00699     uint64_t reserved_18_23               : 6;
00700     uint64_t stx                          : 2;  /**< Bist Results for STX RAM(s)
00701                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00702                                                          - 1: BAD */
00703     uint64_t reserved_10_15               : 6;
00704     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;  /**< Bist Results for DTX RAM(s)
00705                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00706                                                          - 1: BAD */
00707     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
00708     uint64_t rdf                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for RWB[3:0] RAM(s)
00709                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00710                                                          - 1: BAD */
00711     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00712     uint64_t pdb                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for PDB RAM(s)
00713                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00714                                                          - 1: BAD */
00715 #else
00716     uint64_t pdb                          : 1;
00717     uint64_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
00718     uint64_t rdf                          : 1;
00719     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
00720     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;
00721     uint64_t reserved_10_15               : 6;
00722     uint64_t stx                          : 2;
00723     uint64_t reserved_18_23               : 6;
00724     uint64_t gfb                          : 1;
00725     uint64_t reserved_25_27               : 3;
00726     uint64_t mwb                          : 1;
00727     uint64_t reserved_29_63               : 35;
00728 #endif
00729     } cn63xx;
00730     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn63xx          cn63xxp1;
00731     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn63xx          cn66xx;
00732     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn68xx {
00733 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00734     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
00735     uint64_t mrp                          : 2;  /**< Bist Results for MRP RAM(s) (per-DLC)
00736                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00737                                                          - 1: BAD */
00738     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
00739     uint64_t gfb                          : 3;  /**< Bist Results for GFB RAM(s) (per-cluster)
00740                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00741                                                          - 1: BAD */
00742     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
00743     uint64_t stx2                         : 2;  /**< Bist Results for STX2 RAM(s)
00744                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00745                                                          - 1: BAD */
00746     uint64_t stx1                         : 2;  /**< Bist Results for STX1 RAM(s)
00747                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00748                                                          - 1: BAD */
00749     uint64_t stx                          : 2;  /**< Bist Results for STX0 RAM(s)
00750                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00751                                                          - 1: BAD */
00752     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
00753     uint64_t dtx2                         : 2;  /**< Bist Results for DTX2 RAM(s)
00754                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00755                                                          - 1: BAD */
00756     uint64_t dtx1                         : 2;  /**< Bist Results for DTX1 RAM(s)
00757                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00758                                                          - 1: BAD */
00759     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;  /**< Bist Results for DTX0 RAM(s)
00760                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00761                                                          - 1: BAD */
00762     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
00763     uint64_t rdf                          : 3;  /**< Bist Results for RWB RAM(s) (per-cluster)
00764                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00765                                                          - 1: BAD */
00766     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
00767     uint64_t pdb                          : 3;  /**< Bist Results for PDB RAM(s) (per-cluster)
00768                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00769                                                          - 1: BAD */
00770 #else
00771     uint64_t pdb                          : 3;
00772     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
00773     uint64_t rdf                          : 3;
00774     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
00775     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;
00776     uint64_t dtx1                         : 2;
00777     uint64_t dtx2                         : 2;
00778     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
00779     uint64_t stx                          : 2;
00780     uint64_t stx1                         : 2;
00781     uint64_t stx2                         : 2;
00782     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
00783     uint64_t gfb                          : 3;
00784     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
00785     uint64_t mrp                          : 2;
00786     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
00787 #endif
00788     } cn68xx;
00789     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn68xx          cn68xxp1;
00790     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn61xx          cn70xx;
00791     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn61xx          cn70xxp1;
00792     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn73xx {
00793 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00794     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
00795     uint64_t mrp                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for MRP RAM(s) (per-DLC) */
00796     uint64_t reserved_26_27               : 2;
00797     uint64_t gfb                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for GFB RAMs (per cluster) */
00798     uint64_t reserved_20_23               : 4;
00799     uint64_t stx1                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX1 RAMs */
00800     uint64_t stx                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX0 RAMs */
00801     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
00802     uint64_t dtx1                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX1 RAMs */
00803     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX0 RAMs */

00806     uint64_t reserved_2_3                 : 2;

00808 #else

00811     uint64_t rdf                          : 2;
00812     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
00813     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;
00814     uint64_t dtx1                         : 2;

00816     uint64_t stx                          : 2;
00817     uint64_t stx1                         : 2;

00819     uint64_t gfb                          : 2;

00821     uint64_t mrp                          : 2;
00822     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
00823 #endif
00824     } cn73xx;
00825     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn78xx {
00826 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00827     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
00828     uint64_t mrp                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for MRP RAM(s) (per-DLC). */
00829     uint64_t gfb                          : 4;  /**< BIST results for GFB RAMs (per cluster). */
00830     uint64_t stx3                         : 2;  /**< BIST Results for STX3 RAM(s). */
00831     uint64_t stx2                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX2 RAMs. */
00832     uint64_t stx1                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX1 RAMs. */
00833     uint64_t stx                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for STX0 RAMs. */
00834     uint64_t dtx3                         : 2;  /**< BIST Results for DTX3 RAM(s). */
00835     uint64_t dtx2                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX2 RAMs. */
00836     uint64_t dtx1                         : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX1 RAMs. */
00837     uint64_t dtx                          : 2;  /**< BIST results for DTX0 RAMs. */
00838     uint64_t rdf                          : 4;  /**< BIST results for RWB RAMs (per cluster). */
00839     uint64_t pdb                          : 4;  /**< BIST results for PDB RAMs (per cluster). */
00840 #else

00842     uint64_t rdf                          : 4;

00852     uint64_t mrp                          : 2;
00853     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
00854 #endif
00855     } cn78xx;
00856     struct cvmx_dfa_bist0_cn78xx          cn78xxp1;
00857 };
00858 typedef union cvmx_dfa_bist0 cvmx_dfa_bist0_t;
00859 
00860 /**
00861  * cvmx_dfa_bist1
00862  *
00863  * This register shows the result of the BIST run on the HFA (globals).
00864  * 1 = BIST error, 0 = BIST passed, is in progress, or never ran.
00865  */
00866 union cvmx_dfa_bist1 {
00867     uint64_t u64;
00868     struct cvmx_dfa_bist1_s {
00869 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00870     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
00871     uint64_t dc3ram3                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 3 BIST results for RAM3 RAM. */
00872     uint64_t dc3ram2                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 3 BIST results for RAM2 RAM. */
00873     uint64_t dc3ram1                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 3 BIST results for RAM1 RAM. */
00874     uint64_t dlc1ram                      : 1;  /**< DLC1 BIST results. */
00875     uint64_t dlc0ram                      : 1;  /**< DLC0 BIST results. */
00876     uint64_t dc2ram3                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 2 BIST results for RAM3 RAM. */
00877     uint64_t dc2ram2                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 2 BIST results for RAM2 RAM. */
00878     uint64_t dc2ram1                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 2 BIST results for RAM1 RAM. */
00879     uint64_t dc1ram3                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 1 BIST results for RAM3 RAM. */
00880     uint64_t dc1ram2                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 1 BIST results for RAM2 RAM. */
00881     uint64_t dc1ram1                      : 1;  /**< Cluster 1 BIST results for RAM1 RAM. */
00882     uint64_t ram3                         : 1;  /**< Cluster 0 BIST results for RAM3 RAM. */
00883     uint64_t ram2                         : 1;  /**< Cluster 0 BIST results for RAM2 RAM. */
00884     uint64_t ram1                         : 1;  /**< Cluster 0 BIST results for RAM1 RAM. */
00885     uint64_t crq                          : 1;  /**< BIST results for CRQ RAM. */
00886     uint64_t gutv                         : 1;  /**< BIST results for GUTV RAM. */
00887     uint64_t gutp                         : 4;  /**< BIST results for GUTP RAMs (per-cluster). */
00888     uint64_t ncd                          : 1;  /**< BIST results for NCD RAM. */
00889     uint64_t gif                          : 1;  /**< BIST results for GIF RAM. */
00890     uint64_t gib                          : 1;  /**< BIST results for GIB RAM. */
00891     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;  /**< BIST results for GFU RAM. */
00892 #else
00893     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;
00894     uint64_t gib                          : 1;
00895     uint64_t gif                          : 1;
00896     uint64_t ncd                          : 1;
00897     uint64_t gutp                         : 4;
00898     uint64_t gutv                         : 1;
00899     uint64_t crq                          : 1;
00900     uint64_t ram1                         : 1;
00901     uint64_t ram2                         : 1;
00902     uint64_t ram3                         : 1;
00903     uint64_t dc1ram1                      : 1;
00904     uint64_t dc1ram2                      : 1;
00905     uint64_t dc1ram3                      : 1;
00906     uint64_t dc2ram1                      : 1;
00907     uint64_t dc2ram2                      : 1;
00908     uint64_t dc2ram3                      : 1;
00909     uint64_t dlc0ram                      : 1;
00910     uint64_t dlc1ram                      : 1;
00911     uint64_t dc3ram1                      : 1;
00912     uint64_t dc3ram2                      : 1;
00913     uint64_t dc3ram3                      : 1;
00914     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
00915 #endif
00916     } s;
00917     struct cvmx_dfa_bist1_cn61xx {
00918 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD

00921                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)

01121     uint64_t gutp                         : 4;  /**< BIST results for GUTP RAMs (per-cluster) */
01122     uint64_t ncd                          : 1;  /**< BIST results for NCD RAM */

01126 #else

01128     uint64_t gib                          : 1;
01129     uint64_t gif                          : 1;
01130     uint64_t ncd                          : 1;
01131     uint64_t gutp                         : 4;
01132     uint64_t gutv                         : 1;
01133     uint64_t crq                          : 1;
01134     uint64_t ram1                         : 1;
01135     uint64_t ram2                         : 1;
01136     uint64_t ram3                         : 1;
01137     uint64_t dc1ram1                      : 1;
01138     uint64_t dc1ram2                      : 1;
01139     uint64_t dc1ram3                      : 1;
01140     uint64_t reserved_16_18               : 3;
01141     uint64_t dlc0ram                      : 1;
01142     uint64_t dlc1ram                      : 1;
01143     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
01144 #endif
01145     } cn73xx;
01146     struct cvmx_dfa_bist1_s               cn78xx;
01147     struct cvmx_dfa_bist1_s               cn78xxp1;
01148 };
01149 typedef union cvmx_dfa_bist1 cvmx_dfa_bist1_t;
01150 
01151 /**
01152  * cvmx_dfa_bst0
01153  *
01154  * DFA_BST0 = DFA Bist Status
01155  *
01156  * Description:
01157  */
01158 union cvmx_dfa_bst0 {
01159     uint64_t u64;
01160     struct cvmx_dfa_bst0_s {
01161 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01162     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
01163     uint64_t rdf                          : 16; /**< Bist Results for RDF[3:0] RAM(s)
01164                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01165                                                          - 1: BAD */
01166     uint64_t pdf                          : 16; /**< Bist Results for PDF[3:0] RAM(s)
01167                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01168                                                          - 1: BAD */
01169 #else
01170     uint64_t pdf                          : 16;
01171     uint64_t rdf                          : 16;
01172     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
01173 #endif
01174     } s;
01175     struct cvmx_dfa_bst0_s                cn31xx;
01176     struct cvmx_dfa_bst0_s                cn38xx;
01177     struct cvmx_dfa_bst0_s                cn38xxp2;
01178     struct cvmx_dfa_bst0_cn58xx {
01179 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01180     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
01181     uint64_t rdf                          : 4;  /**< Bist Results for RDF[3:0] RAM(s)
01182                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01183                                                          - 1: BAD */
01184     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
01185     uint64_t pdf                          : 4;  /**< Bist Results for PDF[3:0] RAM(s)
01186                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01187                                                          - 1: BAD */
01188 #else
01189     uint64_t pdf                          : 4;
01190     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
01191     uint64_t rdf                          : 4;
01192     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
01193 #endif
01194     } cn58xx;
01195     struct cvmx_dfa_bst0_cn58xx           cn58xxp1;
01196 };
01197 typedef union cvmx_dfa_bst0 cvmx_dfa_bst0_t;
01198 
01199 /**
01200  * cvmx_dfa_bst1
01201  *
01202  * DFA_BST1 = DFA Bist Status
01203  *
01204  * Description:
01205  */
01206 union cvmx_dfa_bst1 {
01207     uint64_t u64;
01208     struct cvmx_dfa_bst1_s {
01209 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01210     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
01211     uint64_t crq                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for CRQ RAM
01212                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01213                                                          - 1: BAD */
01214     uint64_t ifu                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for IFU RAM
01215                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01216                                                          - 1: BAD */
01217     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for GFU RAM
01218                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01219                                                          - 1: BAD */
01220     uint64_t drf                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for DRF RAM
01221                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01222                                                          - 1: BAD */
01223     uint64_t crf                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for CRF RAM
01224                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01225                                                          - 1: BAD */
01226     uint64_t p0_bwb                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for P0_BWB RAM
01227                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01228                                                          - 1: BAD */
01229     uint64_t p1_bwb                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for P1_BWB RAM
01230                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01231                                                          - 1: BAD */
01232     uint64_t p0_brf                       : 8;  /**< Bist Results for P0_BRF RAM
01233                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01234                                                          - 1: BAD */
01235     uint64_t p1_brf                       : 8;  /**< Bist Results for P1_BRF RAM
01236                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01237                                                          - 1: BAD */
01238 #else
01239     uint64_t p1_brf                       : 8;
01240     uint64_t p0_brf                       : 8;
01241     uint64_t p1_bwb                       : 1;
01242     uint64_t p0_bwb                       : 1;
01243     uint64_t crf                          : 1;
01244     uint64_t drf                          : 1;
01245     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;
01246     uint64_t ifu                          : 1;
01247     uint64_t crq                          : 1;
01248     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
01249 #endif
01250     } s;
01251     struct cvmx_dfa_bst1_cn31xx {
01252 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01253     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
01254     uint64_t crq                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for CRQ RAM
01255                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01256                                                          - 1: BAD */
01257     uint64_t ifu                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for IFU RAM
01258                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01259                                                          - 1: BAD */
01260     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for GFU RAM
01261                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01262                                                          - 1: BAD */
01263     uint64_t drf                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for DRF RAM
01264                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01265                                                          - 1: BAD */
01266     uint64_t crf                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for CRF RAM
01267                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01268                                                          - 1: BAD */
01269     uint64_t reserved_0_17                : 18;
01270 #else
01271     uint64_t reserved_0_17                : 18;
01272     uint64_t crf                          : 1;
01273     uint64_t drf                          : 1;
01274     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;
01275     uint64_t ifu                          : 1;
01276     uint64_t crq                          : 1;
01277     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
01278 #endif
01279     } cn31xx;
01280     struct cvmx_dfa_bst1_s                cn38xx;
01281     struct cvmx_dfa_bst1_s                cn38xxp2;
01282     struct cvmx_dfa_bst1_cn58xx {
01283 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01284     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
01285     uint64_t crq                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for CRQ RAM
01286                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01287                                                          - 1: BAD */
01288     uint64_t ifu                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for IFU RAM
01289                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01290                                                          - 1: BAD */
01291     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for GFU RAM
01292                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01293                                                          - 1: BAD */
01294     uint64_t reserved_19_19               : 1;
01295     uint64_t crf                          : 1;  /**< Bist Results for CRF RAM
01296                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01297                                                          - 1: BAD */
01298     uint64_t p0_bwb                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for P0_BWB RAM
01299                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01300                                                          - 1: BAD */
01301     uint64_t p1_bwb                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for P1_BWB RAM
01302                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01303                                                          - 1: BAD */
01304     uint64_t p0_brf                       : 8;  /**< Bist Results for P0_BRF RAM
01305                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01306                                                          - 1: BAD */
01307     uint64_t p1_brf                       : 8;  /**< Bist Results for P1_BRF RAM
01308                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
01309                                                          - 1: BAD */
01310 #else
01311     uint64_t p1_brf                       : 8;
01312     uint64_t p0_brf                       : 8;
01313     uint64_t p1_bwb                       : 1;
01314     uint64_t p0_bwb                       : 1;
01315     uint64_t crf                          : 1;
01316     uint64_t reserved_19_19               : 1;
01317     uint64_t gfu                          : 1;
01318     uint64_t ifu                          : 1;
01319     uint64_t crq                          : 1;
01320     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
01321 #endif
01322     } cn58xx;
01323     struct cvmx_dfa_bst1_cn58xx           cn58xxp1;
01324 };
01325 typedef union cvmx_dfa_bst1 cvmx_dfa_bst1_t;
01326 
01327 /**
01328  * cvmx_dfa_cfg
01329  *
01330  * Specify the RSL base addresses for the block
01331  *
01332  *                  DFA_CFG = DFA Configuration
01333  *
01334  * Description:
01335  */
01336 union cvmx_dfa_cfg {
01337     uint64_t u64;
01338     struct cvmx_dfa_cfg_s {
01339 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01340     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
01341     uint64_t nrpl_ena                     : 1;  /**< When set, allows the per-node replication feature to be
01342                                                          enabled.
01343                                                          In 36-bit mode: The IWORD0[31:30]=SNREPL field AND
01344                                                          bits [21:20] of the Next Node ptr are used in generating
01345                                                          the next node address (see OCTEON HRM - DFA Chapter for
01346                                                          psuedo-code of DTE next node address generation).
01347                                                          NOTE: When NRPL_ENA=1 and IWORD0[TY]=1(36b mode),
01348                                                          (regardless of IWORD0[NRPLEN]), the Resultant Word1+
01349                                                          [[47:44],[23:20]] = Next Node's [27:20] bits. This allows
01350                                                          SW to use the RESERVED bits of the final node for SW
01351                                                          caching. Also, if required, SW will use [22:21]=Node
01352                                                          Replication to re-start the same graph walk(if graph
01353                                                          walk prematurely terminated (ie: DATA_GONE).
01354                                                          In 18-bit mode: The IWORD0[31:30]=SNREPL field AND
01355                                                          bit [16:14] of the Next Node ptr are used in generating
01356                                                          the next node address (see OCTEON HRM - DFA Chapter for
01357                                                          psuedo-code of DTE next node address generation).
01358                                                          If (IWORD0[NREPLEN]=1 and DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA]=1) [
01359                                                             If next node ptr[16] is set [
01360                                                               next node ptr[15:14] indicates the next node repl
01361                                                               next node ptr[13:0]  indicates the position of the
01362                                                                  node relative to the first normal node (i.e.
01363                                                                  IWORD3[Msize] must be added to get the final node)
01364                                                             ]
01365                                                             else If next node ptr[16] is not set [
01366                                                               next node ptr[15:0] indicates the next node id
01367                                                               next node repl = 0
01368                                                             ]
01369                                                          ]
01370                                                          NOTE: For 18b node replication, MAX node space=64KB(2^16)
01371                                                          is used in detecting terminal node space(see HRM for full
01372                                                          description).
01373                                                          NOTE: The DFA graphs MUST BE built/written to DFA LLM memory
01374                                                          aware of the "per-node" replication. */
01375     uint64_t nxor_ena                     : 1;  /**< When set, allows the DTE Instruction IWORD0[NXOREN]
01376                                                          to be used to enable/disable the per-node address 'scramble'
01377                                                          of the LLM address to lessen the effects of bank conflicts.
01378                                                          If IWORD0[NXOREN] is also set, then:
01379                                                          In 36-bit mode: The node_Id[7:0] 8-bit value is XORed
01380                                                          against the LLM address addr[9:2].
01381                                                          In 18-bit mode: The node_id[6:0] 7-bit value is XORed
01382                                                          against the LLM address addr[8:2]. (note: we don't address
01383                                                          scramble outside the mode's node space).
01384                                                          NOTE: The DFA graphs MUST BE built/written to DFA LLM memory
01385                                                          aware of the "per-node" address scramble.
01386                                                          NOTE: The address 'scramble' ocurs for BOTH DFA LLM graph
01387                                                          read/write operations. */
01388     uint64_t gxor_ena                     : 1;  /**< When set, the DTE Instruction IWORD0[GXOR]
01389                                                          field is used to 'scramble' the LLM address
01390                                                          to lessen the effects of bank conflicts.
01391                                                          In 36-bit mode: The GXOR[7:0] 8-bit value is XORed
01392                                                          against the LLM address addr[9:2].
01393                                                          In 18-bit mode: GXOR[6:0] 7-bit value is XORed against
01394                                                          the LLM address addr[8:2]. (note: we don't address
01395                                                          scramble outside the mode's node space)
01396                                                          NOTE: The DFA graphs MUST BE built/written to DFA LLM memory
01397                                                          aware of the "per-graph" address scramble.
01398                                                          NOTE: The address 'scramble' ocurs for BOTH DFA LLM graph
01399                                                          read/write operations. */
01400     uint64_t sarb                         : 1;  /**< DFA Source Arbiter Mode
01401                                                          Selects the arbitration mode used to select DFA
01402                                                          requests issued from either CP2 or the DTE (NCB-CSR
01403                                                          or DFA HW engine).
01404                                                             - 0: Fixed Priority [Highest=CP2, Lowest=DTE]
01405                                                             - 1: Round-Robin
01406                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01407                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
01408 #else
01409     uint64_t sarb                         : 1;
01410     uint64_t gxor_ena                     : 1;
01411     uint64_t nxor_ena                     : 1;
01412     uint64_t nrpl_ena                     : 1;
01413     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
01414 #endif
01415     } s;
01416     struct cvmx_dfa_cfg_s                 cn38xx;
01417     struct cvmx_dfa_cfg_cn38xxp2 {
01418 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01419     uint64_t reserved_1_63                : 63;
01420     uint64_t sarb                         : 1;  /**< DFA Source Arbiter Mode
01421                                                          Selects the arbitration mode used to select DFA
01422                                                          requests issued from either CP2 or the DTE (NCB-CSR
01423                                                          or DFA HW engine).
01424                                                             - 0: Fixed Priority [Highest=CP2, Lowest=DTE]
01425                                                             - 1: Round-Robin
01426                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01427                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
01428 #else
01429     uint64_t sarb                         : 1;
01430     uint64_t reserved_1_63                : 63;
01431 #endif
01432     } cn38xxp2;
01433     struct cvmx_dfa_cfg_s                 cn58xx;
01434     struct cvmx_dfa_cfg_s                 cn58xxp1;
01435 };
01436 typedef union cvmx_dfa_cfg cvmx_dfa_cfg_t;
01437 
01438 /**
01439  * cvmx_dfa_config
01440  *
01441  * Specify the RSL base addresses for the block
01442  * DFA_CONFIG = DFA Configuration Register
01443  * Description:
01444  */
01445 union cvmx_dfa_config {
01446     uint64_t u64;
01447     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s {
01448 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01449     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
01450     uint64_t dlcclear_bist                : 1;  /**< When [DLCSTART_BIST] is written 0->1, if [DLCCLEAR_BIST]=1, all previous DLC BIST state is
01451                                                          cleared. Note the following:
01452                                                          * [DLCCLEAR_BIST] must be written to 1 before [DLCSTART_BIST] is written to 1
01453                                                          using a separate CSR write operation.
01454                                                          * [DLCCLEAR_BIST] must not be changed after writing [DLCSTART_BIST] 0->1 until
01455                                                          the BIST operation completes. */
01456     uint64_t dlcstart_bist                : 1;  /**< When software writes [DLCSTART_BIST]=0->1, a BIST is executed for the DLC sub-block RAMs
01457                                                          which contains DCLK domain asynchronous RAMs. Note the following:
01458                                                          This bit should only be written after DCLK has been enabled by software and is stable.
01459                                                          (See LMC initialization routine for details on how to enable the DDR3/4 memory
01460                                                          (DCLK)--which requires LMC PLL init, clock divider, and proper DLL initialization
01461                                                          sequence.) */
01462     uint64_t repl_ena                     : 1;  /**< Replication mode enable.
01463                                                          This is used by the memory controller to support graph data in multiple ports (or port
01464                                                          sets), so that the least full port can be selected to minimize latency effects.
01465                                                          Software Note: Using this mode requires the HFA software compiler and HFA driver to be
01466                                                          aware of the address replication changes. This involves changes to the MLOAD/GWALK HFA
01467                                                          instruction format (See IWORD2.SREPL), as well as changes to node arc and metadata
01468                                                          definitions which support an additional REPL field. When clear, replication mode is
01469                                                          disabled, and HFA interprets HFA instructions and node-arc formats which do not have
01470                                                          address replication information. */
01471     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;  /**< Cluster cripple mask. A 1 in each bit of the mask represents which HTE cluster to cripple.
01472                                                          CN78XX has four clusters (therefore CLMSKCRIP<3:0> are used.)
01473                                                          The MIO_FUS_DFA_CLMASK_CRIPPLE[3:0] fuse bits are forced into this register at reset. Any
01474                                                          fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write operation and are always read as 1. */
01475     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;  /**< Encoding that represents the number of HTEs to cripple for each cluster. Typically
01476                                                          DTE_CLCRIP = 0, which enables all HTEs within each cluster. However, when the HFA
01477                                                          performance counters are used, software may want to limit the number of HTEs per cluster
01478                                                          available, as there are only four parallel performance counters.
01479                                                          0 = HTE[15:0]:ON.
01480                                                          1 = 1/2 = HTE[15:8]:OFF  /HTE[7:0]:ON.
01481                                                          2 = 1/4 = HTE[15:12]:OFF /HTE[11:0]:ON.
01482                                                          3 = 3/4 = HTE[15:4]:OFF  /HTE[3:0]:ON.
01483                                                          4 = 1/8 = HTE[15:14]:OFF /HTE[13:0]:ON.
01484                                                          5 = 5/8 = HTE[15:6]:OFF  /HTE[5:0]:ON.
01485                                                          6 = 3/8 = HTE[15:10]:OFF /HTE[9:0]:ON.
01486                                                          7 = 7/8 = HTE[15:2]:OFF  /HTE[1:0]:ON.
01487                                                          Higher numbered HTEs are crippled first. For instance, on CN78XX (with 16 HTEs/cluster),
01488                                                          if DTE_CLCRIP = 1 (1/2), then [15:8] within the cluster are crippled and only HTE numbers
01489                                                          [7:0] are available.
01490                                                          The MIO_FUS_DFA_NUMDTE_CRIPPLE[3:0] fuse bits are forced into this register at reset. Any
01491                                                          fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write operation and are always read as 1. */
01492     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;  /**< HFA clock disable source. When set, the HFA clocks for HTE (thread engine) operations are
01493                                                          disabled to conserve overall chip clocking power when the HFA function is not used.
01494                                                          When set, software must never issue IOI-direct CSR operations to the HFA (will result in
01495                                                          IOI timeout errors).
01496                                                          This should only be written to a different value during power-on software initialization.
01497                                                          The MIO_FUS_DFA_DTE_DISABLE fuse bit is forced into this register at reset. If the fuse
01498                                                          bit contains 1, write operations to DTECLKDIS are disallowed and are always read as 1. */
01499 #else
01500     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;
01501     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;
01502     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;
01503     uint64_t repl_ena                     : 1;
01504     uint64_t dlcstart_bist                : 1;
01505     uint64_t dlcclear_bist                : 1;
01506     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
01507 #endif
01508     } s;
01509     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s              cn61xx;
01510     struct cvmx_dfa_config_cn63xx {
01511 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01512     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01513     uint64_t repl_ena                     : 1;  /**< Replication Mode Enable
01514                                                          *** o63-P2 NEW ***
01515                                                          When set, enables replication mode performance enhancement
01516                                                          feature. This enables the DFA to communicate address
01517                                                          replication information during memory references to the DFM
01518                                                          (memory controller). This in turn is used by the DFM to support
01519                                                          graph data in multiple banks (or bank sets), so that the least
01520                                                          full bank can be selected to minimize the effects of DDR3 bank
01521                                                          conflicts (ie: tRC=row cycle time).
01522                                                          SWNOTE: Using this mode requires the DFA SW compiler and DFA
01523                                                          driver to be aware of the o63-P2 address replication changes.
01524                                                          This involves changes to the MLOAD/GWALK DFA instruction format
01525                                                          (see: IWORD2.SREPL), as well as changes to node arc and metadata
01526                                                          definitions which now support an additional REPL field.
01527                                                          When clear, replication mode is disabled, and DFA will interpret
01528                                                          o63-P1 DFA instructions and node-arc formats which DO NOT have
01529                                                          address replication information. */
01530     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;  /**< Cluster Cripple Mask
01531                                                          A one in each bit of the mask represents which DTE cluster to
01532                                                          cripple.
01533                                                          NOTE: o63 has only a single Cluster (therefore CLMSKCRIP[0]
01534                                                          is the only bit used.
01535                                                          o2 has 4 clusters, where all CLMSKCRIP mask bits are used.
01536                                                          SWNOTE: The MIO_FUS___DFA_CLMASK_CRIPPLE[3:0] fuse bits will
01537                                                          be forced into this register at reset. Any fuse bits that
01538                                                          contain '1' will be disallowed during a write and will always
01539                                                          be read as '1'. */
01540     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;  /**< Encoding which represents \#of DTEs to cripple for each
01541                                                          cluster. Typically DTE_CLCRIP=0 which enables all DTEs
01542                                                          within each cluster. However, when the DFA performance
01543                                                          counters are used, SW may want to limit the \#of DTEs
01544                                                          per cluster available, as there are only 4 parallel
01545                                                          performance counters.
01546                                                             DTE_CLCRIP | \#DTEs crippled(per cluster)
01547                                                          ------------+-----------------------------
01548                                                                 0    |  0      DTE[15:0]:ON
01549                                                                 1    |  1/2    DTE[15:8]:OFF  /DTE[7:0]:ON
01550                                                                 2    |  1/4    DTE[15:12]:OFF /DTE[11:0]:ON
01551                                                                 3    |  3/4    DTE[15:4]:OFF  /DTE[3:0]:ON
01552                                                                 4    |  1/8    DTE[15:14]:OFF /DTE[13:0]:ON
01553                                                                 5    |  5/8    DTE[15:6]:OFF  /DTE[5:0]:ON
01554                                                                 6    |  3/8    DTE[15:10]:OFF /DTE[9:0]:ON
01555                                                                 7    |  7/8    DTE[15:2]:OFF  /DTE[1:0]:ON
01556                                                          NOTE: Higher numbered DTEs are crippled first. For instance,
01557                                                          on o63 (with 16 DTEs/cluster), if DTE_CLCRIP=1(1/2), then
01558                                                          DTE#s [15:8] within the cluster are crippled and only
01559                                                          DTE#s [7:0] are available.
01560                                                          IMPNOTE: The encodings are done in such a way as to later
01561                                                          be used with fuses (for future o2 revisions which will disable
01562                                                          some \#of DTEs). Blowing a fuse has the effect that there will
01563                                                          always be fewer DTEs available. [ie: we never want a customer
01564                                                          to blow additional fuses to get more DTEs].
01565                                                          SWNOTE: The MIO_FUS___DFA_NUMDTE_CRIPPLE[2:0] fuse bits will
01566                                                          be forced into this register at reset. Any fuse bits that
01567                                                          contain '1' will be disallowed during a write and will always
01568                                                          be read as '1'. */
01569     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;  /**< DFA Clock Disable Source
01570                                                          When SET, the DFA clocks for DTE(thread engine)
01571                                                          operation are disabled (to conserve overall chip clocking
01572                                                          power when the DFA function is not used).
01573                                                          NOTE: When SET, SW MUST NEVER issue NCB-Direct CSR
01574                                                          operations to the DFA (will result in NCB Bus Timeout
01575                                                          errors).
01576                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01577                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
01578                                                          SWNOTE: The MIO_FUS___DFA_DTE_DISABLE fuse bit will
01579                                                          be forced into this register at reset. If the fuse bit
01580                                                          contains '1', writes to DTECLKDIS are disallowed and
01581                                                          will always be read as '1'. */
01582 #else
01583     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;
01584     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;
01585     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;
01586     uint64_t repl_ena                     : 1;
01587     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01588 #endif
01589     } cn63xx;
01590     struct cvmx_dfa_config_cn63xxp1 {
01591 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01592     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01593     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;  /**< Cluster Cripple Mask
01594                                                          A one in each bit of the mask represents which DTE cluster to
01595                                                          cripple.
01596                                                          NOTE: o63 has only a single Cluster (therefore CLMSKCRIP[0]
01597                                                          is the only bit used.
01598                                                          o2 has 4 clusters, where all CLMSKCRIP mask bits are used.
01599                                                          SWNOTE: The MIO_FUS___DFA_CLMASK_CRIPPLE[3:0] fuse bits will
01600                                                          be forced into this register at reset. Any fuse bits that
01601                                                          contain '1' will be disallowed during a write and will always
01602                                                          be read as '1'. */
01603     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;  /**< Encoding which represents \#of DTEs to cripple for each
01604                                                          cluster. Typically DTE_CLCRIP=0 which enables all DTEs
01605                                                          within each cluster. However, when the DFA performance
01606                                                          counters are used, SW may want to limit the \#of DTEs
01607                                                          per cluster available, as there are only 4 parallel
01608                                                          performance counters.
01609                                                             DTE_CLCRIP | \#DTEs crippled(per cluster)
01610                                                          ------------+-----------------------------
01611                                                                 0    |  0      DTE[15:0]:ON
01612                                                                 1    |  1/2    DTE[15:8]:OFF  /DTE[7:0]:ON
01613                                                                 2    |  1/4    DTE[15:12]:OFF /DTE[11:0]:ON
01614                                                                 3    |  3/4    DTE[15:4]:OFF  /DTE[3:0]:ON
01615                                                                 4    |  1/8    DTE[15:14]:OFF /DTE[13:0]:ON
01616                                                                 5    |  5/8    DTE[15:6]:OFF  /DTE[5:0]:ON
01617                                                                 6    |  3/8    DTE[15:10]:OFF /DTE[9:0]:ON
01618                                                                 7    |  7/8    DTE[15:2]:OFF  /DTE[1:0]:ON
01619                                                          NOTE: Higher numbered DTEs are crippled first. For instance,
01620                                                          on o63 (with 16 DTEs/cluster), if DTE_CLCRIP=1(1/2), then
01621                                                          DTE#s [15:8] within the cluster are crippled and only
01622                                                          DTE#s [7:0] are available.
01623                                                          IMPNOTE: The encodings are done in such a way as to later
01624                                                          be used with fuses (for future o2 revisions which will disable
01625                                                          some \#of DTEs). Blowing a fuse has the effect that there will
01626                                                          always be fewer DTEs available. [ie: we never want a customer
01627                                                          to blow additional fuses to get more DTEs].
01628                                                          SWNOTE: The MIO_FUS___DFA_NUMDTE_CRIPPLE[2:0] fuse bits will
01629                                                          be forced into this register at reset. Any fuse bits that
01630                                                          contain '1' will be disallowed during a write and will always
01631                                                          be read as '1'. */
01632     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;  /**< DFA Clock Disable Source
01633                                                          When SET, the DFA clocks for DTE(thread engine)
01634                                                          operation are disabled (to conserve overall chip clocking
01635                                                          power when the DFA function is not used).
01636                                                          NOTE: When SET, SW MUST NEVER issue NCB-Direct CSR
01637                                                          operations to the DFA (will result in NCB Bus Timeout
01638                                                          errors).
01639                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01640                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
01641                                                          SWNOTE: The MIO_FUS___DFA_DTE_DISABLE fuse bit will
01642                                                          be forced into this register at reset. If the fuse bit
01643                                                          contains '1', writes to DTECLKDIS are disallowed and
01644                                                          will always be read as '1'. */
01645 #else
01646     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;
01647     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;
01648     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;
01649     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01650 #endif
01651     } cn63xxp1;
01652     struct cvmx_dfa_config_cn63xx         cn66xx;
01653     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s              cn68xx;
01654     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s              cn68xxp1;
01655     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s              cn70xx;
01656     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s              cn70xxp1;
01657     struct cvmx_dfa_config_cn73xx {
01658 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01659     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
01660     uint64_t dlcclear_bist                : 1;  /**< When [DLCSTART_BIST] is written 0->1, if [DLCCLEAR_BIST]=1, all previous DLC BIST state is
01661                                                          cleared. Note the following:
01662                                                          * [DLCCLEAR_BIST] must be written to 1 before [DLCSTART_BIST] is written to 1
01663                                                          using a separate CSR write operation.
01664                                                          * [DLCCLEAR_BIST] must not be changed after writing [DLCSTART_BIST] 0->1 until
01665                                                          the BIST operation completes. */
01666     uint64_t dlcstart_bist                : 1;  /**< When software writes [DLCSTART_BIST]=0->1, a BIST is executed for the DLC sub-block RAMs
01667                                                          which contains DCLK domain asynchronous RAMs. Note the following:
01668                                                          This bit should only be written after DCLK has been enabled by software and is stable.
01669                                                          (See LMC initialization routine for details on how to enable the DDR3/4 memory
01670                                                          (DCLK)--which requires LMC PLL init, clock divider, and proper DLL initialization
01671                                                          sequence.) */
01672     uint64_t repl_ena                     : 1;  /**< Replication mode enable.
01673                                                          This is used by the memory controller to support graph data in multiple ports (or port
01674                                                          sets), so that the least full port can be selected to minimize latency effects.
01675                                                          Software Note: Using this mode requires the HFA software compiler and HFA driver to be
01676                                                          aware of the address replication changes. This involves changes to the MLOAD/GWALK HFA
01677                                                          instruction format (See IWORD2.SREPL), as well as changes to node arc and metadata
01678                                                          definitions which support an additional REPL field. When clear, replication mode is
01679                                                          disabled, and HFA interprets HFA instructions and node-arc formats which do not have
01680                                                          address replication information. */
01681     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
01682     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 2;  /**< Cluster cripple mask. A 1 in each bit of the mask represents which HTE cluster to cripple.
01683                                                          CN73XX has two clusters (therefore CLMSKCRIP<1:0> are used.)
01684                                                          The MIO_FUS_DFA_CLMASK_CRIPPLE[1:0] fuse bits are forced into this register at reset. Any
01685                                                          fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write operation and are always read as 1. */
01686     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;  /**< Encoding that represents the number of HTEs to cripple for each cluster. Typically
01687                                                          DTE_CLCRIP = 0, which enables all HTEs within each cluster. However, when the HFA
01688                                                          performance counters are used, software may want to limit the number of HTEs per cluster
01689                                                          available, as there are only four parallel performance counters.
01690                                                          0 = HTE[15:0]:ON.
01691                                                          1 = 1/2 = HTE[15:8]:OFF  /HTE[7:0]:ON.
01692                                                          2 = 1/4 = HTE[15:12]:OFF /HTE[11:0]:ON.
01693                                                          3 = 3/4 = HTE[15:4]:OFF  /HTE[3:0]:ON.
01694                                                          4 = 1/8 = HTE[15:14]:OFF /HTE[13:0]:ON.
01695                                                          5 = 5/8 = HTE[15:6]:OFF  /HTE[5:0]:ON.
01696                                                          6 = 3/8 = HTE[15:10]:OFF /HTE[9:0]:ON.
01697                                                          7 = 7/8 = HTE[15:2]:OFF  /HTE[1:0]:ON.
01698                                                          Higher numbered HTEs are crippled first. For instance, on CN78XX (with 16 HTEs/cluster),
01699                                                          if DTE_CLCRIP = 1 (1/2), then [15:8] within the cluster are crippled and only HTE numbers
01700                                                          [7:0] are available.
01701                                                          The MIO_FUS_DFA_NUMDTE_CRIPPLE[3:0] fuse bits are forced into this register at reset. Any
01702                                                          fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write operation and are always read as 1. */
01703     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;  /**< HFA clock disable source. When set, the HFA clocks for HTE (thread engine) operations are
01704                                                          disabled to conserve overall chip clocking power when the HFA function is not used.
01705                                                          When set, software must never issue IOI-direct CSR operations to the HFA (will result in
01706                                                          IOI timeout errors).
01707                                                          This should only be written to a different value during power-on software initialization.
01708                                                          The MIO_FUS_DFA_DTE_DISABLE fuse bit is forced into this register at reset. If the fuse
01709                                                          bit contains 1, write operations to DTECLKDIS are disallowed and are always read as 1. */
01710 #else
01711     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;
01712     uint64_t cldtecrip                    : 3;
01713     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 2;
01714     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
01715     uint64_t repl_ena                     : 1;
01716     uint64_t dlcstart_bist                : 1;
01717     uint64_t dlcclear_bist                : 1;
01718     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
01719 #endif
01720     } cn73xx;
01721     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s              cn78xx;
01722     struct cvmx_dfa_config_s              cn78xxp1;
01723 };
01724 typedef union cvmx_dfa_config cvmx_dfa_config_t;
01725 
01726 /**
01727  * cvmx_dfa_control
01728  *
01729  * Description:
01730  *
01731  */
01732 union cvmx_dfa_control {
01733     uint64_t u64;
01734     struct cvmx_dfa_control_s {
01735 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01736     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
01737     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 6;  /**< Reserved. */
01738     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
01739     uint64_t reserved_3_4                 : 2;
01740     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
01741     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
01742     uint64_t imode                        : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
01743 #else
01744     uint64_t imode                        : 1;
01745     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;
01746     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;
01747     uint64_t reserved_3_4                 : 2;
01748     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;
01749     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 6;
01750     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
01751 #endif
01752     } s;
01753     struct cvmx_dfa_control_cn61xx {
01754 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01755     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01756     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 4;  /**< SBD Debug Entry#
01757                                                          *FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY*
01758                                                          DFA Scoreboard debug control
01759                                                          Selects which one of 16 DFA Scoreboard entries is
01760                                                          latched into the DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3] registers. */
01761     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;  /**< DFA Scoreboard LOCK Strobe
01762                                                          *FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY*
01763                                                          DFA Scoreboard debug control
01764                                                          When written with a '1', the DFA Scoreboard Debug
01765                                                          registers (DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3]) are all locked down.
01766                                                          This allows SW to lock down the contents of the entire
01767                                                          SBD for a single instant in time. All subsequent reads
01768                                                          of the DFA scoreboard registers will return the data
01769                                                          from that instant in time. */
01770     uint64_t reserved_3_4                 : 2;
01771     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRP Arbiter Mode
01772                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=WQF,DFF,HP=RGF]/1=RR
01773                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01774                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
01775     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRQ Arbiter Mode
01776                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=IRF,RWF,PRF,HP=GRF]/1=RR
01777                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01778                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
01779     uint64_t imode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-Inbound Arbiter
01780                                                          (0=FP [LP=NRQ,HP=NRP], 1=RR)
01781                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
01782                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
01783 #else
01784     uint64_t imode                        : 1;
01785     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;
01786     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;
01787     uint64_t reserved_3_4                 : 2;
01788     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;
01789     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 4;
01790     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01791 #endif
01792     } cn61xx;
01793     struct cvmx_dfa_control_cn61xx        cn63xx;
01794     struct cvmx_dfa_control_cn61xx        cn63xxp1;
01795     struct cvmx_dfa_control_cn61xx        cn66xx;
01796     struct cvmx_dfa_control_s             cn68xx;
01797     struct cvmx_dfa_control_s             cn68xxp1;
01798     struct cvmx_dfa_control_cn61xx        cn70xx;
01799     struct cvmx_dfa_control_cn61xx        cn70xxp1;
01800     struct cvmx_dfa_control_s             cn73xx;
01801     struct cvmx_dfa_control_s             cn78xx;
01802     struct cvmx_dfa_control_s             cn78xxp1;
01803 };
01804 typedef union cvmx_dfa_control cvmx_dfa_control_t;
01805 
01806 /**
01807  * cvmx_dfa_dbell
01808  *
01809  * To write to DFA_DBELL, a device issues an IOBST request directed at the HFA with addr[34:33] =
01810  * 0x0. To read DFA_DBELL, a device issues an IOBLD64 request directed at the HFA with
01811  * addr[34:33] = 0x0.
01812  *
01813  * If DFA_CONFIG[DTECLKDIS] = 1 (i.e. HFA-HTE clocks are disabled) or if FUSE[90]= 'HFA HTE
01814  * disable' is blown, read/write operations to DFA_DBELL do not take effect.
01815  */
01816 union cvmx_dfa_dbell {
01817     uint64_t u64;
01818     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s {
01819 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01820     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
01821     uint64_t dbell                        : 20; /**< Represents the cumulative total of pending HFA instructions that software has previously
01822                                                          written into the HFA instruction FIFO (DIF) in main memory. Each HFA instruction contains
01823                                                          a fixed size 64-byte instruction word which is executed by the HFA hardware.
01824                                                          The DBL register can hold up to 1M-1 (2^20-1) pending HFA instruction requests. During a
01825                                                          read (by software), the 'most recent' contents of the DFA_DBELL register are returned at
01826                                                          the time the IOI-INB bus is driven.
01827                                                          Since HFA hardware updates this register, its contents are unpredictable in software. */
01828 #else
01829     uint64_t dbell                        : 20;
01830     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
01831 #endif
01832     } s;
01833     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn31xx;
01834     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn38xx;
01835     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn38xxp2;
01836     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn58xx;
01837     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn58xxp1;
01838     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn61xx;
01839     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn63xx;
01840     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn63xxp1;
01841     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn66xx;
01842     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn68xx;
01843     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn68xxp1;
01844     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn70xx;
01845     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn70xxp1;
01846     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn73xx;
01847     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn78xx;
01848     struct cvmx_dfa_dbell_s               cn78xxp1;
01849 };
01850 typedef union cvmx_dfa_dbell cvmx_dfa_dbell_t;
01851 
01852 /**
01853  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_addr
01854  *
01855  * DFA_DDR2_ADDR = DFA DDR2  fclk-domain Memory Address Config Register
01856  *
01857  *
01858  * Description: The following registers are used to compose the DFA's DDR2 address into ROW/COL/BNK
01859  *              etc.
01860  */
01861 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_addr {
01862     uint64_t u64;
01863     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_addr_s {
01864 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01865     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01866     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;  /**< If there is a need to insert a register chip on the
01867                                                          system (the equivalent of a registered DIMM) to
01868                                                          provide better setup for the command and control bits
01869                                                          turn this mode on.
01870                                                              RDIMM_ENA
01871                                                                 0           Registered Mode OFF
01872                                                                 1           Registered Mode ON */
01873     uint64_t num_rnks                     : 2;  /**< NUM_RNKS is programmed based on how many ranks there
01874                                                          are in the system. This needs to be programmed correctly
01875                                                          regardless of whether we are in RNK_LO mode or not.
01876                                                             NUM_RNKS     \# of Ranks
01877                                                               0              1
01878                                                               1              2
01879                                                               2              4
01880                                                               3              RESERVED */
01881     uint64_t rnk_lo                       : 1;  /**< When this mode is turned on, consecutive addresses
01882                                                          outside the bank boundary
01883                                                          are programmed to go to different ranks in order to
01884                                                          minimize bank conflicts. It is useful in 4-bank DDR2
01885                                                          parts based memory to extend out the \#physical banks
01886                                                          available and minimize bank conflicts.
01887                                                          On 8 bank ddr2 parts, this mode is not very useful
01888                                                          because this mode does come with
01889                                                          a penalty which is that every successive reads that
