01890                                                          cross rank boundary will need a 1 cycle bubble
01891                                                          inserted to prevent bus turnaround conflicts.
01892                                                             RNK_LO
01893                                                              0      - OFF
01894                                                              1      - ON */
01895     uint64_t num_colrows                  : 3;  /**< NUM_COLROWS    is used to set the MSB of the ROW_ADDR
01896                                                          and the LSB of RANK address when not in RNK_LO mode.
01897                                                          Calculate the sum of \#COL and \#ROW and program the
01898                                                          controller appropriately
01899                                                             RANK_LSB        \#COLs + \#ROWs
01900                                                             ------------------------------
01901                                                              - 000:                   22
01902                                                              - 001:                   23
01903                                                              - 010:                   24
01904                                                              - 011:                   25
01905                                                             - 100-111:             RESERVED */
01906     uint64_t num_cols                     : 2;  /**< The Long word address that the controller receives
01907                                                          needs to be converted to Row, Col, Rank and Bank
01908                                                          addresses depending on the memory part's micro arch.
01909                                                          NUM_COL tells the controller how many colum bits
01910                                                          there are and the controller uses this info to map
01911                                                          the LSB of the row address
01912                                                              - 00: num_cols = 9
01913                                                              - 01: num_cols = 10
01914                                                              - 10: num_cols = 11
01915                                                              - 11: RESERVED */
01916 #else
01917     uint64_t num_cols                     : 2;
01918     uint64_t num_colrows                  : 3;
01919     uint64_t rnk_lo                       : 1;
01920     uint64_t num_rnks                     : 2;
01921     uint64_t rdimm_ena                    : 1;
01922     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01923 #endif
01924     } s;
01925     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_addr_s           cn31xx;
01926 };
01927 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_addr cvmx_dfa_ddr2_addr_t;
01928 
01929 /**
01930  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_bus
01931  *
01932  * DFA_DDR2_BUS = DFA DDR Bus Activity Counter
01933  *
01934  *
01935  * Description: This counter counts \# cycles that the memory bus is doing a read/write/command
01936  *              Useful to benchmark the bus utilization as a ratio of
01937  *              \#Cycles of Data Transfer/\#Cycles since init or
01938  *              \#Cycles of Data Transfer/\#Cycles that memory controller is active
01939  */
01940 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_bus {
01941     uint64_t u64;
01942     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_bus_s {
01943 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01944     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
01945     uint64_t bus_cnt                      : 47; /**< Counter counts the \# cycles of Data transfer */
01946 #else
01947     uint64_t bus_cnt                      : 47;
01948     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
01949 #endif
01950     } s;
01951     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_bus_s            cn31xx;
01952 };
01953 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_bus cvmx_dfa_ddr2_bus_t;
01954 
01955 /**
01956  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_cfg
01957  *
01958  * DFA_DDR2_CFG = DFA DDR2 fclk-domain Memory Configuration \#0 Register
01959  *
01960  * Description:
01961  */
01962 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_cfg {
01963     uint64_t u64;
01964     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_cfg_s {
01965 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01966     uint64_t reserved_41_63               : 23;
01967     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< Establishes tRFC(from DDR2 data sheets) in \# of
01968                                                          4 fclk intervals.
01969                                                          General Equation:
01970                                                          TRFC(csr) = ROUNDUP[tRFC(data-sheet-ns)/(4 * fclk(ns))]
01971                                                          Example:
01972                                                             tRFC(data-sheet-ns) = 127.5ns
01973                                                             Operational Frequency: 533MHz DDR rate
01974                                                                 [fclk=266MHz(3.75ns)]
01975                                                          Then:
01976                                                             TRFC(csr) = ROUNDUP[127.5ns/(4 * 3.75ns)]
01977                                                                       = 9 */
01978     uint64_t mrs_pgm                      : 1;  /**< When clear, the HW initialization sequence fixes
01979                                                          some of the *MRS register bit definitions.
01980                                                             EMRS:
01981                                                               A[14:13] = 0 RESERVED
01982                                                               A[12] = 0    Output Buffers Enabled (FIXED)
01983                                                               A[11] = 0    RDQS Disabled (FIXED)
01984                                                               A[10] = 0    DQSn Enabled (FIXED)
01985                                                               A[9:7] = 0   OCD Not supported (FIXED)
01986                                                               A[6] = 0     RTT Disabled (FIXED)
01987                                                               A[5:3]=DFA_DDR2_TMG[ADDLAT] (if DFA_DDR2_TMG[POCAS]=1)
01988                                                                             Additive LATENCY (Programmable)
01989                                                               A[2]=0       RTT Disabled (FIXED)
01990                                                               A[1]=DFA_DDR2_TMG[DIC] (Programmable)
01991                                                               A[0] = 0     DLL Enabled (FIXED)
01992                                                             MRS:
01993                                                               A[14:13] = 0 RESERVED
01994                                                               A[12] = 0    Fast Active Power Down Mode (FIXED)
01995                                                               A[11:9] = DFA_DDR2_TMG[TWR](Programmable)
01996                                                               A[8] = 1     DLL Reset (FIXED)
01997                                                               A[7] = 0     Test Mode (FIXED)
01998                                                               A[6:4]=DFA_DDR2_TMG[CASLAT] CAS LATENCY (Programmable)
01999                                                               A[3] = 0     Burst Type(must be 0:Sequential) (FIXED)
02000                                                               A[2:0] = 2   Burst Length=4 (must be 0:Sequential) (FIXED)
02001                                                          When set, the HW initialization sequence sources
02002                                                          the DFA_DDR2_MRS, DFA_DDR2_EMRS registers which are
02003                                                          driven onto the DFA_A[] pins. (this allows the MRS/EMRS
02004                                                          fields to be completely programmable - however care
02005                                                          must be taken by software).
02006                                                          This mode is useful for customers who wish to:
02007                                                             1) override the FIXED definitions(above), or
02008                                                             2) Use a "clamshell mode" of operation where the
02009                                                                address bits(per rank) are swizzled on the
02010                                                                board to reduce stub lengths for optimal
02011                                                                frequency operation.
02012                                                          Use this in combination with DFA_DDR2_CFG[RNK_MSK]
02013                                                          to specify the INIT sequence for each of the 4
02014                                                          supported ranks. */
02015     uint64_t fpip                         : 3;  /**< Early Fill Programmable Pipe [\#fclks]
02016                                                          This field dictates the \#fclks prior to the arrival
02017                                                          of fill data(in fclk domain), to start the 'early' fill
02018                                                          command pipe (in the eclk domain) so as to minimize the
02019                                                          overall fill latency.
02020                                                          The programmable early fill command signal is synchronized
02021                                                          into the eclk domain, where it is used to pull data out of
02022                                                          asynchronous RAM as fast as possible.
02023                                                          NOTE: A value of FPIP=0 is the 'safest' setting and will
02024                                                          result in the early fill command pipe starting in the
02025                                                          same cycle as the fill data.
02026                                                          General Equation: (for FPIP)
02027                                                              FPIP <= MIN[6, (ROUND_DOWN[6/EF_RATIO] + 1)]
02028                                                          where:
02029                                                            EF_RATIO = ECLK/FCLK Ratio [eclk(MHz)/fclk(MHz)]
02030                                                          Example: FCLK=200MHz/ECLK=600MHz
02031                                                             FPIP = MIN[6, (ROUND_DOWN[6/(600/200))] + 1)]
02032                                                             FPIP <= 3 */
02033     uint64_t reserved_29_31               : 3;
02034     uint64_t ref_int                      : 13; /**< Refresh Interval (represented in \#of fclk
02035                                                          increments).
02036                                                          Each refresh interval will generate a single
02037                                                          auto-refresh command sequence which implicitly targets
02038                                                          all banks within the device:
02039                                                          Example: For fclk=200MHz(5ns)/400MHz(DDR):
02040                                                            trefint(ns) = [tREFI(max)=3.9us = 3900ns [datasheet]
02041                                                            REF_INT = ROUND_DOWN[(trefint/fclk)]
02042                                                                    = ROUND_DOWN[(3900ns/5ns)]
02043                                                                    = 780 fclks (0x30c)
02044                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
02045                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
02046     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
02047     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< Board Skew (represented in \#fclks)
02048                                                          Represents additional board skew of DQ/DQS.
02049                                                              - 00: board-skew = 0 fclk
02050                                                              - 01: board-skew = 1 fclk
02051                                                              - 10: board-skew = 2 fclk
02052                                                              - 11: board-skew = 3 fclk
02053                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
02054                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
02055     uint64_t rnk_msk                      : 4;  /**< Controls the CS_N[3:0] during a) a HW Initialization
02056                                                          sequence (triggered by DFA_DDR2_CFG[INIT]) or
02057                                                          b) during a normal refresh sequence. If
02058                                                          the RNK_MSK[x]=1, the corresponding CS_N[x] is driven.
02059                                                          NOTE: This is required for DRAM used in a
02060                                                          clamshell configuration, since the address lines
02061                                                          carry Mode Register write data that is unique
02062                                                          per rank(or clam). In a clamshell configuration,
02063                                                          the N3K DFA_A[x] pin may be tied into Clam#0's A[x]
02064                                                          and also into Clam#1's 'mirrored' address bit A[y]
02065                                                          (eg: Clam0 sees A[5] and Clam1 sees A[15]).
02066                                                          To support clamshell designs, SW must initiate
02067                                                          separate HW init sequences each unique rank address
02068                                                          mapping. Before each HW init sequence is triggered,
02069                                                          SW must preload the DFA_DDR2_MRS/EMRS registers with
02070                                                          the data that will be driven onto the A[14:0] wires
02071                                                          during the EMRS/MRS mode register write(s).
02072                                                          NOTE: After the final HW initialization sequence has
02073                                                          been triggered, SW must wait 64K eclks before writing
02074                                                          the RNK_MSK[3:0] field = 3'b1111 (so that CS_N[3:0]
02075                                                          is driven during refresh sequences in normal operation.
02076                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
02077                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
02078     uint64_t silo_qc                      : 1;  /**< Enables Quarter Cycle move of the Rd sampling window */
02079     uint64_t silo_hc                      : 1;  /**< A combination of SILO_HC, SILO_QC and TSKW
02080                                                          specifies the positioning of the sampling strobe
02081                                                          when receiving read data back from DDR2. This is
02082                                                          done to offset any board trace induced delay on
02083                                                          the DQ and DQS which inherently makes these
02084                                                          asynchronous with respect to the internal clk of
02085                                                          controller. TSKW moves this sampling window by
02086                                                          integer cycles. SILO_QC and HC move this quarter
02087                                                          and half a cycle respectively. */
02088     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< Silo Latency (\#fclks): On reads, determines how many
02089                                                          additional fclks to wait (on top of CASLAT+1) before
02090                                                          pulling data out of the padring silos used for time
02091                                                          domain boundary crossing.
02092                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
02093                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
02094     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;  /**< Tristate Enable (back porch) (\#fclks)
02095                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
02096                                                          tristate disable back porch for the DQ data bus.
02097                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
02098                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
02099                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
02100                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
02101                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
02102                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
02103     uint64_t fprch                        : 1;  /**< Tristate Enable (front porch) (\#fclks)
02104                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
02105                                                          tristate disable front porch for the DQ data bus.
02106                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
02107                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
02108                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
02109                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
02110                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
02111                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
02112     uint64_t init                         : 1;  /**< When a '1' is written (and the previous value was '0'),
02113                                                          the HW init sequence(s) for the LLM Memory Port is
02114                                                          initiated.
02115                                                          NOTE: To initialize memory, SW must:
02116                                                            1) Enable memory port
02117                                                                a) PRTENA=1
02118                                                            2) Wait 200us (to ensure a stable clock
02119                                                               to the DDR2) - as per DDR2 spec.
02120                                                            3) Write a '1' to the INIT which
02121                                                               will initiate a hardware initialization
02122                                                               sequence.
02123                                                          NOTE: After writing a '1', SW must wait 64K eclk
02124                                                          cycles to ensure the HW init sequence has completed
02125                                                          before writing to ANY of the DFA_DDR2* registers.
02126                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
02127                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
02128     uint64_t prtena                       : 1;  /**< Enable DFA Memory
02129                                                          When enabled, this bit lets N3K be the default
02130                                                          driver for DFA-LLM memory port. */
02131 #else
02132     uint64_t prtena                       : 1;
02133     uint64_t init                         : 1;
02134     uint64_t fprch                        : 1;
02135     uint64_t bprch                        : 1;
02136     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
02137     uint64_t silo_hc                      : 1;
02138     uint64_t silo_qc                      : 1;
02139     uint64_t rnk_msk                      : 4;
02140     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
02141     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
02142     uint64_t ref_int                      : 13;
02143     uint64_t reserved_29_31               : 3;
02144     uint64_t fpip                         : 3;
02145     uint64_t mrs_pgm                      : 1;
02146     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;
02147     uint64_t reserved_41_63               : 23;
02148 #endif
02149     } s;
02150     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_cfg_s            cn31xx;
02151 };
02152 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_cfg cvmx_dfa_ddr2_cfg_t;
02153 
02154 /**
02155  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_comp
02156  *
02157  * DFA_DDR2_COMP = DFA DDR2 I/O PVT Compensation Configuration
02158  *
02159  *
02160  * Description: The following are registers to program the DDR2 PLL and DLL
02161  */
02162 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_comp {
02163     uint64_t u64;
02164     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_comp_s {
02165 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02166     uint64_t dfa__pctl                    : 4;  /**< DFA DDR pctl from compensation circuit
02167                                                          Internal DBG only */
02168     uint64_t dfa__nctl                    : 4;  /**< DFA DDR nctl from compensation circuit
02169                                                          Internal DBG only */
02170     uint64_t reserved_9_55                : 47;
02171     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02172     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
02173     uint64_t comp_bypass                  : 1;  /**< Compensation Bypass */
02174 #else
02175     uint64_t comp_bypass                  : 1;
02176     uint64_t nctl_csr                     : 4;
02177     uint64_t pctl_csr                     : 4;
02178     uint64_t reserved_9_55                : 47;
02179     uint64_t dfa__nctl                    : 4;
02180     uint64_t dfa__pctl                    : 4;
02181 #endif
02182     } s;
02183     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_comp_s           cn31xx;
02184 };
02185 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_comp cvmx_dfa_ddr2_comp_t;
02186 
02187 /**
02188  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_emrs
02189  *
02190  * DFA_DDR2_EMRS = DDR2 EMRS Register(s) EMRS1[14:0], EMRS1_OCD[14:0]
02191  * Description: This register contains the data driven onto the Address[14:0] lines during  DDR INIT
02192  * To support Clamshelling (where N3K DFA_A[] pins are not 1:1 mapped to each clam(or rank), a HW init
02193  * sequence is allowed on a "per-rank" basis. Care must be taken in the values programmed into these
02194  * registers during the HW initialization sequence (see N3K specific restrictions in notes below).
02195  * DFA_DDR2_CFG[MRS_PGM] must be 1 to support this feature.
02196  *
02197  * Notes:
02198  * For DDR-II please consult your device's data sheet for further details:
02199  *
02200  */
02201 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_emrs {
02202     uint64_t u64;
02203     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_emrs_s {
02204 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02205     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
02206     uint64_t emrs1_ocd                    : 15; /**< Memory Address[14:0] during "EMRS1 (OCD Calibration)"
02207                                                          step \#12a "EMRS OCD Default Command" A[9:7]=111
02208                                                          of DDR2 HW initialization sequence.
02209                                                          (See JEDEC DDR2 specification (JESD79-2):
02210                                                          Power Up and initialization sequence).
02211                                                             A[14:13] = 0, RESERVED
02212                                                             A[12] = 0, Output Buffers Enabled
02213                                                             A[11] = 0, RDQS Disabled (we do not support RDQS)
02214                                                             A[10] = 0, DQSn Enabled
02215                                                             A[9:7] = 7, OCD Calibration Mode Default
02216                                                             A[6] = 0, ODT Disabled
02217                                                             A[5:3]=DFA_DDR2_TMG[ADDLAT]  Additive LATENCY (Default 0)
02218                                                             A[2]=0    Termination Res RTT (ODT off Default)
02219                                                             [A6,A2] = 0 -> ODT Disabled
02220                                                                       1 -> 75 ohm; 2 -> 150 ohm; 3 - Reserved
02221                                                             A[1]=0  Normal Output Driver Imp mode
02222                                                                     (1 - weak ie., 60% of normal drive strength)
02223                                                             A[0] = 0 DLL Enabled */
02224     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
02225     uint64_t emrs1                        : 15; /**< Memory Address[14:0] during:
02226                                                            a) Step \#7 "EMRS1 to enable DLL (A[0]=0)"
02227                                                            b) Step \#12b "EMRS OCD Calibration Mode Exit"
02228                                                          steps of DDR2 HW initialization sequence.
02229                                                          (See JEDEC DDR2 specification (JESD79-2): Power Up and
02230                                                          initialization sequence).
02231                                                            A[14:13] = 0, RESERVED
02232                                                            A[12] = 0, Output Buffers Enabled
02233                                                            A[11] = 0, RDQS Disabled (we do not support RDQS)
02234                                                            A[10] = 0, DQSn Enabled
02235                                                            A[9:7] = 0, OCD Calibration Mode exit/maintain
02236                                                            A[6] = 0, ODT Disabled
02237                                                            A[5:3]=DFA_DDR2_TMG[ADDLAT]  Additive LATENCY (Default 0)
02238                                                            A[2]=0    Termination Res RTT (ODT off Default)
02239                                                            [A6,A2] = 0 -> ODT Disabled
02240                                                                      1 -> 75 ohm; 2 -> 150 ohm; 3 - Reserved
02241                                                            A[1]=0  Normal Output Driver Imp mode
02242                                                                    (1 - weak ie., 60% of normal drive strength)
02243                                                            A[0] = 0 DLL Enabled */
02244 #else
02245     uint64_t emrs1                        : 15;
02246     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
02247     uint64_t emrs1_ocd                    : 15;
02248     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
02249 #endif
02250     } s;
02251     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_emrs_s           cn31xx;
02252 };
02253 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_emrs cvmx_dfa_ddr2_emrs_t;
02254 
02255 /**
02256  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_fcnt
02257  *
02258  * DFA_DDR2_FCNT = DFA FCLK Counter
02259  *
02260  *
02261  * Description: This FCLK cycle counter gets going after memory has been initialized
02262  */
02263 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_fcnt {
02264     uint64_t u64;
02265     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_fcnt_s {
02266 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02267     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
02268     uint64_t fcyc_cnt                     : 47; /**< Counter counts FCLK cycles or \# cycles that the memory
02269                                                          controller has requests queued up depending on FCNT_MODE
02270                                                          If FCNT_MODE = 0, this counter counts the \# FCLK cycles
02271                                                          If FCNT_MODE = 1, this counter counts the \# cycles the
02272                                                          controller is active with memory requests. */
02273 #else
02274     uint64_t fcyc_cnt                     : 47;
02275     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
02276 #endif
02277     } s;
02278     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_fcnt_s           cn31xx;
02279 };
02280 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_fcnt cvmx_dfa_ddr2_fcnt_t;
02281 
02282 /**
02283  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_mrs
02284  *
02285  * DFA_DDR2_MRS = DDR2 MRS Register(s) MRS_DLL[14:0], MRS[14:0]
02286  * Description: This register contains the data driven onto the Address[14:0] lines during DDR INIT
02287  * To support Clamshelling (where N3K DFA_A[] pins are not 1:1 mapped to each clam(or rank), a HW init
02288  * sequence is allowed on a "per-rank" basis. Care must be taken in the values programmed into these
02289  * registers during the HW initialization sequence (see N3K specific restrictions in notes below).
02290  * DFA_DDR2_CFG[MRS_PGM] must be 1 to support this feature.
02291  *
02292  * Notes:
02293  * For DDR-II please consult your device's data sheet for further details:
02294  *
02295  */
02296 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_mrs {
02297     uint64_t u64;
02298     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_mrs_s {
02299 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02300     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
02301     uint64_t mrs                          : 15; /**< Memory Address[14:0] during "MRS without resetting
02302                                                          DLL A[8]=0" step of HW initialization sequence.
02303                                                          (See JEDEC DDR2 specification (JESD79-2): Power Up
02304                                                          and initialization sequence - Step \#11).
02305                                                            A[14:13] = 0, RESERVED
02306                                                            A[12] = 0, Fast Active Power Down Mode
02307                                                            A[11:9] = DFA_DDR2_TMG[TWR]
02308                                                            A[8] = 0, for DLL Reset
02309                                                            A[7] =0  Test Mode (must be 0 for normal operation)
02310                                                            A[6:4]=DFA_DDR2_TMG[CASLAT] CAS LATENCY (default 4)
02311                                                            A[3]=0    Burst Type(must be 0:Sequential)
02312                                                            A[2:0]=2  Burst Length=4(default) */
02313     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
02314     uint64_t mrs_dll                      : 15; /**< Memory Address[14:0] during "MRS for DLL_RESET A[8]=1"
02315                                                          step of HW initialization sequence.
02316                                                          (See JEDEC DDR2 specification (JESD79-2): Power Up
02317                                                          and initialization sequence - Step \#8).
02318                                                            A[14:13] = 0, RESERVED
02319                                                            A[12] = 0, Fast Active Power Down Mode
02320                                                            A[11:9] = DFA_DDR2_TMG[TWR]
02321                                                            A[8] = 1, for DLL Reset
02322                                                            A[7] = 0  Test Mode (must be 0 for normal operation)
02323                                                            A[6:4]=DFA_DDR2_TMG[CASLAT]    CAS LATENCY (default 4)
02324                                                            A[3] = 0    Burst Type(must be 0:Sequential)
02325                                                            A[2:0] = 2  Burst Length=4(default) */
02326 #else
02327     uint64_t mrs_dll                      : 15;
02328     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
02329     uint64_t mrs                          : 15;
02330     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
02331 #endif
02332     } s;
02333     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_mrs_s            cn31xx;
02334 };
02335 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_mrs cvmx_dfa_ddr2_mrs_t;
02336 
02337 /**
02338  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_opt
02339  *
02340  * DFA_DDR2_OPT = DFA DDR2 Optimization Registers
02341  *
02342  *
02343  * Description: The following are registers to tweak certain parameters to boost performance
02344  */
02345 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_opt {
02346     uint64_t u64;
02347     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_opt_s {
02348 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02349     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
02350     uint64_t max_read_batch               : 5;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive read to service before
02351                                                          allowing write to interrupt. */
02352     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 5;  /**< Maximum number of consecutive writes to service before
02353                                                          allowing reads to interrupt. */
02354 #else
02355     uint64_t max_write_batch              : 5;
02356     uint64_t max_read_batch               : 5;
02357     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
02358 #endif
02359     } s;
02360     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_opt_s            cn31xx;
02361 };
02362 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_opt cvmx_dfa_ddr2_opt_t;
02363 
02364 /**
02365  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_pll
02366  *
02367  * DFA_DDR2_PLL = DFA DDR2 PLL and DLL Configuration
02368  *
02369  *
02370  * Description: The following are registers to program the DDR2 PLL and DLL
02371  */
02372 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_pll {
02373     uint64_t u64;
02374     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_pll_s {
02375 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02376     uint64_t pll_setting                  : 17; /**< Internal Debug Use Only */
02377     uint64_t reserved_32_46               : 15;
02378     uint64_t setting90                    : 5;  /**< Contains the setting of DDR DLL; Internal DBG only */
02379     uint64_t reserved_21_26               : 6;
02380     uint64_t dll_setting                  : 5;  /**< Contains the open loop setting value for the DDR90 delay
02381                                                          line. */
02382     uint64_t dll_byp                      : 1;  /**< DLL Bypass. When set, the DDR90 DLL is bypassed and
02383                                                          the DLL behaves in Open Loop giving a fixed delay
02384                                                          set by DLL_SETTING */
02385     uint64_t qdll_ena                     : 1;  /**< DDR Quad DLL Enable: A 0->1 transition on this bit after
02386                                                          erst deassertion will reset the DDR 90 DLL. Allow
02387                                                          200 micro seconds for Lock before DDR Init. */
02388     uint64_t bw_ctl                       : 4;  /**< Internal Use Only - for Debug */
02389     uint64_t bw_upd                       : 1;  /**< Internal Use Only - for Debug */
02390     uint64_t pll_div2                     : 1;  /**< PLL Output is further divided by 2. Useful for slow
02391                                                          fclk frequencies where the PLL may be out of range. */
02392     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
02393     uint64_t pll_ratio                    : 5;  /**< Bits <6:2> sets the clk multiplication ratio
02394                                                          If the fclk frequency desired is less than 260MHz
02395                                                          (lower end saturation point of the pll), write 2x
02396                                                          the ratio desired in this register and set PLL_DIV2 */
02397     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;  /**< PLL Bypass. Uses the ref_clk without multiplication. */
02398     uint64_t pll_init                     : 1;  /**< Need a 0 to 1 pulse on this CSR to get the DFA
02399                                                          Clk Generator Started. Write this register before
02400                                                          starting anything. Allow 200 uS for PLL Lock before
02401                                                          doing anything. */
02402 #else
02403     uint64_t pll_init                     : 1;
02404     uint64_t pll_bypass                   : 1;
02405     uint64_t pll_ratio                    : 5;
02406     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
02407     uint64_t pll_div2                     : 1;
02408     uint64_t bw_upd                       : 1;
02409     uint64_t bw_ctl                       : 4;
02410     uint64_t qdll_ena                     : 1;
02411     uint64_t dll_byp                      : 1;
02412     uint64_t dll_setting                  : 5;
02413     uint64_t reserved_21_26               : 6;
02414     uint64_t setting90                    : 5;
02415     uint64_t reserved_32_46               : 15;
02416     uint64_t pll_setting                  : 17;
02417 #endif
02418     } s;
02419     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_pll_s            cn31xx;
02420 };
02421 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_pll cvmx_dfa_ddr2_pll_t;
02422 
02423 /**
02424  * cvmx_dfa_ddr2_tmg
02425  *
02426  * DFA_DDR2_TMG = DFA DDR2 Memory Timing Config Register
02427  *
02428  *
02429  * Description: The following are registers to program the DDR2 memory timing parameters.
02430  */
02431 union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_tmg {
02432     uint64_t u64;
02433     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_tmg_s {
02434 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02435     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
02436     uint64_t fcnt_mode                    : 1;  /**< If FCNT_MODE = 0, this counter counts the \# FCLK cycles
02437                                                          If FCNT_MODE = 1, this counter counts the \# cycles the
02438                                                          controller is active with memory requests. */
02439     uint64_t cnt_clr                      : 1;  /**< Clears the FCLK Cyc & Bus Util counter */
02440     uint64_t cavmipo                      : 1;  /**< RESERVED */
02441     uint64_t ctr_rst                      : 1;  /**< Reset oneshot pulse for refresh counter & Perf counters
02442                                                          SW should first write this field to a one to clear
02443                                                          & then write to a zero for normal operation */
02444     uint64_t odt_rtt                      : 2;  /**< DDR2 Termination Resistor Setting
02445                                                          These two bits are loaded into the RTT
02446                                                          portion of the EMRS register bits A6 & A2. If DDR2's
02447                                                          termination (for the memory's DQ/DQS/DM pads) is not
02448                                                          desired, set it to 00. If it is, chose between
02449                                                          01 for 75 ohm and 10 for 150 ohm termination.
02450                                                               00 = ODT Disabled
02451                                                               01 = 75 ohm Termination
02452                                                               10 = 150 ohm Termination
02453                                                               11 = 50 ohm Termination */
02454     uint64_t dqsn_ena                     : 1;  /**< For DDR-II Mode, DIC[1] is used to load into EMRS
02455                                                          bit 10 - DQSN Enable/Disable field. By default, we
02456                                                          program the DDR's to drive the DQSN also. Set it to
02457                                                          1 if DQSN should be Hi-Z.
02458                                                               0 - DQSN Enable
02459                                                               1 - DQSN Disable */
02460     uint64_t dic                          : 1;  /**< Drive Strength Control:
02461                                                          For DDR-I/II Mode, DIC[0] is
02462                                                          loaded into the Extended Mode Register (EMRS) A1 bit
02463                                                          during initialization. (see DDR-I data sheet EMRS
02464                                                          description)
02465                                                               0 = Normal
02466                                                               1 = Reduced */
02467     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;  /**< A 1 on this register will force the controller to
02468                                                          slot a bubble between every reads */
02469     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;  /**< tFAW - Cycles = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/tcyc(ns)] - 1
02470                                                          Four Access Window time. Relevant only in
02471                                                          8-bank parts.
02472                                                               TFAW = 5'b0 for DDR2-4bank
02473                                                               TFAW = RNDUP[tFAW(ns)/tcyc(ns)] - 1 in DDR2-8bank */
02474     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;  /**< tWTR Cycles = RNDUP[tWTR(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
02475                                                          Last Wr Data to Rd Command time.
02476                                                          (Represented in fclk cycles)
02477                                                          TYP=15ns
02478                                                               - 0000: RESERVED
02479                                                               - 0001: 1
02480                                                               - ...
02481                                                               - 0111: 7
02482                                                               - 1000-1111: RESERVED */
02483     uint64_t twr                          : 3;  /**< DDR Write Recovery time (tWR). Last Wr Brst to Prech
02484                                                          This is not a direct encoding of the value. Its
02485                                                          programmed as below per DDR2 spec. The decimal number
02486                                                          on the right is RNDUP(tWR(ns) / clkFreq)
02487                                                          TYP=15ns
02488                                                               - 000: RESERVED
02489                                                               - 001: 2
02490                                                               - 010: 3
02491                                                               - 011: 4
02492                                                               - 100: 5
02493                                                               - 101: 6
02494                                                               - 110-111: RESERVED */
02495     uint64_t trp                          : 4;  /**< tRP Cycles = RNDUP[tRP(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
02496                                                          (Represented in fclk cycles)
02497                                                          TYP=15ns
02498                                                               - 0000: RESERVED
02499                                                               - 0001: 1
02500                                                               - ...
02501                                                               - 0111: 7
02502                                                               - 1000-1111: RESERVED
02503                                                          When using parts with 8 banks (DFA_CFG->MAX_BNK
02504                                                          is 1), load tRP cycles + 1 into this register. */
02505     uint64_t tras                         : 5;  /**< tRAS Cycles = RNDUP[tRAS(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
02506                                                          (Represented in fclk cycles)
02507                                                          TYP=45ns
02508                                                               - 00000-0001: RESERVED
02509                                                               - 00010: 2
02510                                                               - ...
02511                                                               - 10100: 20
02512                                                               - 10101-11111: RESERVED */
02513     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;  /**< tRRD cycles: ACT-ACT timing parameter for different
02514                                                          banks. (Represented in fclk cycles)
02515                                                          For DDR2, TYP=7.5ns
02516                                                              - 000: RESERVED
02517                                                              - 001: 1 tCYC
02518                                                              - 010: 2 tCYC
02519                                                              - 011: 3 tCYC
02520                                                              - 100: 4 tCYC
02521                                                              - 101: 5 tCYC
02522                                                              - 110-111: RESERVED */
02523     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;  /**< tRCD Cycles = RNDUP[tRCD(ns)/tcyc(ns)]
02524                                                          (Represented in fclk cycles)
02525                                                          TYP=15ns
02526                                                               - 0000: RESERVED
02527                                                               - 0001: 2 (2 is the smallest value allowed)
02528                                                               - 0002: 2
02529                                                               - ...
02530                                                               - 0111: 7
02531                                                               - 1110-1111: RESERVED */
02532     uint64_t addlat                       : 3;  /**< When in Posted CAS mode ADDLAT needs to be programmed
02533                                                          to tRCD-1
02534                                                                ADDLAT         \#additional latency cycles
02535                                                                 000              0
02536                                                                 001              1 (tRCD = 2 fclk's)
02537                                                                 010              2 (tRCD = 3 fclk's)
02538                                                                 011              3 (tRCD = 4 fclk's)
02539                                                                 100              4 (tRCD = 5 fclk's)
02540                                                                 101              5 (tRCD = 6 fclk's)
02541                                                                 110              6 (tRCD = 7 fclk's)
02542                                                                 111              7 (tRCD = 8 fclk's) */
02543     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;  /**< Posted CAS mode. When 1, we use DDR2's Posted CAS
02544                                                          feature. When using this mode, ADDLAT needs to be
02545                                                          programmed as well */
02546     uint64_t caslat                       : 3;  /**< CAS Latency in \# fclk Cycles
02547                                                          CASLAT           \#  CAS latency cycles
02548                                                           000 - 010           RESERVED
02549                                                           011                    3
02550                                                           100                    4
02551                                                           101                    5
02552                                                           110                    6
02553                                                           111                    7 */
02554     uint64_t tmrd                         : 2;  /**< tMRD Cycles
02555                                                          (Represented in fclk tCYC)
02556                                                          For DDR2, its TYP 2*tCYC)
02557                                                              - 000: RESERVED
02558                                                              - 001: 1
02559                                                              - 010: 2
02560                                                              - 011: 3 */
02561     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;  /**< When 2T mode is turned on, command signals are
02562                                                          setup a cycle ahead of when the CS is enabled
02563                                                          and kept for a total of 2 cycles. This mode is
02564                                                          enabled in higher speeds when there is difficulty
02565                                                          meeting setup. Performance could
02566                                                          be negatively affected in 2T mode */
02567 #else
02568     uint64_t ddr2t                        : 1;
02569     uint64_t tmrd                         : 2;
02570     uint64_t caslat                       : 3;
02571     uint64_t pocas                        : 1;
02572     uint64_t addlat                       : 3;
02573     uint64_t trcd                         : 4;
02574     uint64_t trrd                         : 3;
02575     uint64_t tras                         : 5;
02576     uint64_t trp                          : 4;
02577     uint64_t twr                          : 3;
02578     uint64_t twtr                         : 4;
02579     uint64_t tfaw                         : 5;
02580     uint64_t r2r_slot                     : 1;
02581     uint64_t dic                          : 1;
02582     uint64_t dqsn_ena                     : 1;
02583     uint64_t odt_rtt                      : 2;
02584     uint64_t ctr_rst                      : 1;
02585     uint64_t cavmipo                      : 1;
02586     uint64_t cnt_clr                      : 1;
02587     uint64_t fcnt_mode                    : 1;
02588     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
02589 #endif
02590     } s;
02591     struct cvmx_dfa_ddr2_tmg_s            cn31xx;
02592 };
02593 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ddr2_tmg cvmx_dfa_ddr2_tmg_t;
02594 
02595 /**
02596  * cvmx_dfa_debug0
02597  *
02598  * When the DFA_CONTROL[SBDLCK] bit is written '1', the contents of this register are locked
02599  * down. Otherwise, the contents of this register are the 'active' contents of the DFA Scoreboard
02600  * at the time of the CSR read operation.
02601  * VERIFICATION NOTE: Read data is unsafe. X's (undefined data) can propagate (in the behavioral
02602  * model) on the read operations unless the DTE Engine specified by DFA_CONTROL[SBDNUM] has
02603  * previously been assigned an instruction.
02604  */
02605 union cvmx_dfa_debug0 {
02606     uint64_t u64;
02607     struct cvmx_dfa_debug0_s {
02608 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02609     uint64_t sbd0                         : 64; /**< DFA ScoreBoard 0 Data (DFA Scoreboard Debug). */
02610 #else
02611     uint64_t sbd0                         : 64;
02612 #endif
02613     } s;
02614     struct cvmx_dfa_debug0_s              cn73xx;
02615     struct cvmx_dfa_debug0_s              cn78xx;
02616     struct cvmx_dfa_debug0_s              cn78xxp1;
02617 };
02618 typedef union cvmx_dfa_debug0 cvmx_dfa_debug0_t;
02619 
02620 /**
02621  * cvmx_dfa_debug1
02622  *
02623  * When the DFA_CONTROL[SBDLCK] bit is written '1', the contents of this register are locked
02624  * down. Otherwise, the contents of this register are the 'active' contents of the DFA Scoreboard
02625  * at the time of the CSR read operation.
02626  * VERIFICATION NOTE: Read data is unsafe. X's(undefined data) can propagate (in the behavioral
02627  * model) on the read operations unless the DTE Engine specified by DFA_CONTROL[SBDNUM] has
02628  * previously been assigned an instruction.
02629  */
02630 union cvmx_dfa_debug1 {
02631     uint64_t u64;
02632     struct cvmx_dfa_debug1_s {
02633 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02634     uint64_t sbd1                         : 64; /**< Scoreboard 1 debug data.
02635                                                          [63:56] = Reserved.
02636                                                          [55:16] = Packet data pointer.
02637                                                          [15:0] = Packet data counter. */
02638 #else
02639     uint64_t sbd1                         : 64;
02640 #endif
02641     } s;
02642     struct cvmx_dfa_debug1_s              cn73xx;
02643     struct cvmx_dfa_debug1_s              cn78xx;
02644     struct cvmx_dfa_debug1_s              cn78xxp1;
02645 };
02646 typedef union cvmx_dfa_debug1 cvmx_dfa_debug1_t;
02647 
02648 /**
02649  * cvmx_dfa_debug2
02650  *
02651  * When DFA_CONTROL[SBDLCK] is written to 1, the contents of this register are locked
02652  * down. Otherwise, the contents of this register are the active contents of the HFA
02653  * scoreboard at the time of the CSR read operation.
02654  *
02655  * VERIFICATION NOTE: Read data is unsafe. X's(undefined data) can propagate (in the
02656  * behavioral model) on the read operations unless the DTE Engine specified by
02657  * DFA_CONTROL[SBDNUM] has previously been assigned an instruction.
02658  */
02659 union cvmx_dfa_debug2 {
02660     uint64_t u64;
02661     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s {
02662 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02663     uint64_t sbd2                         : 64; /**< HFA scoreboard 2 data.
02664                                                          <63:45> = Reserved.
02665                                                          <44:42> = Instruction type.
02666                                                          <41:5> = Result write pointer.
02667                                                          <4:0> = Pending result write counter. */
02668 #else
02669     uint64_t sbd2                         : 64;
02670 #endif
02671     } s;
02672     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn61xx;
02673     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn63xx;
02674     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn63xxp1;
02675     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn66xx;
02676     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn68xx;
02677     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn68xxp1;
02678     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn70xx;
02679     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn70xxp1;
02680     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn73xx;
02681     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn78xx;
02682     struct cvmx_dfa_debug2_s              cn78xxp1;
02683 };
02684 typedef union cvmx_dfa_debug2 cvmx_dfa_debug2_t;
02685 
02686 /**
02687  * cvmx_dfa_debug3
02688  *
02689  * When DFA_CONTROL[SBDLCK] is written to 1, the contents of this register are locked down.
02690  * Otherwise, the contents of this register are the active contents of the HFA Scoreboard at the
02691  * time of the CSR read operation. VERIFICATION NOTE: Read data is unsafe. X's(undefined data)
02692  * can
02693  * propagate (in the behavioral model) on the read operations unless the DTE Engine specified by
02694  * DFA_CONTROL[SBDNUM] has previously been assigned an instruction.
02695  */
02696 union cvmx_dfa_debug3 {
02697     uint64_t u64;
02698     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s {
02699 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02700     uint64_t sbd3                         : 64; /**< HFA scoreboard 3 data.
02701                                                          <63:52> = rptr<39:29>: Result base pointer (QW-aligned).
02702                                                          <52:16> = glptr<39:3>: Gather list pointer.
02703                                                          <15:0> = glcnt Gather list counter. */
02704 #else
02705     uint64_t sbd3                         : 64;
02706 #endif
02707     } s;
02708     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn61xx;
02709     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn63xx;
02710     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn63xxp1;
02711     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn66xx;
02712     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn68xx;
02713     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn68xxp1;
02714     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn70xx;
02715     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn70xxp1;
02716     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn73xx;
02717     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn78xx;
02718     struct cvmx_dfa_debug3_s              cn78xxp1;
02719 };
02720 typedef union cvmx_dfa_debug3 cvmx_dfa_debug3_t;
02721 
02722 /**
02723  * cvmx_dfa_difctl
02724  *
02725  * To write to DFA_DIFCTL, a device issues an IOBST request directed at the HFA with addr[34:32]
02726  * = 0x6. To read DFA_DIFCTL, a device issues an IOBLD64 request directed at the HFA with
02727  * addr[34:32] = 0x6. This register is intended to only be written once (at power-up). Any future
02728  * write operations could cause the HFA and FPA hardware to become unpredictable.
02729  *
02730  * If DFA_CONFIG[DTECLKDIS] = 1 (i.e. HFA-HTE clocks are disabled) or if FUSE[90] = 'HFA HTE
02731  * disable' is blown, read/write operations to DFA_DIFCTL do not take effect.
02732  */
02733 union cvmx_dfa_difctl {
02734     uint64_t u64;
02735     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_s {
02736 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02737     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
02738     uint64_t aura                         : 16; /**< Represents the 16-bit aura ID used by HFA hardware when the HFA instruction chunk is
02739                                                          recycled back to the free page list maintained by the FPA hardware (once the HFA
02740                                                          instruction has been issued). */
02741     uint64_t msegbase                     : 6;  /**< Reserved. */
02742     uint64_t reserved_12_19               : 8;
02743     uint64_t pool                         : 3;  /**< Represents the 3bit buffer pool-id  used by DFA HW
02744                                                          when the DFA instruction chunk is recycled back
02745                                                          to the Free Page List maintained by the FPA HW
02746                                                          (once the DFA instruction has been issued). */
02747     uint64_t size                         : 9;  /**< Represents the number of 64-byte instructions contained within each HFA instruction chunk.
02748                                                          At power-on, software seeds the SIZE register with a fixed chunk-size (must be at least
02749                                                          0x3). HFA hardware uses this field to determine the size of each HFA instruction chunk, in
02750                                                          order to:
02751                                                          a) determine when to read the next HFA instruction chunk pointer which is written by
02752                                                          software at the end of the current HFA instruction chunk (see HFA description of next
02753                                                          chunk buffer Ptr for format).
02754                                                          b) determine when a HFA instruction chunk can be returned to the free page list maintained
02755                                                          by the FPA hardware. */
02756 #else
02757     uint64_t size                         : 9;
02758     uint64_t pool                         : 3;
02759     uint64_t reserved_12_19               : 8;
02760     uint64_t msegbase                     : 6;
02761     uint64_t aura                         : 16;
02762     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
02763 #endif
02764     } s;
02765     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx {
02766 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02767     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
02768     uint64_t dwbcnt                       : 8;  /**< Represents the \# of cache lines in the instruction
02769                                                          buffer that may be dirty and should not be
02770                                                          written-back to memory when the instruction
02771                                                          chunk is returned to the Free Page list.
02772                                                          NOTE: Typically SW will want to mark all DFA
02773                                                          Instruction memory returned to the Free Page list
02774                                                          as DWB (Don't WriteBack), therefore SW should
02775                                                          seed this register as:
02776                                                            DFA_DIFCTL[DWBCNT] = (DFA_DIFCTL[SIZE] + 4)/4 */
02777     uint64_t pool                         : 3;  /**< Represents the 3bit buffer pool-id  used by DFA HW
02778                                                          when the DFA instruction chunk is recycled back
02779                                                          to the Free Page List maintained by the FPA HW
02780                                                          (once the DFA instruction has been issued). */
02781     uint64_t size                         : 9;  /**< Represents the \# of 32B instructions contained
02782                                                          within each DFA instruction chunk. At Power-on,
02783                                                          SW will seed the SIZE register with a fixed
02784                                                          chunk-size. (Must be at least 3)
02785                                                          DFA HW uses this field to determine the size
02786                                                          of each DFA instruction chunk, in order to:
02787                                                             a) determine when to read the next DFA
02788                                                                instruction chunk pointer which is
02789                                                                written by SW at the end of the current
02790                                                                DFA instruction chunk (see DFA description
02791                                                                of next chunk buffer Ptr for format).
02792                                                             b) determine when a DFA instruction chunk
02793                                                                can be returned to the Free Page List
02794                                                                maintained by the FPA HW. */
02795 #else
02796     uint64_t size                         : 9;
02797     uint64_t pool                         : 3;
02798     uint64_t dwbcnt                       : 8;
02799     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
02800 #endif
02801     } cn31xx;
02802     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx         cn38xx;
02803     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx         cn38xxp2;
02804     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx         cn58xx;
02805     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx         cn58xxp1;
02806     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn61xx {
02807 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02808     uint64_t reserved_26_63               : 38;
02809     uint64_t msegbase                     : 6;  /**< Memory Segmentation Base Address
02810                                                          For debug purposes, backdoor accesses to the DFA
02811                                                          memory are supported via NCB-Direct CSR accesses to
02812                                                          the DFA Memory REGION(if addr[34:32]=5. However due
02813                                                          to the existing NCB address decoding scheme, the
02814                                                          address only offers a 4GB extent into the DFA memory
02815                                                          REGION. Therefore, the MSEGBASE CSR field provides
02816                                                          the additional upper memory address bits to allow access
02817                                                          to the full extent of memory (128GB MAX).
02818                                                          For DFA Memory REGION read NCB-Direct CSR accesses, the
02819                                                          38bit L2/DRAM memory byte address is generated as follows:
02820                                                            memaddr[37:0] = [DFA_DIFCTL[MSEGBASE],ncb_addr[31:3],3'b0]
02821                                                          NOTE: See the upper 6bits of the memory address are sourced
02822                                                          from DFA_DIFCTL[MSEGBASE] CSR field. The lower 4GB address
02823                                                          offset is directly referenced using the NCB address bits during
02824                                                          the reference itself.
02825                                                          NOTE: The DFA_DIFCTL[MSEGBASE] is shared amongst all references.
02826                                                          As such, if multiple PPs are accessing different segments in memory,
02827                                                          their must be a SW mutual exclusive lock during each DFA Memory
02828                                                          REGION access to avoid collisions between PPs using the same MSEGBASE
02829                                                          CSR field.
02830                                                          NOTE: See also DFA_ERROR[DFANXM] programmable interrupt which is
02831                                                          flagged if SW tries to access non-existent memory space (address hole
02832                                                          or upper unused region of 38bit address space). */
02833     uint64_t dwbcnt                       : 8;  /**< Represents the \# of cache lines in the instruction
02834                                                          buffer that may be dirty and should not be
02835                                                          written-back to memory when the instruction
02836                                                          chunk is returned to the Free Page list.
02837                                                          NOTE: Typically SW will want to mark all DFA
02838                                                          Instruction memory returned to the Free Page list
02839                                                          as DWB (Don't WriteBack), therefore SW should
02840                                                          seed this register as:
02841                                                            DFA_DIFCTL[DWBCNT] = (DFA_DIFCTL[SIZE] + 4)/4 */
02842     uint64_t pool                         : 3;  /**< Represents the 3bit buffer pool-id  used by DFA HW
02843                                                          when the DFA instruction chunk is recycled back
02844                                                          to the Free Page List maintained by the FPA HW
02845                                                          (once the DFA instruction has been issued). */
02846     uint64_t size                         : 9;  /**< Represents the \# of 32B instructions contained
02847                                                          within each DFA instruction chunk. At Power-on,
02848                                                          SW will seed the SIZE register with a fixed
02849                                                          chunk-size. (Must be at least 3)
02850                                                          DFA HW uses this field to determine the size
02851                                                          of each DFA instruction chunk, in order to:
02852                                                             a) determine when to read the next DFA
02853                                                                instruction chunk pointer which is
02854                                                                written by SW at the end of the current
02855                                                                DFA instruction chunk (see DFA description
02856                                                                of next chunk buffer Ptr for format).
02857                                                             b) determine when a DFA instruction chunk
02858                                                                can be returned to the Free Page List
02859                                                                maintained by the FPA HW. */
02860 #else
02861     uint64_t size                         : 9;
02862     uint64_t pool                         : 3;
02863     uint64_t dwbcnt                       : 8;
02864     uint64_t msegbase                     : 6;
02865     uint64_t reserved_26_63               : 38;
02866 #endif
02867     } cn61xx;
02868     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx         cn63xx;
02869     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx         cn63xxp1;
02870     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn31xx         cn66xx;
02871     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn61xx         cn68xx;
02872     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn61xx         cn68xxp1;
02873     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn61xx         cn70xx;
02874     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn61xx         cn70xxp1;
02875     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn73xx {
02876 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02877     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
02878     uint64_t aura                         : 16; /**< Represents the 16-bit aura ID used by HFA hardware when the HFA instruction chunk is
02879                                                          recycled back to the free page list maintained by the FPA hardware (once the HFA
02880                                                          instruction has been issued). */
02881     uint64_t msegbase                     : 6;  /**< Reserved. */
02882     uint64_t reserved_13_19               : 7;
02883     uint64_t ldwb                         : 1;  /**< Load don't write back. When set, the hardware issues LDWB command towards the cache when
02884                                                          fetching the last word of instructions; as a result the line will not be written back when
02885                                                          replaced.
02886                                                          When clear, the hardware issues regular load towards the cache, which will cause the line
02887                                                          to be written back before being replaced. */
02888     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
02889     uint64_t size                         : 9;  /**< Represents the number of 64-byte instructions contained within each HFA instruction chunk.
02890                                                          At power-on, software seeds the SIZE register with a fixed chunk-size (must be at least
02891                                                          0x3). HFA hardware uses this field to determine the size of each HFA instruction chunk, in
02892                                                          order to:
02893                                                          a) determine when to read the next HFA instruction chunk pointer which is written by
02894                                                          software at the end of the current HFA instruction chunk (see HFA description of next
02895                                                          chunk buffer Ptr for format).
02896                                                          b) determine when a HFA instruction chunk can be returned to the free page list maintained
02897                                                          by the FPA hardware. */
02898 #else
02899     uint64_t size                         : 9;
02900     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
02901     uint64_t ldwb                         : 1;
02902     uint64_t reserved_13_19               : 7;
02903     uint64_t msegbase                     : 6;
02904     uint64_t aura                         : 16;
02905     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
02906 #endif
02907     } cn73xx;
02908     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn73xx         cn78xx;
02909     struct cvmx_dfa_difctl_cn73xx         cn78xxp1;
02910 };
02911 typedef union cvmx_dfa_difctl cvmx_dfa_difctl_t;
02912 
02913 /**
02914  * cvmx_dfa_difrdptr
02915  *
02916  * To write to DFA_DIFRDPTR, a device issues an IOBST request directed at the HFA with
02917  * addr[34:33] = 0x1. To read DFA_DIFRDPTR, a device issues an IOBLD64 request directed at the
02918  * HFA with addr[34:33] = 0x1.
02919  *
02920  * If DFA_CONFIG[DTECLKDIS] = 1 (i.e. HFA-HTE clocks are disabled) or if FUSE[90] = 'HFA HTE
02921  * disable' is blown, read/write operations to DFA_DIFRDPTR do not take effect.
02922  */
02923 union cvmx_dfa_difrdptr {
02924     uint64_t u64;
02925     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_s {
02926 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02927     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
02928 #else
02929     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
02930 #endif
02931     } s;
02932     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn31xx {
02933 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02934     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
02935     uint64_t rdptr                        : 31; /**< Represents the 32B-aligned address of the current
02936                                                          instruction in the DFA Instruction FIFO in main
02937                                                          memory. The RDPTR must be seeded by software at
02938                                                          boot time, and is then maintained thereafter
02939                                                          by DFA HW.
02940                                                          During the seed write (by SW), RDPTR[6:5]=0,
02941                                                          since DFA instruction chunks must be 128B aligned.
02942                                                          During a read (by SW), the 'most recent' contents
02943                                                          of the RDPTR register are returned at the time
02944                                                          the NCB-INB bus is driven.
02945                                                          NOTE: Since DFA HW updates this register, its
02946                                                          contents are unpredictable in SW (unless
02947                                                          its guaranteed that no new DoorBell register
02948                                                          writes have occurred and the DoorBell register is
02949                                                          read as zero). */
02950     uint64_t reserved_0_4                 : 5;
02951 #else
02952     uint64_t reserved_0_4                 : 5;
02953     uint64_t rdptr                        : 31;
02954     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
02955 #endif
02956     } cn31xx;
02957     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn31xx       cn38xx;
02958     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn31xx       cn38xxp2;
02959     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn31xx       cn58xx;
02960     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn31xx       cn58xxp1;
02961     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx {
02962 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02963     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
02964     uint64_t rdptr                        : 35; /**< Represents the 32B-aligned address of the current
02965                                                          instruction in the DFA Instruction FIFO in main
02966                                                          memory. The RDPTR must be seeded by software at
02967                                                          boot time, and is then maintained thereafter
02968                                                          by DFA HW.
02969                                                          During the seed write (by SW), RDPTR[6:5]=0,
02970                                                          since DFA instruction chunks must be 128B aligned.
