02971                                                          During a read (by SW), the 'most recent' contents
02972                                                          of the RDPTR register are returned at the time
02973                                                          the NCB-INB bus is driven.
02974                                                          NOTE: Since DFA HW updates this register, its
02975                                                          contents are unpredictable in SW (unless
02976                                                          its guaranteed that no new DoorBell register
02977                                                          writes have occurred and the DoorBell register is
02978                                                          read as zero). */
02979     uint64_t reserved_0_4                 : 5;
02980 #else
02981     uint64_t reserved_0_4                 : 5;
02982     uint64_t rdptr                        : 35;
02983     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
02984 #endif
02985     } cn61xx;
02986     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx       cn63xx;
02987     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx       cn63xxp1;
02988     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx       cn66xx;
02989     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx       cn68xx;
02990     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx       cn68xxp1;
02991     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx       cn70xx;
02992     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn61xx       cn70xxp1;
02993     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn73xx {
02994 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02995     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
02996     uint64_t rdptr                        : 36; /**< Represents the 64-byte-aligned address of the current instruction in the HFA Instruction
02997                                                          FIFO in main memory. The RDPTR must be seeded by software at boot time, and is then
02998                                                          maintained thereafter by HFA hardware. During the seed write operation (by software),
02999                                                          [RDPTR]<6:5> = 0, since HFA instruction chunks must be 128-byte-aligned. During a read
03000                                                          operation (by software), the most-recent contents of the [RDPTR] register are returned at
03001                                                          the time the IOI-INB bus is driven.
03002                                                          Since HFA hardware updates this register, its contents are unpredictable in software
03003                                                          (unless it is guaranteed that no new doorbell register write operations have occurred and
03004                                                          the doorbell register is read as zero). */
03005     uint64_t reserved_0_5                 : 6;
03006 #else
03007     uint64_t reserved_0_5                 : 6;
03008     uint64_t rdptr                        : 36;
03009     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
03010 #endif
03011     } cn73xx;
03012     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn73xx       cn78xx;
03013     struct cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_cn73xx       cn78xxp1;
03014 };
03015 typedef union cvmx_dfa_difrdptr cvmx_dfa_difrdptr_t;
03016 
03017 /**
03018  * cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr
03019  *
03020  * This register contains HFA graph-cache failing address/control error capture information. It
03021  * contains useful information to help in isolating a graph-cache RAM failure.
03022  */
03023 union cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr {
03024     uint64_t u64;
03025     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s {
03026 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03027     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
03028     uint64_t ram3fadr                     : 12; /**< HFA RAM3 failing address. If DFA_ERROR[DC0PERR<2>] = 1, this field indicates the failing
03029                                                          RAM3 address. The failing address is locked down until the DC0PERR<2> W1C occurs.
03030                                                          If multiple DC0PERR<0>=1 errors are detected, the LSB cluster error information is
03031                                                          captured. */
03032     uint64_t reserved_25_31               : 7;
03033     uint64_t ram2fadr                     : 9;  /**< HFA RAM2 failing address. If DFA_ERROR[DC0PERR<1>] = 1, this field indicates the failing
03034                                                          RAM2 address. The failing address is locked down until the DC0PERR<1> W1C occurs.
03035                                                          If multiple DC0PERR<0>=1 errors are detected, the LSB cluster error information is
03036                                                          captured. */
03037     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03038     uint64_t ram1fadr                     : 14; /**< HFA RAM1 failing address. If DFA_ERROR[DC0PERR<0>] = 1, this field indicates the failing
03039                                                          RAM1 address. The failing address is locked down until the DC0PERR<0> W1C occurs.
03040                                                          If multiple DC0PERR<0>=1 errors are detected, the LSB cluster error information is
03041                                                          captured. */
03042 #else
03043     uint64_t ram1fadr                     : 14;
03044     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03045     uint64_t ram2fadr                     : 9;
03046     uint64_t reserved_25_31               : 7;
03047     uint64_t ram3fadr                     : 12;
03048     uint64_t reserved_44_63               : 20;
03049 #endif
03050     } s;
03051     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn61xx;
03052     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn63xx;
03053     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn63xxp1;
03054     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn66xx;
03055     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn68xx;
03056     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn68xxp1;
03057     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn70xx;
03058     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn70xxp1;
03059     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn73xx;
03060     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn78xx;
03061     struct cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_s             cn78xxp1;
03062 };
03063 typedef union cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr cvmx_dfa_dtcfadr_t;
03064 
03065 /**
03066  * cvmx_dfa_eclkcfg
03067  *
03068  * Specify the RSL base addresses for the block
03069  *
03070  *                  DFA_ECLKCFG = DFA eclk-domain Configuration Registers
03071  *
03072  * Description:
03073  */
03074 union cvmx_dfa_eclkcfg {
03075     uint64_t u64;
03076     struct cvmx_dfa_eclkcfg_s {
03077 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03078     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03079     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 3;  /**< SBD Debug Entry#
03080                                                          For internal use only. (DFA Scoreboard debug)
03081                                                          Selects which one of 8 DFA Scoreboard entries is
03082                                                          latched into the DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3] registers. */
03083     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03084     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;  /**< DFA Scoreboard LOCK Strobe
03085                                                          For internal use only. (DFA Scoreboard debug)
03086                                                          When written with a '1', the DFA Scoreboard Debug
03087                                                          registers (DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3]) are all locked down.
03088                                                          This allows SW to lock down the contents of the entire
03089                                                          SBD for a single instant in time. All subsequent reads
03090                                                          of the DFA scoreboard registers will return the data
03091                                                          from that instant in time. */
03092     uint64_t dcmode                       : 1;  /**< DRF-CRQ/DTE Arbiter Mode
03093                                                          DTE-DRF Arbiter (0=FP [LP=CRQ/HP=DTE],1=RR)
03094                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03095                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03096     uint64_t dtmode                       : 1;  /**< DRF-DTE Arbiter Mode
03097                                                          DTE-DRF Arbiter (0=FP [LP=DTE[15],...,HP=DTE[0]],1=RR)
03098                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03099                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03100     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRP Arbiter Mode
03101                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=WQF,DFF,HP=RGF]/1=RR
03102                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03103                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03104     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRQ Arbiter Mode
03105                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=IRF,RWF,PRF,HP=GRF]/1=RR
03106                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03107                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03108     uint64_t imode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-Inbound Arbiter
03109                                                          (0=FP [LP=NRQ,HP=NRP], 1=RR)
03110                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03111                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03112     uint64_t sarb                         : 1;  /**< DFA Source Arbiter Mode
03113                                                          Selects the arbitration mode used to select DFA requests
03114                                                          issued from either CP2 or the DTE (NCB-CSR or DFA HW engine).
03115                                                           - 0: Fixed Priority [Highest=CP2, Lowest=DTE]
03116                                                           - 1: Round-Robin
03117                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03118                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03119     uint64_t reserved_3_7                 : 5;
03120     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;  /**< DFA DTE Clock Disable
03121                                                          When SET, the DFA clocks for DTE(thread engine)
03122                                                          operation are disabled.
03123                                                          NOTE: When SET, SW MUST NEVER issue ANY operations to
03124                                                          the DFA via the NCB Bus. All DFA Operations must be
03125                                                          issued solely through the CP2 interface. */
03126     uint64_t maxbnk                       : 1;  /**< Maximum Banks per-device (used by the address mapper
03127                                                          when extracting address bits for the memory bank#.
03128                                                                  - 0: 4 banks/device
03129                                                                  - 1: 8 banks/device */
03130     uint64_t dfa_frstn                    : 1;  /**< Hold this 0 until the DFA DDR PLL and DLL lock
03131                                                          and then write a 1. A 1 on this register deasserts
03132                                                          the internal frst_n. Refer to DFA_DDR2_PLL registers for more
03133                                                          startup information.
03134                                                          Startup sequence if DFA interface needs to be ON:
03135                                                           After valid power up,
03136                                                           Write DFA_DDR2_PLL-> PLL_RATIO & PLL_DIV2 & PLL_BYPASS
03137                                                           to the appropriate values
03138                                                           Wait a few cycles
03139                                                           Write a 1 DFA_DDR2_PLL -> PLL_INIT
03140                                                           Wait 100 microseconds
03141                                                           Write a 1 to DFA_DDR2_PLL -> QDLL_ENA
03142                                                           Wait 10 microseconds
03143                                                           Write a 1 to this register DFA_FRSTN to pull DFA out of
03144                                                           reset
03145                                                           Now the DFA block is ready to be initialized (follow the
03146                                                           DDR init sequence). */
03147 #else
03148     uint64_t dfa_frstn                    : 1;
03149     uint64_t maxbnk                       : 1;
03150     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;
03151     uint64_t reserved_3_7                 : 5;
03152     uint64_t sarb                         : 1;
03153     uint64_t imode                        : 1;
03154     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;
03155     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;
03156     uint64_t dtmode                       : 1;
03157     uint64_t dcmode                       : 1;
03158     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;
03159     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03160     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 3;
03161     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03162 #endif
03163     } s;
03164     struct cvmx_dfa_eclkcfg_s             cn31xx;
03165 };
03166 typedef union cvmx_dfa_eclkcfg cvmx_dfa_eclkcfg_t;
03167 
03168 /**
03169  * cvmx_dfa_err
03170  *
03171  * DFA_ERR = DFA ERROR Register
03172  *
03173  * Description:
03174  */
03175 union cvmx_dfa_err {
03176     uint64_t u64;
03177     struct cvmx_dfa_err_s {
03178 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03179     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
03180     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow Interrupt Enable bit.
03181                                                          When set, doorbell overflow conditions are reported. */
03182     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow detected - Status bit
03183                                                          When set, the 20b accumulated doorbell register
03184                                                          had overflowed (SW wrote too many doorbell requests).
03185                                                          If the DBLINA had previously been enabled(set),
03186                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03187                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03188                                                          NOTE: Detection of a Doorbell Register overflow
03189                                                          is a catastrophic error which may leave the DFA
03190                                                          HW in an unrecoverable state. */
03191     uint64_t cp2pina                      : 1;  /**< CP2 LW Mode Parity Error Interrupt Enable bit.
03192                                                          When set, all PP-generated LW Mode read
03193                                                          transactions which encounter a parity error (across
03194                                                          the 36b of data) are reported. */
03195     uint64_t cp2perr                      : 1;  /**< PP-CP2 Parity Error Detected - Status bit
03196                                                          When set, a parity error had been detected for a
03197                                                          PP-generated LW Mode read transaction.
03198                                                          If the CP2PINA had previously been enabled(set),
03199                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03200                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03201                                                          See also: DFA_MEMFADR CSR which contains more data
03202                                                          about the memory address/control to help isolate
03203                                                          the failure. */
03204     uint64_t cp2parena                    : 1;  /**< CP2 LW Mode Parity Error Enable
03205                                                          When set, all PP-generated LW Mode read
03206                                                          transactions which encounter a parity error (across
03207                                                          the 36b of data) are reported.
03208                                                          NOTE: This signal must only be written to a different
03209                                                          value when there are no PP-CP2 transactions
03210                                                          (preferrably during power-on software initialization). */
03211     uint64_t dtepina                      : 1;  /**< DTE Parity Error Interrupt Enable bit
03212                                                          (for 18b SIMPLE mode ONLY).
03213                                                          When set, all DTE-generated 18b SIMPLE Mode read
03214                                                          transactions which encounter a parity error (across
03215                                                          the 17b of data) are reported. */
03216     uint64_t dteperr                      : 1;  /**< DTE Parity Error Detected (for 18b SIMPLE mode ONLY)
03217                                                          When set, all DTE-generated 18b SIMPLE Mode read
03218                                                          transactions which encounter a parity error (across
03219                                                          the 17b of data) are reported. */
03220     uint64_t dteparena                    : 1;  /**< DTE Parity Error Enable (for 18b SIMPLE mode ONLY)
03221                                                          When set, all DTE-generated 18b SIMPLE Mode read
03222                                                          transactions which encounter a parity error (across
03223                                                          the 17b of data) are reported.
03224                                                          NOTE: This signal must only be written to a different
03225                                                          value when there are no DFA thread engines active
03226                                                          (preferrably during power-on). */
03227     uint64_t dtesyn                       : 7;  /**< DTE 29b ECC Failing 6bit Syndrome
03228                                                          When DTESBE or DTEDBE are set, this field contains
03229                                                          the failing 7b ECC syndrome. */
03230     uint64_t dtedbina                     : 1;  /**< DTE 29b Double Bit Error Interrupt Enable bit
03231                                                          When set, an interrupt is posted for any DTE-generated
03232                                                          36b SIMPLE Mode read which encounters a double bit
03233                                                          error. */
03234     uint64_t dtesbina                     : 1;  /**< DTE 29b Single Bit Error Interrupt Enable bit
03235                                                          When set, an interrupt is posted for any DTE-generated
03236                                                          36b SIMPLE Mode read which encounters a single bit
03237                                                          error (which is also corrected). */
03238     uint64_t dtedbe                       : 1;  /**< DTE 29b Double Bit Error Detected - Status bit
03239                                                          When set, a double bit error had been detected
03240                                                          for a DTE-generated 36b SIMPLE Mode read transaction.
03241                                                          The DTESYN contains the failing syndrome.
03242                                                          If the DTEDBINA had previously been enabled(set),
03243                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03244                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03245                                                          See also: DFA_MEMFADR CSR which contains more data
03246                                                          about the memory address/control to help isolate
03247                                                          the failure.
03248                                                          NOTE: DTE-generated 18b SIMPLE Mode Read transactions
03249                                                          do not participate in ECC check/correct). */
03250     uint64_t dtesbe                       : 1;  /**< DTE 29b Single Bit Error Corrected - Status bit
03251                                                          When set, a single bit error had been detected and
03252                                                          corrected for a DTE-generated 36b SIMPLE Mode read
03253                                                          transaction.
03254                                                          If the DTEDBE=0, then the DTESYN contains the
03255                                                          failing syndrome (used during correction).
03256                                                          NOTE: DTE-generated 18b SIMPLE Mode Read
03257                                                          transactions do not participate in ECC check/correct).
03258                                                          If the DTESBINA had previously been enabled(set),
03259                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03260                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03261                                                          See also: DFA_MEMFADR CSR which contains more data
03262                                                          about the memory address/control to help isolate
03263                                                          the failure. */
03264     uint64_t dteeccena                    : 1;  /**< DTE 29b ECC Enable (for 36b SIMPLE mode ONLY)
03265                                                          When set, 29b ECC is enabled on all DTE-generated
03266                                                          36b SIMPLE Mode read transactions.
03267                                                          NOTE: This signal must only be written to a different
03268                                                          value when there are no DFA thread engines active
03269                                                          (preferrably during power-on software initialization). */
03270     uint64_t cp2syn                       : 8;  /**< PP-CP2 QW ECC Failing 8bit Syndrome
03271                                                          When CP2SBE or CP2DBE are set, this field contains
03272                                                          the failing ECC 8b syndrome.
03273                                                          Refer to CP2ECCENA. */
03274     uint64_t cp2dbina                     : 1;  /**< PP-CP2 Double Bit Error Interrupt Enable bit
03275                                                          When set, an interrupt is posted for any PP-generated
03276                                                          QW Mode read which encounters a double bit error.
03277                                                          Refer to CP2DBE. */
03278     uint64_t cp2sbina                     : 1;  /**< PP-CP2 Single Bit Error Interrupt Enable bit
03279                                                          When set, an interrupt is posted for any PP-generated
03280                                                          QW Mode read which encounters a single bit error
03281                                                          (which is also corrected).
03282                                                          Refer to CP2SBE. */
03283     uint64_t cp2dbe                       : 1;  /**< PP-CP2 Double Bit Error Detected - Status bit
03284                                                          When set, a double bit error had been detected
03285                                                          for a PP-generated QW Mode read transaction.
03286                                                          The CP2SYN contains the failing syndrome.
03287                                                           NOTE: PP-generated LW Mode Read transactions
03288                                                          do not participate in ECC check/correct).
03289                                                          Refer to CP2ECCENA.
03290                                                          If the CP2DBINA had previously been enabled(set),
03291                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03292                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03293                                                          See also: DFA_MEMFADR CSR which contains more data
03294                                                          about the memory address/control to help isolate
03295                                                          the failure. */
03296     uint64_t cp2sbe                       : 1;  /**< PP-CP2 Single Bit Error Corrected - Status bit
03297                                                          When set, a single bit error had been detected and
03298                                                          corrected for a PP-generated QW Mode read
03299                                                          transaction.
03300                                                          If the CP2DBE=0, then the CP2SYN contains the
03301                                                          failing syndrome (used during correction).
03302                                                          Refer to CP2ECCENA.
03303                                                          If the CP2SBINA had previously been enabled(set),
03304                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03305                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03306                                                          See also: DFA_MEMFADR CSR which contains more data
03307                                                          about the memory address/control to help isolate
03308                                                          the failure.
03309                                                          NOTE: PP-generated LW Mode Read transactions
03310                                                          do not participate in ECC check/correct). */
03311     uint64_t cp2eccena                    : 1;  /**< PP-CP2 QW ECC Enable (for QW Mode transactions)
03312                                                          When set, 8bit QW ECC is enabled on all PP-generated
03313                                                          QW Mode read transactions, CP2SBE and
03314                                                          CP2DBE may be set, and CP2SYN may be filled.
03315                                                          NOTE: This signal must only be written to a different
03316                                                          value when there are no PP-CP2 transactions
03317                                                          (preferrably during power-on software initialization).
03318                                                          NOTE: QW refers to a 64-bit LLM Load/Store (intiated
03319                                                          by a processor core). LW refers to a 36-bit load/store. */
03320 #else
03321     uint64_t cp2eccena                    : 1;
03322     uint64_t cp2sbe                       : 1;
03323     uint64_t cp2dbe                       : 1;
03324     uint64_t cp2sbina                     : 1;
03325     uint64_t cp2dbina                     : 1;
03326     uint64_t cp2syn                       : 8;
03327     uint64_t dteeccena                    : 1;
03328     uint64_t dtesbe                       : 1;
03329     uint64_t dtedbe                       : 1;
03330     uint64_t dtesbina                     : 1;
03331     uint64_t dtedbina                     : 1;
03332     uint64_t dtesyn                       : 7;
03333     uint64_t dteparena                    : 1;
03334     uint64_t dteperr                      : 1;
03335     uint64_t dtepina                      : 1;
03336     uint64_t cp2parena                    : 1;
03337     uint64_t cp2perr                      : 1;
03338     uint64_t cp2pina                      : 1;
03339     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;
03340     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;
03341     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
03342 #endif
03343     } s;
03344     struct cvmx_dfa_err_s                 cn31xx;
03345     struct cvmx_dfa_err_s                 cn38xx;
03346     struct cvmx_dfa_err_s                 cn38xxp2;
03347     struct cvmx_dfa_err_s                 cn58xx;
03348     struct cvmx_dfa_err_s                 cn58xxp1;
03349 };
03350 typedef union cvmx_dfa_err cvmx_dfa_err_t;
03351 
03352 /**
03353  * cvmx_dfa_error
03354  *
03355  * Description:
03356  *
03357  */
03358 union cvmx_dfa_error {
03359     uint64_t u64;
03360     struct cvmx_dfa_error_s {
03361 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03362     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
03363     uint64_t osmerr                       : 1;  /**< OSM reported an error with the response data. */
03364     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;  /**< HFA illegal replication factor error. HFA only supports 1*, 2*, and 4* port replication.
03365                                                          Legal configurations for memory are to support 2 port or 4 port configurations.
03366                                                          The REPLERR interrupt is set in the following illegal configuration cases:
03367                                                          * An 8* replication factor is detected for any memory reference.
03368                                                          * A 4* replication factor is detected for any memory reference when only 2
03369                                                          memory ports are enabled.
03370                                                          * If [REPLERR] is set during a HFA graph walk operation, the walk prematurely
03371                                                          terminates with RWORD0[REA]=ERR. If [REPLERR] is set during a IOI-direct CSR
03372                                                          read access to HFA memory region, the CSR read response data is unpredictable. */
03373     uint64_t dfanxm                       : 1;  /**< HFA nonexistent memory access. HTEs (and backdoor CSR HFA memory region read
03374                                                          operations) have access to the following 40-bit L2/DRAM address space, which
03375                                                          maps to a 38-bit physical DDR3/4 SDRAM address space.
03376                                                          DR0: 0x0 0000 0000 0000 to 0x0 0000 0FFF FFFF
03377                                                          maps to lower 256MB of physical DDR3/4 SDRAM.
03378                                                          DR1: 0x0 0000 2000 0000 to 0x0 0020 0FFF FFFF
03379                                                          maps to upper 127.75GB of DDR3/4 SDRAM.
03380                                                          In the event the HFA generates a reference to the L2/DRAM address hole (0x0000.0FFF.FFFF -
03381                                                          0x0000.1FFF.FFFF) or to an address above 0x0020.0FFF.FFFF, the DFANXM programmable
03382                                                          interrupt bit will be set.
03383                                                          Software Note:
03384                                                          Both the 1) software HFA graph compiler and the 2) software IOI-direct CSR accesses to HFA
03385                                                          memory region must avoid making references to these nonexistent memory regions.
03386                                                          If [DFANXM] is set during a HFA graph walk operation, the walk is prematurely terminated
03387                                                          with RWORD0[REA]=ERR. If [DFANXM] is set during a IOI-direct CSR read access to HFA memory
03388                                                          region, the CSR read response data is forced to
03389                                                          128'hBADE_FEED_DEAD_BEEF_FACE_CAFE_BEAD_C0DE. (The 64-bit doubleword being accessed,
03390                                                          either the upper or lower doubleword will be returned). */
03391     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;  /**< If any of the clusters detected a parity error on RAM1, this additional bit further
03392                                                          specifies that the RAM1 parity error was detected during a CND-RD (cache node metadata
03393                                                          read operation).
03394                                                          This bit is set if ANY node cluster's RAM1 accesses detect a CNDRD error. */
03395     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03396     uint64_t dlc1_ovferr                  : 1;  /**< DLC1 FIFO overflow error detected. This condition should never architecturally occur, and
03397                                                          is here in case hardware credit/debit scheme is not working. */
03398     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;  /**< DLC0 FIFO overflow error detected. This condition should never architecturally occur, and
03399                                                          is here in case hardware credit/debit scheme is not working. */
03400     uint64_t dc3perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster 3 RAM[3:1] parity error detected. See also DFA_DTCFADR, which contains the failing
03401                                                          addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03402     uint64_t dc2perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster 2 RAM[3:1] parity error detected. See also DFA_DTCFADR, which contains the failing
03403                                                          addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03404     uint64_t dc1perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster 1 RAM[3:1] parity error detected. See also DFA_DTCFADR, which contains the failing
03405                                                          addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03406     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster 0 RAM[3:1] parity error detected. See also DFA_DTCFADR register, which contains
03407                                                          the failing addresses for the graph-cache RAMs. */
03408     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell overflow detected - status bit. When set, DFA_DBELL[DBELL]
03409                                                          had overflowed (software wrote too many doorbell requests). If the DBLINA had previously
03410                                                          been enabled (set), an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear the interrupt by
03411                                                          writing a 1 to this register bit.
03412                                                          Detection of a doorbell register overflow is a catastrophic error that may leave the HFA
03413                                                          hardware in an unrecoverable state. */
03414 #else
03415     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;
03416     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;
03417     uint64_t dc1perr                      : 3;
03418     uint64_t dc2perr                      : 3;
03419     uint64_t dc3perr                      : 3;
03420     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;
03421     uint64_t dlc1_ovferr                  : 1;
03422     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03423     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;
03424     uint64_t dfanxm                       : 1;
03425     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;
03426     uint64_t osmerr                       : 1;
03427     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
03428 #endif
03429     } s;
03430     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn61xx {
03431 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03432     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03433     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;  /**< DFA Illegal Replication Factor Error
03434                                                          For o68: DFA only supports 1x, 2x, and 4x port replication.
03435                                                          Legal configurations for memory are to support 2 port or
03436                                                          4 port configurations.
03437                                                          The REPLERR interrupt will be set in the following illegal
03438                                                          configuration cases:
03439                                                              1) An 8x replication factor is detected for any memory reference.
03440                                                              2) A 4x replication factor is detected for any memory reference
03441                                                                 when only 2 memory ports are enabled.
03442                                                          NOTE: If REPLERR is set during a DFA Graph Walk operation,
03443                                                          then the walk will prematurely terminate with RWORD0[REA]=ERR.
03444                                                          If REPLERR is set during a NCB-Direct CSR read access to DFA
03445                                                          Memory REGION, then the CSR read response data is UNPREDICTABLE. */
03446     uint64_t dfanxm                       : 1;  /**< DFA Non-existent Memory Access
03447                                                          For o68/o61: DTEs (and backdoor CSR DFA Memory REGION reads)
03448                                                          have access to the following 38bit L2/DRAM address space
03449                                                          which maps to a 37bit physical DDR3 SDRAM address space.
03450                                                          see:
03451                                                          DR0: 0x0 0000 0000 0000 to 0x0 0000 0FFF FFFF
03452                                                                  maps to lower 256MB of physical DDR3 SDRAM
03453                                                          DR1: 0x0 0000 2000 0000 to 0x0 0020 0FFF FFFF
03454                                                                  maps to upper 127.75GB of DDR3 SDRAM
03455                                                                     L2/DRAM address space                     Physical DDR3 SDRAM Address space
03456                                                                       (38bit address)                           (37bit address)
03457                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0020.0FFF.FFFF
03458                                                                        |
03459                                                                       ===   DR1   ===                          +-----------+ 0x001F.FFFF.FFFF
03460                                                           (128GB-256MB)|           |                           |
03461                                                                        |           |                     =>    |           |  (128GB-256MB)
03462                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0000.1FFF.FFFF          |   DR1
03463                                                                256MB   |   HOLE    |   (DO NOT USE)            |
03464                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0000.0FFF.FFFF          +-----------+ 0x0000.0FFF.FFFF
03465                                                                256MB   |    DR0    |                           |   DR0     |   (256MB)
03466                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0000.0000.0000          +-----------+ 0x0000.0000.0000
03467                                                          In the event the DFA generates a reference to the L2/DRAM
03468                                                          address hole (0x0000.0FFF.FFFF - 0x0000.1FFF.FFFF) or to
03469                                                          an address above 0x0020.0FFF.FFFF, the DFANXM programmable
03470                                                          interrupt bit will be set.
03471                                                          SWNOTE: Both the 1) SW DFA Graph compiler and the 2) SW NCB-Direct CSR
03472                                                          accesses to DFA Memory REGION MUST avoid making references
03473                                                          to these non-existent memory regions.
03474                                                          NOTE: If DFANXM is set during a DFA Graph Walk operation,
03475                                                          then the walk will prematurely terminate with RWORD0[REA]=ERR.
03476                                                          If DFANXM is set during a NCB-Direct CSR read access to DFA
03477                                                          Memory REGION, then the CSR read response data is forced to
03478                                                          128'hBADE_FEED_DEAD_BEEF_FACE_CAFE_BEAD_C0DE. (NOTE: the QW
03479                                                          being accessed, either the upper or lower QW will be returned). */
03480     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;  /**< If any of the cluster's detected a Parity error on RAM1
03481                                                          this additional bit further specifies that the
03482                                                          RAM1 parity error was detected during a CND-RD
03483                                                          (Cache Node Metadata Read).
03484 
03485                                                          For CNDRD Parity Error, the previous CNA arc fetch
03486                                                          information is written to RWORD1+ as follows:
03487                                                             RWORD1+[NTYPE]=MNODE
03488                                                             RWORD1+[NDNID]=cna.ndnid
03489                                                             RWORD1+[NHMSK]=cna.hmsk
03490                                                             RWORD1+[NNPTR]=cna.nnptr[13:0]
03491                                                          NOTE: This bit is set if ANY node cluster's RAM1 accesses
03492                                                          detect a CNDRD error. */
03493     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03494     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;  /**< DLC0 Fifo Overflow Error Detected
03495                                                          This condition should NEVER architecturally occur, and
03496                                                          is here in case HW credit/debit scheme is not working. */
03497     uint64_t reserved_4_12                : 9;
03498     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster#0 RAM[3:1] Parity Error Detected
03499                                                          See also DFA_DTCFADR register which contains the
03500                                                          failing addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03501     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow detected - Status bit
03502                                                          When set, the 20b accumulated doorbell register
03503                                                          had overflowed (SW wrote too many doorbell requests).
03504                                                          If the DBLINA had previously been enabled(set),
03505                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03506                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03507                                                          NOTE: Detection of a Doorbell Register overflow
03508                                                          is a catastrophic error which may leave the DFA
03509                                                          HW in an unrecoverable state. */
03510 #else
03511     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;
03512     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;
03513     uint64_t reserved_4_12                : 9;
03514     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;
03515     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
03516     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;
03517     uint64_t dfanxm                       : 1;
03518     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;
03519     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03520 #endif
03521     } cn61xx;
03522     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn63xx {
03523 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03524     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
03525     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;  /**< If DC0PERR[0]=1 indicating a RAM1 Parity error,
03526                                                          this additional bit further specifies that the
03527                                                          RAM1 parity error was detected during a CND-RD
03528                                                          (Cache Node Metadata Read).
03529 
03530                                                          For CNDRD Parity Error, the previous CNA arc fetch
03531                                                          information is written to RWORD1+ as follows:
03532                                                             RWORD1+[NTYPE]=MNODE
03533                                                             RWORD1+[NDNID]=cna.ndnid
03534                                                             RWORD1+[NHMSK]=cna.hmsk
03535                                                             RWORD1+[NNPTR]=cna.nnptr[13:0] */
03536     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
03537     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;  /**< RAM[3:1] Parity Error Detected from Node Cluster \#0
03538                                                          See also DFA_DTCFADR register which contains the
03539                                                          failing addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03540     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow detected - Status bit
03541                                                          When set, the 20b accumulated doorbell register
03542                                                          had overflowed (SW wrote too many doorbell requests).
03543                                                          If the DBLINA had previously been enabled(set),
03544                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03545                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03546                                                          NOTE: Detection of a Doorbell Register overflow
03547                                                          is a catastrophic error which may leave the DFA
03548                                                          HW in an unrecoverable state. */
03549 #else
03550     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;
03551     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;
03552     uint64_t reserved_4_15                : 12;
03553     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;
03554     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
03555 #endif
03556     } cn63xx;
03557     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn63xx          cn63xxp1;
03558     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn63xx          cn66xx;
03559     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn68xx {
03560 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03561     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03562     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;  /**< DFA Illegal Replication Factor Error
03563                                                          For o68: DFA only supports 1x, 2x, and 4x port replication.
03564                                                          Legal configurations for memory are to support 2 port or
03565                                                          4 port configurations.
03566                                                          The REPLERR interrupt will be set in the following illegal
03567                                                          configuration cases:
03568                                                              1) An 8x replication factor is detected for any memory reference.
03569                                                              2) A 4x replication factor is detected for any memory reference
03570                                                                 when only 2 memory ports are enabled.
03571                                                          NOTE: If REPLERR is set during a DFA Graph Walk operation,
03572                                                          then the walk will prematurely terminate with RWORD0[REA]=ERR.
03573                                                          If REPLERR is set during a NCB-Direct CSR read access to DFA
03574                                                          Memory REGION, then the CSR read response data is UNPREDICTABLE. */
03575     uint64_t dfanxm                       : 1;  /**< DFA Non-existent Memory Access
03576                                                          For o68: DTEs (and backdoor CSR DFA Memory REGION reads)
03577                                                          have access to the following 38bit L2/DRAM address space
03578                                                          which maps to a 37bit physical DDR3 SDRAM address space.
03579                                                          see:
03580                                                          DR0: 0x0 0000 0000 0000 to 0x0 0000 0FFF FFFF
03581                                                                  maps to lower 256MB of physical DDR3 SDRAM
03582                                                          DR1: 0x0 0000 2000 0000 to 0x0 0020 0FFF FFFF
03583                                                                  maps to upper 127.75GB of DDR3 SDRAM
03584                                                                     L2/DRAM address space                     Physical DDR3 SDRAM Address space
03585                                                                       (38bit address)                           (37bit address)
03586                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0020.0FFF.FFFF
03587                                                                        |
03588                                                                       ===   DR1   ===                          +-----------+ 0x001F.FFFF.FFFF
03589                                                           (128GB-256MB)|           |                           |
03590                                                                        |           |                     =>    |           |  (128GB-256MB)
03591                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0000.1FFF.FFFF          |   DR1
03592                                                                256MB   |   HOLE    |   (DO NOT USE)            |
03593                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0000.0FFF.FFFF          +-----------+ 0x0000.0FFF.FFFF
03594                                                                256MB   |    DR0    |                           |   DR0     |   (256MB)
03595                                                                        +-----------+ 0x0000.0000.0000          +-----------+ 0x0000.0000.0000
03596                                                          In the event the DFA generates a reference to the L2/DRAM
03597                                                          address hole (0x0000.0FFF.FFFF - 0x0000.1FFF.FFFF) or to
03598                                                          an address above 0x0020.0FFF.FFFF, the DFANXM programmable
03599                                                          interrupt bit will be set.
03600                                                          SWNOTE: Both the 1) SW DFA Graph compiler and the 2) SW NCB-Direct CSR
03601                                                          accesses to DFA Memory REGION MUST avoid making references
03602                                                          to these non-existent memory regions.
03603                                                          NOTE: If DFANXM is set during a DFA Graph Walk operation,
03604                                                          then the walk will prematurely terminate with RWORD0[REA]=ERR.
03605                                                          If DFANXM is set during a NCB-Direct CSR read access to DFA
03606                                                          Memory REGION, then the CSR read response data is forced to
03607                                                          128'hBADE_FEED_DEAD_BEEF_FACE_CAFE_BEAD_C0DE. (NOTE: the QW
03608                                                          being accessed, either the upper or lower QW will be returned). */
03609     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;  /**< If Any of the cluster's detected a Parity error on RAM1
03610                                                          this additional bit further specifies that the
03611                                                          RAM1 parity error was detected during a CND-RD
03612                                                          (Cache Node Metadata Read).
03613 
03614                                                          For CNDRD Parity Error, the previous CNA arc fetch
03615                                                          information is written to RWORD1+ as follows:
03616                                                             RWORD1+[NTYPE]=MNODE
03617                                                             RWORD1+[NDNID]=cna.ndnid
03618                                                             RWORD1+[NHMSK]=cna.hmsk
03619                                                             RWORD1+[NNPTR]=cna.nnptr[13:0]
03620                                                          NOTE: This bit is set if ANY node cluster's RAM1 accesses
03621                                                          detect a CNDRD error. */
03622     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03623     uint64_t dlc1_ovferr                  : 1;  /**< DLC1 Fifo Overflow Error Detected
03624                                                          This condition should NEVER architecturally occur, and
03625                                                          is here in case HW credit/debit scheme is not working. */
03626     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;  /**< DLC0 Fifo Overflow Error Detected
03627                                                          This condition should NEVER architecturally occur, and
03628                                                          is here in case HW credit/debit scheme is not working. */
03629     uint64_t reserved_10_12               : 3;
03630     uint64_t dc2perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster#2 RAM[3:1] Parity Error Detected
03631                                                          See also DFA_DTCFADR register which contains the
03632                                                          failing addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03633     uint64_t dc1perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster#1 RAM[3:1] Parity Error Detected
03634                                                          See also DFA_DTCFADR register which contains the
03635                                                          failing addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03636     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;  /**< Cluster#0 RAM[3:1] Parity Error Detected
03637                                                          See also DFA_DTCFADR register which contains the
03638                                                          failing addresses for the internal node cache RAMs. */
03639     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow detected - Status bit
03640                                                          When set, the 20b accumulated doorbell register
03641                                                          had overflowed (SW wrote too many doorbell requests).
03642                                                          If the DBLINA had previously been enabled(set),
03643                                                          an interrupt will be posted. Software can clear
03644                                                          the interrupt by writing a 1 to this register bit.
03645                                                          NOTE: Detection of a Doorbell Register overflow
03646                                                          is a catastrophic error which may leave the DFA
03647                                                          HW in an unrecoverable state. */
03648 #else
03649     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;
03650     uint64_t dc0perr                      : 3;
03651     uint64_t dc1perr                      : 3;
03652     uint64_t dc2perr                      : 3;
03653     uint64_t reserved_10_12               : 3;
03654     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;
03655     uint64_t dlc1_ovferr                  : 1;
03656     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
03657     uint64_t cndrd                        : 1;
03658     uint64_t dfanxm                       : 1;
03659     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;
03660     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03661 #endif
03662     } cn68xx;
03663     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn68xx          cn68xxp1;
03664     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn61xx          cn70xx;
03665     struct cvmx_dfa_error_cn61xx          cn70xxp1;
03666     struct cvmx_dfa_error_s               cn73xx;
03667     struct cvmx_dfa_error_s               cn78xx;
03668     struct cvmx_dfa_error_s               cn78xxp1;
03669 };
03670 typedef union cvmx_dfa_error cvmx_dfa_error_t;
03671 
03672 /**
03673  * cvmx_dfa_intmsk
03674  *
03675  * Description:
03676  *
03677  */
03678 union cvmx_dfa_intmsk {
03679     uint64_t u64;
03680     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_s {
03681 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03682     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03683     uint64_t replerrena                   : 1;  /**< DFA Illegal Replication Factor Interrupt Enable */
03684     uint64_t dfanxmena                    : 1;  /**< DFA Non-existent Memory Access Interrupt Enable */
03685     uint64_t reserved_15_16               : 2;
03686     uint64_t dlc1_ovfena                  : 1;  /**< DLC1 Fifo Overflow Error Interrupt Enable */
03687     uint64_t dlc0_ovfena                  : 1;  /**< DLC0 Fifo Overflow Error Interrupt Enable */
03688     uint64_t reserved_10_12               : 3;
03689     uint64_t dc2pena                      : 3;  /**< RAM[3:1] Parity Error Enabled Node Cluster \#2 */
03690     uint64_t dc1pena                      : 3;  /**< RAM[3:1] Parity Error Enabled Node Cluster \#1 */
03691     uint64_t dc0pena                      : 3;  /**< RAM[3:1] Parity Error Enabled Node Cluster \#0 */
03692     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow Interrupt Enable bit.
03693                                                          When set, doorbell overflow conditions are reported. */
03694 #else
03695     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;
03696     uint64_t dc0pena                      : 3;
03697     uint64_t dc1pena                      : 3;
03698     uint64_t dc2pena                      : 3;
03699     uint64_t reserved_10_12               : 3;
03700     uint64_t dlc0_ovfena                  : 1;
03701     uint64_t dlc1_ovfena                  : 1;
03702     uint64_t reserved_15_16               : 2;
03703     uint64_t dfanxmena                    : 1;
03704     uint64_t replerrena                   : 1;
03705     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03706 #endif
03707     } s;
03708     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_cn61xx {
03709 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03710     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03711     uint64_t replerrena                   : 1;  /**< DFA Illegal Replication Factor Interrupt Enable */
03712     uint64_t dfanxmena                    : 1;  /**< DFA Non-existent Memory Access Interrupt Enable */
03713     uint64_t reserved_14_16               : 3;
03714     uint64_t dlc0_ovfena                  : 1;  /**< DLC0 Fifo Overflow Error Interrupt Enable */
03715     uint64_t reserved_4_12                : 9;
03716     uint64_t dc0pena                      : 3;  /**< RAM[3:1] Parity Error Enabled Node Cluster \#0 */
03717     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow Interrupt Enable bit.
03718                                                          When set, doorbell overflow conditions are reported. */
03719 #else
03720     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;
03721     uint64_t dc0pena                      : 3;
03722     uint64_t reserved_4_12                : 9;
03723     uint64_t dlc0_ovfena                  : 1;
03724     uint64_t reserved_14_16               : 3;
03725     uint64_t dfanxmena                    : 1;
03726     uint64_t replerrena                   : 1;
03727     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
03728 #endif
03729     } cn61xx;
03730     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_cn63xx {
03731 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03732     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
03733     uint64_t dc0pena                      : 3;  /**< RAM[3:1] Parity Error Enabled Node Cluster \#0 */
03734     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell Overflow Interrupt Enable bit.
03735                                                          When set, doorbell overflow conditions are reported. */
03736 #else
03737     uint64_t dblina                       : 1;
03738     uint64_t dc0pena                      : 3;
03739     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
03740 #endif
03741     } cn63xx;
03742     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_cn63xx         cn63xxp1;
03743     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_cn63xx         cn66xx;
03744     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_s              cn68xx;
03745     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_s              cn68xxp1;
03746     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_cn61xx         cn70xx;
03747     struct cvmx_dfa_intmsk_cn61xx         cn70xxp1;
03748 };
03749 typedef union cvmx_dfa_intmsk cvmx_dfa_intmsk_t;
03750 
03751 /**
03752  * cvmx_dfa_memcfg0
03753  *
03754  * DFA_MEMCFG0 = DFA Memory Configuration
03755  *
03756  * Description:
03757  */
03758 union cvmx_dfa_memcfg0 {
03759     uint64_t u64;
03760     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg0_s {
03761 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
03762     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
03763     uint64_t rldqck90_rst                 : 1;  /**< RLDCK90 and RLDQK90 DLL SW Reset
03764                                                          When written with a '1' the RLDCK90 and RLDQK90 DLL are
03765                                                          in soft-reset. */
03766     uint64_t rldck_rst                    : 1;  /**< RLDCK Zero Delay DLL(Clock Generator) SW Reset
03767                                                          When written with a '1' the RLDCK zero delay DLL is in
03768                                                          soft-reset. */
03769     uint64_t clkdiv                       : 2;  /**< RLDCLK Divisor Select
03770                                                            - 0: RLDx_CK_H/L = Core Clock /2
03771                                                            - 1: RESERVED (must not be used)
03772                                                            - 2: RLDx_CK_H/L = Core Clock /3
03773                                                            - 3: RLDx_CK_H/L = Core Clock /4
03774                                                          The DFA LLM interface(s) are tied to the core clock
03775                                                          frequency through this programmable clock divisor.
03776                                                          Examples:
03777                                                             Core Clock(MHz) | DFA-LLM Clock(MHz) | CLKDIV
03778                                                            -----------------+--------------------+--------
03779                                                                  800        |    400/(800-DDR)   |  /2
03780                                                                 1000        |    333/(666-DDR)   |  /3
03781                                                                  800        |    200/(400-DDR)   |  /4
03782                                                          NOTE: This value MUST BE programmed BEFORE doing a
03783                                                          Hardware init sequence (see: DFA_MEMCFG0[INIT_Px] bits). */
03784     uint64_t lpp_ena                      : 1;  /**< PP Linear Port Addressing Mode Enable
03785                                                          When enabled, PP-core LLM accesses to the lower-512MB
03786                                                          LLM address space are sent to the single DFA port
03787                                                          which is enabled. NOTE: If LPP_ENA=1, only
03788                                                          one DFA RLDRAM port may be enabled for RLDRAM accesses
03789                                                          (ie: ENA_P0 and ENA_P1 CAN NEVER BOTH be set).
03790                                                          PP-core LLM accesses to the upper-512MB LLM address
03791                                                          space are sent to the other 'disabled' DFA port.
03792                                                          SW RESTRICTION: If LPP_ENA=1, then only one DFA port
03793                                                          may be enabled for RLDRAM accesses (ie: ENA_P0 and
03794                                                          ENA_P1 CAN NEVER BOTH be set).
03795                                                          NOTE: This bit is used to allow PP-Core LLM accesses to a
03796                                                          disabled port, such that each port can be sequentially
03797                                                          addressed (ie: disable LW address interleaving).
03798                                                          Enabling this bit allows BOTH PORTs to be active and
03799                                                          sequentially addressable. The single port that is
03800                                                          enabled(ENA_Px) will respond to the low-512MB LLM address
03801                                                          space, and the other 'disabled' port will respond to the
03802                                                          high-512MB LLM address space.
03803                                                          Example usage:
03804                                                             - DFA RLD0 pins used for TCAM-FPGA(CP2 accesses)
03805                                                             - DFA RLD1 pins used for RLDRAM (DTE/CP2 accesses).
03806                                                          USAGE NOTE:
03807                                                          If LPP_ENA=1 and SW DOES NOT initialize the disabled port
03808                                                          (ie: INIT_Px=0->1), then refreshes and the HW init
03809                                                          sequence WILL NOT occur for the disabled port.
03810                                                          If LPP_ENA=1 and SW does initialize the disabled port
03811                                                          (INIT_Px=0->1 with ENA_Px=0), then refreshes and
03812                                                          the HW init sequence WILL occur to the disabled port. */
03813     uint64_t bunk_init                    : 2;  /**< Controls the CS_N[1:0] during a) a HW Initialization
03814                                                          sequence (triggered by DFA_MEMCFG0[INIT_Px]) or
03815                                                          b) during a normal refresh sequence. If
03816                                                          the BNK_INIT[x]=1, the corresponding CS_N[x] is driven.
03817                                                          NOTE: This is required for DRAM used in a
03818                                                          clamshell configuration, since the address lines
03819                                                          carry Mode Register write data that is unique
03820                                                          per bunk(or clam). In a clamshell configuration,
03821                                                          The N3K A[x] pin may be tied into Clam#0's A[x]
03822                                                          and also into Clam#1's 'mirrored' address bit A[y]
03823                                                          (eg: Clam0 sees A[5] and Clam1 sees A[15]).
03824                                                          To support clamshell designs, SW must initiate
03825                                                          two separate HW init sequences for the two bunks
03826                                                          (or clams) . Before each HW init sequence is triggered,
03827                                                          SW must preload the DFA_MEMRLD[22:0] with the data
03828                                                          that will be driven onto the A[22:0] wires during
03829                                                          an MRS mode register write.
03830                                                          NOTE: After the final HW initialization sequence has
03831                                                          been triggered, SW must wait 64K eclks before writing
03832                                                          the BUNK_INIT[1:0] field = 3'b11 (so that CS_N[1:0] is
03833                                                          driven during refresh sequences in normal operation.
03834                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03835                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03836     uint64_t init_p0                      : 1;  /**< When a '1' is written (and the previous value was '0'),
03837                                                          the HW init sequence(s) for Memory Port \#0 is
03838                                                          initiated.
03839                                                          NOTE: To initialize memory, SW must:
03840                                                            1) Set up the DFA_MEMCFG0[CLKDIV] ratio for intended
03841                                                               RLDRAM operation.
03842                                                                 [legal values 0: DIV2 2: DIV3 3: DIV4]
03843                                                            2) Write a '1' into BOTH the DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDCK_RST]
03844                                                               and DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDQCK90_RST] field at
03845                                                               the SAME TIME. This step puts all three DLLs in
03846                                                               SW reset (RLDCK, RLDCK90, RLDQK90 DLLs).
03847                                                            3) Write a '0' into the DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDCK_RST] field.
03848                                                               This step takes the RLDCK DLL out of soft-reset so
03849                                                               that the DLL can generate the RLDx_CK_H/L clock pins.
03850                                                            4) Wait 1ms (for RLDCK DLL to achieve lock)
03851                                                            5) Write a '0' into DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDQCK90_RST] field.
03852                                                               This step takes the RLDCK90 DLL AND RLDQK90 DLL out
03853                                                               of soft-reset.
03854                                                            6) Wait 1ms (for RLDCK90/RLDQK90 DLLs to achieve lock)
03855                                                            7) Enable memory port(s):  ENA_P0=1/ENA_P1=1
03856                                                            8) Wait 100us (to ensure a stable clock
03857                                                               to the RLDRAMs) - as per RLDRAM spec.
03858                                                            - - - - - Hardware Initialization Sequence - - - - -
03859                                                            9) Setup the DFA_MEMCFG0[BUNK_INIT] for the bunk(s)
03860                                                               intended to be initialized.
03861                                                           10) Write a '1' to the corresponding INIT_Px which
03862                                                               will initiate a hardware initialization
03863                                                               sequence to that'specific' port.
03864                                                           11) Wait (DFA_MEMCFG0[CLKDIV] * 32K) eclk cycles.
03865                                                               [to ensure the HW init sequence has completed
03866                                                               before writing to ANY of the DFA_MEM* registers]
03867                                                            - - - - - Hardware Initialization Sequence - - - - -
03868                                                           12) Write the DFA_MEMCFG0[BUNK_INIT]=3 to enable
03869                                                               refreshes to BOTH bunks.
03870                                                          NOTE: In some cases (where the address wires are routed
03871                                                          differently between the front and back 'bunks'),
03872                                                          SW will need to use DFA_MEMCFG0[BUNK_INIT] bits to
03873                                                          control the Hardware initialization sequence for a
03874                                                          'specific bunk'. In these cases, SW would setup the
03875                                                          BUNK_INIT and repeat Steps \#9-11 for each bunk/port.
03876                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03877                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
03878                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#0 corresponds to the Octeon
03879                                                          RLD0_* pins. */
03880     uint64_t init_p1                      : 1;  /**< When a '1' is written (and the previous value was '0'),
03881                                                          the HW init sequence(s) for Memory Port \#1 is
03882                                                          initiated.
03883                                                          NOTE: To initialize memory, SW must:
03884                                                            1) Set up the DFA_MEMCFG0[CLKDIV] ratio for intended
03885                                                               RLDRAM operation.
03886                                                                 [legal values 0: DIV2 2: DIV3 3: DIV4]
