03887                                                            2) Write a '1' into BOTH the DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDCK_RST]
03888                                                               and DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDQCK90_RST] field at
03889                                                               the SAME TIME. This step puts all three DLLs in
03890                                                               SW reset (RLDCK, RLDCK90, RLDQK90 DLLs).
03891                                                            3) Write a '0' into the DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDCK_RST] field.
03892                                                               This step takes the RLDCK DLL out of soft-reset so
03893                                                               that the DLL can generate the RLDx_CK_H/L clock pins.
03894                                                            4) Wait 1ms (for RLDCK DLL to achieve lock)
03895                                                            5) Write a '0' into DFA_MEM_CFG0[RLDQCK90_RST] field.
03896                                                               This step takes the RLDCK90 DLL AND RLDQK90 DLL out
03897                                                               of soft-reset.
03898                                                            6) Wait 1ms (for RLDCK90/RLDQK90 DLLs to achieve lock)
03899                                                            7) Enable memory port(s) ENA_P0=1/ENA_P1=1
03900                                                            8) Wait 100us (to ensure a stable clock
03901                                                               to the RLDRAMs) - as per RLDRAM spec.
03902                                                            - - - - - Hardware Initialization Sequence - - - - -
03903                                                            9) Setup the DFA_MEMCFG0[BUNK_INIT] for the bunk(s)
03904                                                               intended to be initialized.
03905                                                           10) Write a '1' to the corresponding INIT_Px which
03906                                                               will initiate a hardware initialization
03907                                                               sequence to that'specific' port.
03908                                                           11) Wait (DFA_MEMCFG0[CLKDIV] * 32K) eclk cycles.
03909                                                               [to ensure the HW init sequence has completed
03910                                                               before writing to ANY of the DFA_MEM* registers]
03911                                                            - - - - - Hardware Initialization Sequence - - - - -
03912                                                           12) Write the DFA_MEMCFG0[BUNK_INIT]=3 to enable
03913                                                               refreshes to BOTH bunks.
03914                                                          NOTE: In some cases (where the address wires are routed
03915                                                          differently between the front and back 'bunks'),
03916                                                          SW will need to use DFA_MEMCFG0[BUNK_INIT] bits to
03917                                                          control the Hardware initialization sequence for a
03918                                                          'specific bunk'. In these cases, SW would setup the
03919                                                          BUNK_INIT and repeat Steps \#9-11 for each bunk/port.
03920                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03921                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
03922                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#1 corresponds to the Octeon
03923                                                          RLD1_* pins. */
03924     uint64_t r2r_pbunk                    : 1;  /**< When enabled, an additional command bubble is inserted
03925                                                          if back to back reads are issued to different physical
03926                                                          bunks. This is to avoid DQ data bus collisions when
03927                                                          references cross between physical bunks.
03928                                                          [NOTE: the physical bunk address boundary is determined
03929                                                          by the PBUNK bit].
03930                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03931                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03932     uint64_t pbunk                        : 3;  /**< Physical Bunk address bit pointer.
03933                                                          Specifies which address bit within the Longword
03934                                                          Memory address MA[23:0] is used to determine the
03935                                                          chip selects.
03936                                                          [RLD_CS0_N corresponds to physical bunk \#0, and
03937                                                          RLD_CS1_N corresponds to physical bunk \#1].
03938                                                            - 000: CS0_N = MA[19]/CS1_N = !MA[19]
03939                                                            - 001: CS0_N = MA[20]/CS1_N = !MA[20]
03940                                                            - 010: CS0_N = MA[21]/CS1_N = !MA[21]
03941                                                            - 011: CS0_N = MA[22]/CS1_N = !MA[22]
03942                                                            - 100: CS0_N = MA[23]/CS1_N = !MA[23]
03943                                                            - 101-111: CS0_N = 0 /CS1_N = 1
03944                                                          Example(s):
03945                                                          To build out a 128MB DFA memory, 4x 32Mx9
03946                                                          parts could be used to fill out TWO physical
03947                                                          bunks (clamshell configuration). Each (of the
03948                                                          two) physical bunks contains 2x 32Mx9 = 16Mx36.
03949                                                          Each RLDRAM device also contains 8 internal banks,
03950                                                          therefore the memory Address is 16M/8banks = 2M
03951                                                          addresses/bunk (2^21). In this case, MA[21] would
03952                                                          select the physical bunk.
03953                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03954                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
03955                                                          be used to determine the Chip Select(s). */
03956     uint64_t blen                         : 1;  /**< Device Burst Length  (0=2-burst/1=4-burst)
03957                                                          NOTE: RLDRAM-II MUST USE BLEN=0(2-burst) */
03958     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;  /**< Tristate Enable (back porch) (\#dclks)
03959                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
03960                                                          tristate disable back porch for the DQ data bus.
03961                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
03962                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
03963                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
03964                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
03965                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03966                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03967     uint64_t fprch                        : 2;  /**< Tristate Enable (front porch) (\#dclks)
03968                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
03969                                                          tristate disable front porch for the DQ data bus.
03970                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
03971                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
03972                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
03973                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
03974                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03975                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
03976     uint64_t wr_dly                       : 4;  /**< Write->Read CMD Delay (\#mclks):
03977                                                          Determines \#mclk cycles to insert when controller
03978                                                          switches from write to read. This allows programmer
03979                                                          to control the data bus contention.
03980                                                          For RLDRAM-II(BL2): (TBL=1)
03981                                                          WR_DLY = ROUND_UP[((TWL+TBL)*2 - TSKW + FPRCH) / 2] - TRL + 1
03982                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03983                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
03984                                                          NOTE: For aggressive(performance optimal) designs,
03985                                                          the WR_DLY 'may' be tuned down(-1) if bus fight
03986                                                          on W->R transitions is not pronounced. */
03987     uint64_t rw_dly                       : 4;  /**< Read->Write CMD Delay (\#mclks):
03988                                                          Determines \#mclk cycles to insert when controller
03989                                                          switches from read to write. This allows programmer
03990                                                          to control the data bus contention.
03991                                                          For RLDRAM-II(BL2): (TBL=1)
03992                                                          RW_DLY = ROUND_UP[((TRL+TBL)*2 + TSKW + BPRCH+2)/2] - TWL + 1
03993                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
03994                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
03995                                                          NOTE: For aggressive(performance optimal) designs,
03996                                                          the RW_DLY 'may' be tuned down(-1) if bus fight
03997                                                          on R->W transitions is not pronounced. */
03998     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< Silo Latency (\#dclks): On reads, determines how many
03999                                                          additional dclks to wait (on top of tRL+1) before
04000                                                          pulling data out of the padring silos used for time
04001                                                          domain boundary crossing.
04002                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04003                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04004     uint64_t mtype                        : 1;  /**< FCRAM-II Memory Type
04005                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED *** */
04006     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
04007     uint64_t ena_p0                       : 1;  /**< Enable DFA RLDRAM Port#0
04008                                                          When enabled, this bit lets N3K be the default
04009                                                          driver for memory port \#0.
04010                                                          NOTE: a customer is at
04011                                                          liberty to enable either Port#0 or Port#1 or both.
04012                                                          NOTE: Once a port has been disabled, it MUST NEVER
04013                                                          be re-enabled. [the only way to enable a port is
04014                                                          through a chip reset].
04015                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#0 corresponds to the Octeon
04016                                                          RLD0_* pins. */
04017     uint64_t ena_p1                       : 1;  /**< Enable DFA RLDRAM Port#1
04018                                                          When enabled, this bit lets N3K be the default
04019                                                          driver for memory port \#1.
04020                                                          NOTE: a customer is at
04021                                                          liberty to enable either Port#0 or Port#1 or both.
04022                                                          NOTE: Once a port has been disabled, it MUST NEVER
04023                                                          be re-enabled. [the only way to enable a port is
04024                                                          through a chip reset].
04025                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#1 corresponds to the Octeon
04026                                                          RLD1_* pins. */
04027 #else
04028     uint64_t ena_p1                       : 1;
04029     uint64_t ena_p0                       : 1;
04030     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
04031     uint64_t mtype                        : 1;
04032     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
04033     uint64_t rw_dly                       : 4;
04034     uint64_t wr_dly                       : 4;
04035     uint64_t fprch                        : 2;
04036     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;
04037     uint64_t blen                         : 1;
04038     uint64_t pbunk                        : 3;
04039     uint64_t r2r_pbunk                    : 1;
04040     uint64_t init_p1                      : 1;
04041     uint64_t init_p0                      : 1;
04042     uint64_t bunk_init                    : 2;
04043     uint64_t lpp_ena                      : 1;
04044     uint64_t clkdiv                       : 2;
04045     uint64_t rldck_rst                    : 1;
04046     uint64_t rldqck90_rst                 : 1;
04047     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
04048 #endif
04049     } s;
04050     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg0_cn38xx {
04051 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04052     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
04053     uint64_t lpp_ena                      : 1;  /**< PP Linear Port Addressing Mode Enable
04054                                                          When enabled, PP-core LLM accesses to the lower-512MB
04055                                                          LLM address space are sent to the single DFA port
04056                                                          which is enabled. NOTE: If LPP_ENA=1, only
04057                                                          one DFA RLDRAM port may be enabled for RLDRAM accesses
04058                                                          (ie: ENA_P0 and ENA_P1 CAN NEVER BOTH be set).
04059                                                          PP-core LLM accesses to the upper-512MB LLM address
04060                                                          space are sent to the other 'disabled' DFA port.
04061                                                          SW RESTRICTION: If LPP_ENA=1, then only one DFA port
04062                                                          may be enabled for RLDRAM accesses (ie: ENA_P0 and
04063                                                          ENA_P1 CAN NEVER BOTH be set).
04064                                                          NOTE: This bit is used to allow PP-Core LLM accesses to a
04065                                                          disabled port, such that each port can be sequentially
04066                                                          addressed (ie: disable LW address interleaving).
04067                                                          Enabling this bit allows BOTH PORTs to be active and
04068                                                          sequentially addressable. The single port that is
04069                                                          enabled(ENA_Px) will respond to the low-512MB LLM address
04070                                                          space, and the other 'disabled' port will respond to the
04071                                                          high-512MB LLM address space.
04072                                                          Example usage:
04073                                                             - DFA RLD0 pins used for TCAM-FPGA(CP2 accesses)
04074                                                             - DFA RLD1 pins used for RLDRAM (DTE/CP2 accesses).
04075                                                          USAGE NOTE:
04076                                                          If LPP_ENA=1 and SW DOES NOT initialize the disabled port
04077                                                          (ie: INIT_Px=0->1), then refreshes and the HW init
04078                                                          sequence WILL NOT occur for the disabled port.
04079                                                          If LPP_ENA=1 and SW does initialize the disabled port
04080                                                          (INIT_Px=0->1 with ENA_Px=0), then refreshes and
04081                                                          the HW init sequence WILL occur to the disabled port. */
04082     uint64_t bunk_init                    : 2;  /**< Controls the CS_N[1:0] during a) a HW Initialization
04083                                                          sequence (triggered by DFA_MEMCFG0[INIT_Px]) or
04084                                                          b) during a normal refresh sequence. If
04085                                                          the BNK_INIT[x]=1, the corresponding CS_N[x] is driven.
04086                                                          NOTE: This is required for DRAM used in a
04087                                                          clamshell configuration, since the address lines
04088                                                          carry Mode Register write data that is unique
04089                                                          per bunk(or clam). In a clamshell configuration,
04090                                                          The N3K A[x] pin may be tied into Clam#0's A[x]
04091                                                          and also into Clam#1's 'mirrored' address bit A[y]
04092                                                          (eg: Clam0 sees A[5] and Clam1 sees A[15]).
04093                                                          To support clamshell designs, SW must initiate
04094                                                          two separate HW init sequences for the two bunks
04095                                                          (or clams) . Before each HW init sequence is triggered,
04096                                                          SW must preload the DFA_MEMRLD[22:0] with the data
04097                                                          that will be driven onto the A[22:0] wires during
04098                                                          an MRS mode register write.
04099                                                          NOTE: After the final HW initialization sequence has
04100                                                          been triggered, SW must wait 64K eclks before writing
04101                                                          the BUNK_INIT[1:0] field = 3'b11 (so that CS_N[1:0] is
04102                                                          driven during refresh sequences in normal operation.
04103                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04104                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04105                                                          NOTE: For MTYPE=1(FCRAM) Mode, each bunk MUST BE
04106                                                          initialized independently. In other words, a HW init
04107                                                          must be done for Bunk#0, and then another HW init
04108                                                          must be done for Bunk#1 at power-on. */
04109     uint64_t init_p0                      : 1;  /**< When a '1' is written (and the previous value was '0'),
04110                                                          the HW init sequence(s) for Memory Port \#0 is
04111                                                          initiated.
04112                                                          NOTE: To initialize memory, SW must:
04113                                                            1) Enable memory port(s):
04114                                                                a) ENA_P1=1 (single port in pass 1) OR
04115                                                                b) ENA_P0=1/ENA_P1=1 (dual ports or single when not pass 1)
04116                                                            2) Wait 100us (to ensure a stable clock
04117                                                               to the RLDRAMs) - as per RLDRAM spec.
04118                                                            3) Write a '1' to the corresponding INIT_Px which
04119                                                               will initiate a hardware initialization
04120                                                               sequence.
04121                                                          NOTE: After writing a '1', SW must wait 64K eclk
04122                                                          cycles to ensure the HW init sequence has completed
04123                                                          before writing to ANY of the DFA_MEM* registers.
04124                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04125                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04126                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#0 corresponds to the Octeon
04127                                                          RLD0_* pins. */
04128     uint64_t init_p1                      : 1;  /**< When a '1' is written (and the previous value was '0'),
04129                                                          the HW init sequence(s) for Memory Port \#1 is
04130                                                          initiated.
04131                                                          NOTE: To initialize memory, SW must:
04132                                                            1) Enable memory port(s):
04133                                                                a) ENA_P1=1 (single port in pass 1) OR
04134                                                                b) ENA_P0=1/ENA_P1=1 (dual ports or single when not pass 1)
04135                                                            2) Wait 100us (to ensure a stable clock
04136                                                               to the RLDRAMs) - as per RLDRAM spec.
04137                                                            3) Write a '1' to the corresponding INIT_Px which
04138                                                               will initiate a hardware initialization
04139                                                               sequence.
04140                                                          NOTE: After writing a '1', SW must wait 64K eclk
04141                                                          cycles to ensure the HW init sequence has completed
04142                                                          before writing to ANY of the DFA_MEM* registers.
04143                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04144                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04145                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#1 corresponds to the Octeon
04146                                                          RLD1_* pins. */
04147     uint64_t r2r_pbunk                    : 1;  /**< When enabled, an additional command bubble is inserted
04148                                                          if back to back reads are issued to different physical
04149                                                          bunks. This is to avoid DQ data bus collisions when
04150                                                          references cross between physical bunks.
04151                                                          [NOTE: the physical bunk address boundary is determined
04152                                                          by the PBUNK bit].
04153                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04154                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04155                                                          When MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(2-burst), R2R_PBUNK SHOULD BE
04156                                                          ZERO(for optimal performance). However, if electrically,
04157                                                          DQ-sharing becomes a power/heat issue, then R2R_PBUNK
04158                                                          should be set (but at a cost to performance (1/2 BW). */
04159     uint64_t pbunk                        : 3;  /**< Physical Bunk address bit pointer.
04160                                                          Specifies which address bit within the Longword
04161                                                          Memory address MA[23:0] is used to determine the
04162                                                          chip selects.
04163                                                          [RLD_CS0_N corresponds to physical bunk \#0, and
04164                                                          RLD_CS1_N corresponds to physical bunk \#1].
04165                                                            - 000: CS0_N = MA[19]/CS1_N = !MA[19]
04166                                                            - 001: CS0_N = MA[20]/CS1_N = !MA[20]
04167                                                            - 010: CS0_N = MA[21]/CS1_N = !MA[21]
04168                                                            - 011: CS0_N = MA[22]/CS1_N = !MA[22]
04169                                                            - 100: CS0_N = MA[23]/CS1_N = !MA[23]
04170                                                            - 101-111: CS0_N = 0 /CS1_N = 1
04171                                                          Example(s):
04172                                                          To build out a 128MB DFA memory, 4x 32Mx9
04173                                                          parts could be used to fill out TWO physical
04174                                                          bunks (clamshell configuration). Each (of the
04175                                                          two) physical bunks contains 2x 32Mx9 = 16Mx36.
04176                                                          Each RLDRAM device also contains 8 internal banks,
04177                                                          therefore the memory Address is 16M/8banks = 2M
04178                                                          addresses/bunk (2^21). In this case, MA[21] would
04179                                                          select the physical bunk.
04180                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04181                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04182                                                          be used to determine the Chip Select(s).
04183                                                          NOTE: When MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(2-burst), a
04184                                                          "Redundant Bunk" scheme is employed to provide the
04185                                                          highest overall performance (1 Req/ MCLK cycle).
04186                                                          In this mode, it's imperative that SW set the PBUNK
04187                                                          field +1 'above' the highest address bit. (such that
04188                                                          the PBUNK extracted from the address will always be
04189                                                          zero). In this mode, the CS_N[1:0] pins are driven
04190                                                          to each redundant bunk based on a TDM scheme:
04191                                                          [MCLK-EVEN=Bunk#0/MCLK-ODD=Bunk#1]. */
04192     uint64_t blen                         : 1;  /**< Device Burst Length  (0=2-burst/1=4-burst)
04193                                                          When BLEN=0(BL2), all QW reads/writes from CP2 are
04194                                                          decomposed into 2 separate BL2(LW) requests to the
04195                                                          Low-Latency memory.
04196                                                          When BLEN=1(BL4), a LW request (from CP2 or NCB) is
04197                                                          treated as 1 BL4(QW) request to the low latency memory.
04198                                                          NOTE: QW refers to a 64-bit LLM Load/Store (intiated
04199                                                          by a processor core). LW refers to a 36-bit load/store.
04200                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04201                                                          during power-on SW initialization before the DFA LLM
04202                                                          (low latency memory) is used.
04203                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=0(RLDRAM-II) MUST USE BLEN=0(2-burst)
04204                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(BL2) requires a
04205                                                          multi-bunk(clam) board design.
04206                                                          NOTE: If MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/FCRAM2P=0(II)/BLEN=1(BL4),
04207                                                          SW SHOULD use CP2 QW read/write requests (for
04208                                                          optimal low-latency bus performance).
04209                                                          [LW length read/write requests(in BL4 mode) use 50%
04210                                                          of the available bus bandwidth]
04211                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/FCRAM2P=0(II)/BLEN=0(BL2) can only
04212                                                          be used with FCRAM-II devices which support BL2 mode
04213                                                          (see: Toshiba FCRAM-II, where DQ tristate after 2 data
04214                                                          transfers).
04215                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/FCRAM2P=1(II+) does not support LW
04216                                                          write requests (FCRAM-II+ device specification has removed
04217                                                          the variable write mask function from the devices).
04218                                                          As such, if this mode is used, SW must be careful to
04219                                                          issue only PP-CP2 QW write requests. */
04220     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;  /**< Tristate Enable (back porch) (\#dclks)
04221                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
04222                                                          tristate disable back porch for the DQ data bus.
04223                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
04224                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
04225                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
04226                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
04227                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04228                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04229     uint64_t fprch                        : 2;  /**< Tristate Enable (front porch) (\#dclks)
04230                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
04231                                                          tristate disable front porch for the DQ data bus.
04232                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
04233                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
04234                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
04235                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
04236                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04237                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04238     uint64_t wr_dly                       : 4;  /**< Write->Read CMD Delay (\#mclks):
04239                                                          Determines \#mclk cycles to insert when controller
04240                                                          switches from write to read. This allows programmer
04241                                                          to control the data bus contention.
04242                                                          For RLDRAM-II(BL2): (TBL=1)
04243                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL4): (TBL=2)
04244                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL2 grepl=1x ONLY): (TBL=1)
04245                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL2 grepl>=2x): (TBL=3)
04246                                                             NOTE: When MTYTPE=1(FCRAM-II) BLEN=0(BL2 Mode),
04247                                                             grepl>=2x, writes require redundant bunk writes
04248                                                             which require an additional 2 cycles before slotting
04249                                                             the next read.
04250                                                          WR_DLY = ROUND_UP[((TWL+TBL)*2 - TSKW + FPRCH) / 2] - TRL + 1
04251                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04252                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04253                                                          NOTE: For aggressive(performance optimal) designs,
04254                                                          the WR_DLY 'may' be tuned down(-1) if bus fight
04255                                                          on W->R transitions is not pronounced. */
04256     uint64_t rw_dly                       : 4;  /**< Read->Write CMD Delay (\#mclks):
04257                                                          Determines \#mclk cycles to insert when controller
04258                                                          switches from read to write. This allows programmer
04259                                                          to control the data bus contention.
04260                                                          For RLDRAM-II/FCRAM-II (BL2): (TBL=1)
04261                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL4): (TBL=2)
04262                                                          RW_DLY = ROUND_UP[((TRL+TBL)*2 + TSKW + BPRCH+2)/2] - TWL + 1
04263                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04264                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04265                                                          NOTE: For aggressive(performance optimal) designs,
04266                                                          the RW_DLY 'may' be tuned down(-1) if bus fight
04267                                                          on R->W transitions is not pronounced. */
04268     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< Silo Latency (\#dclks): On reads, determines how many
04269                                                          additional dclks to wait (on top of tRL+1) before
04270                                                          pulling data out of the padring silos used for time
04271                                                          domain boundary crossing.
04272                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04273                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04274     uint64_t mtype                        : 1;  /**< Memory Type (0=RLDRAM-II/1=Network DRAM-II/FCRAM)
04275                                                          NOTE: N3K-P1 only supports RLDRAM-II
04276                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04277                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04278                                                          NOTE: When MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(2-burst), only the
04279                                                          "unidirectional DS/QS" mode is supported. (see FCRAM
04280                                                          data sheet EMRS[A6:A5]=SS(Strobe Select) register
04281                                                          definition. [in FCRAM 2-burst mode, we use FCRAM
04282                                                          in a clamshell configuration such that clam0 is
04283                                                          addressed independently of clam1, and DQ is shared
04284                                                          for optimal performance. As such it's imperative that
04285                                                          the QS are conditionally received (and are NOT
04286                                                          free-running), as the N3K receive data capture silos
04287                                                          OR the clam0/1 QS strobes.
04288                                                          NOTE: If this bit is SET, the ASX0/1
04289                                                          ASX_RLD_FCRAM_MODE[MODE] bit(s) should also be SET
04290                                                          in order for the RLD0/1-PHY(s) to support FCRAM devices. */
04291     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
04292     uint64_t ena_p0                       : 1;  /**< Enable DFA RLDRAM Port#0
04293                                                          When enabled, this bit lets N3K be the default
04294                                                          driver for memory port \#0.
04295                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P1, to enable Port#0(2nd port),
04296                                                          Port#1 MUST ALSO be enabled.
04297                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P2, single port mode, a customer is at
04298                                                          liberty to enable either Port#0 or Port#1.
04299                                                          NOTE: Once a port has been disabled, it MUST NEVER
04300                                                          be re-enabled. [the only way to enable a port is
04301                                                          through a chip reset].
04302                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#0 corresponds to the Octeon
04303                                                          RLD0_* pins. */
04304     uint64_t ena_p1                       : 1;  /**< Enable DFA RLDRAM Port#1
04305                                                          When enabled, this bit lets N3K be the default
04306                                                          driver for memory port \#1.
04307                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P1, If the customer wishes to use a
04308                                                          single port, s/he must enable Port#1 (and not Port#0).
04309                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P2, single port mode, a customer is at
04310                                                          liberty to enable either Port#0 or Port#1.
04311                                                          NOTE: Once a port has been disabled, it MUST NEVER
04312                                                          be re-enabled. [the only way to enable a port is
04313                                                          through a chip reset].
04314                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#1 corresponds to the Octeon
04315                                                          RLD1_* pins. */
04316 #else
04317     uint64_t ena_p1                       : 1;
04318     uint64_t ena_p0                       : 1;
04319     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
04320     uint64_t mtype                        : 1;
04321     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
04322     uint64_t rw_dly                       : 4;
04323     uint64_t wr_dly                       : 4;
04324     uint64_t fprch                        : 2;
04325     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;
04326     uint64_t blen                         : 1;
04327     uint64_t pbunk                        : 3;
04328     uint64_t r2r_pbunk                    : 1;
04329     uint64_t init_p1                      : 1;
04330     uint64_t init_p0                      : 1;
04331     uint64_t bunk_init                    : 2;
04332     uint64_t lpp_ena                      : 1;
04333     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
04334 #endif
04335     } cn38xx;
04336     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg0_cn38xxp2 {
04337 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04338     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
04339     uint64_t bunk_init                    : 2;  /**< Controls the CS_N[1:0] during a) a HW Initialization
04340                                                          sequence (triggered by DFA_MEMCFG0[INIT_Px]) or
04341                                                          b) during a normal refresh sequence. If
04342                                                          the BNK_INIT[x]=1, the corresponding CS_N[x] is driven.
04343                                                          NOTE: This is required for DRAM used in a
04344                                                          clamshell configuration, since the address lines
04345                                                          carry Mode Register write data that is unique
04346                                                          per bunk(or clam). In a clamshell configuration,
04347                                                          The N3K A[x] pin may be tied into Clam#0's A[x]
04348                                                          and also into Clam#1's 'mirrored' address bit A[y]
04349                                                          (eg: Clam0 sees A[5] and Clam1 sees A[15]).
04350                                                          To support clamshell designs, SW must initiate
04351                                                          two separate HW init sequences for the two bunks
04352                                                          (or clams) . Before each HW init sequence is triggered,
04353                                                          SW must preload the DFA_MEMRLD[22:0] with the data
04354                                                          that will be driven onto the A[22:0] wires during
04355                                                          an MRS mode register write.
04356                                                          NOTE: After the final HW initialization sequence has
04357                                                          been triggered, SW must wait 64K eclks before writing
04358                                                          the BUNK_INIT[1:0] field = 3'b11 (so that CS_N[1:0] is
04359                                                          driven during refresh sequences in normal operation.
04360                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04361                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04362                                                          NOTE: For MTYPE=1(FCRAM) Mode, each bunk MUST BE
04363                                                          initialized independently. In other words, a HW init
04364                                                          must be done for Bunk#0, and then another HW init
04365                                                          must be done for Bunk#1 at power-on. */
04366     uint64_t init_p0                      : 1;  /**< When a '1' is written (and the previous value was '0'),
04367                                                          the HW init sequence(s) for Memory Port \#0 is
04368                                                          initiated.
04369                                                          NOTE: To initialize memory, SW must:
04370                                                            1) Enable memory port(s):
04371                                                                a) ENA_P1=1 (single port in pass 1) OR
04372                                                                b) ENA_P0=1/ENA_P1=1 (dual ports or single when not pass 1)
04373                                                            2) Wait 100us (to ensure a stable clock
04374                                                               to the RLDRAMs) - as per RLDRAM spec.
04375                                                            3) Write a '1' to the corresponding INIT_Px which
04376                                                               will initiate a hardware initialization
04377                                                               sequence.
04378                                                          NOTE: After writing a '1', SW must wait 64K eclk
04379                                                          cycles to ensure the HW init sequence has completed
04380                                                          before writing to ANY of the DFA_MEM* registers.
04381                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04382                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04383                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#0 corresponds to the Octeon
04384                                                          RLD0_* pins. */
04385     uint64_t init_p1                      : 1;  /**< When a '1' is written (and the previous value was '0'),
04386                                                          the HW init sequence(s) for Memory Port \#1 is
04387                                                          initiated.
04388                                                          NOTE: To initialize memory, SW must:
04389                                                            1) Enable memory port(s):
04390                                                                a) ENA_P1=1 (single port in pass 1) OR
04391                                                                b) ENA_P0=1/ENA_P1=1 (dual ports or single when not pass 1)
04392                                                            2) Wait 100us (to ensure a stable clock
04393                                                               to the RLDRAMs) - as per RLDRAM spec.
04394                                                            3) Write a '1' to the corresponding INIT_Px which
04395                                                               will initiate a hardware initialization
04396                                                               sequence.
04397                                                          NOTE: After writing a '1', SW must wait 64K eclk
04398                                                          cycles to ensure the HW init sequence has completed
04399                                                          before writing to ANY of the DFA_MEM* registers.
04400                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04401                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04402                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#1 corresponds to the Octeon
04403                                                          RLD1_* pins. */
04404     uint64_t r2r_pbunk                    : 1;  /**< When enabled, an additional command bubble is inserted
04405                                                          if back to back reads are issued to different physical
04406                                                          bunks. This is to avoid DQ data bus collisions when
04407                                                          references cross between physical bunks.
04408                                                          [NOTE: the physical bunk address boundary is determined
04409                                                          by the PBUNK bit].
04410                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04411                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04412                                                          When MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(2-burst), R2R_PBUNK SHOULD BE
04413                                                          ZERO(for optimal performance). However, if electrically,
04414                                                          DQ-sharing becomes a power/heat issue, then R2R_PBUNK
04415                                                          should be set (but at a cost to performance (1/2 BW). */
04416     uint64_t pbunk                        : 3;  /**< Physical Bunk address bit pointer.
04417                                                          Specifies which address bit within the Longword
04418                                                          Memory address MA[23:0] is used to determine the
04419                                                          chip selects.
04420                                                          [RLD_CS0_N corresponds to physical bunk \#0, and
04421                                                          RLD_CS1_N corresponds to physical bunk \#1].
04422                                                            - 000: CS0_N = MA[19]/CS1_N = !MA[19]
04423                                                            - 001: CS0_N = MA[20]/CS1_N = !MA[20]
04424                                                            - 010: CS0_N = MA[21]/CS1_N = !MA[21]
04425                                                            - 011: CS0_N = MA[22]/CS1_N = !MA[22]
04426                                                            - 100: CS0_N = MA[23]/CS1_N = !MA[23]
04427                                                            - 101-111: CS0_N = 0 /CS1_N = 1
04428                                                          Example(s):
04429                                                          To build out a 128MB DFA memory, 4x 32Mx9
04430                                                          parts could be used to fill out TWO physical
04431                                                          bunks (clamshell configuration). Each (of the
04432                                                          two) physical bunks contains 2x 32Mx9 = 16Mx36.
04433                                                          Each RLDRAM device also contains 8 internal banks,
04434                                                          therefore the memory Address is 16M/8banks = 2M
04435                                                          addresses/bunk (2^21). In this case, MA[21] would
04436                                                          select the physical bunk.
04437                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04438                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04439                                                          be used to determine the Chip Select(s).
04440                                                          NOTE: When MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(2-burst), a
04441                                                          "Redundant Bunk" scheme is employed to provide the
04442                                                          highest overall performance (1 Req/ MCLK cycle).
04443                                                          In this mode, it's imperative that SW set the PBUNK
04444                                                          field +1 'above' the highest address bit. (such that
04445                                                          the PBUNK extracted from the address will always be
04446                                                          zero). In this mode, the CS_N[1:0] pins are driven
04447                                                          to each redundant bunk based on a TDM scheme:
04448                                                          [MCLK-EVEN=Bunk#0/MCLK-ODD=Bunk#1]. */
04449     uint64_t blen                         : 1;  /**< Device Burst Length  (0=2-burst/1=4-burst)
04450                                                          When BLEN=0(BL2), all QW reads/writes from CP2 are
04451                                                          decomposed into 2 separate BL2(LW) requests to the
04452                                                          Low-Latency memory.
04453                                                          When BLEN=1(BL4), a LW request (from CP2 or NCB) is
04454                                                          treated as 1 BL4(QW) request to the low latency memory.
04455                                                          NOTE: QW refers to a 64-bit LLM Load/Store (intiated
04456                                                          by a processor core). LW refers to a 36-bit load/store.
04457                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04458                                                          during power-on SW initialization before the DFA LLM
04459                                                          (low latency memory) is used.
04460                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=0(RLDRAM-II) MUST USE BLEN=0(2-burst)
04461                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(BL2) requires a
04462                                                          multi-bunk(clam) board design.
04463                                                          NOTE: If MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/FCRAM2P=0(II)/BLEN=1(BL4),
04464                                                          SW SHOULD use CP2 QW read/write requests (for
04465                                                          optimal low-latency bus performance).
04466                                                          [LW length read/write requests(in BL4 mode) use 50%
04467                                                          of the available bus bandwidth]
04468                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/FCRAM2P=0(II)/BLEN=0(BL2) can only
04469                                                          be used with FCRAM-II devices which support BL2 mode
04470                                                          (see: Toshiba FCRAM-II, where DQ tristate after 2 data
04471                                                          transfers).
04472                                                          NOTE: MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/FCRAM2P=1(II+) does not support LW
04473                                                          write requests (FCRAM-II+ device specification has removed
04474                                                          the variable write mask function from the devices).
04475                                                          As such, if this mode is used, SW must be careful to
04476                                                          issue only PP-CP2 QW write requests. */
04477     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;  /**< Tristate Enable (back porch) (\#dclks)
04478                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
04479                                                          tristate disable back porch for the DQ data bus.
04480                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
04481                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
04482                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
04483                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
04484                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04485                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04486     uint64_t fprch                        : 2;  /**< Tristate Enable (front porch) (\#dclks)
04487                                                          On reads, allows user to control the shape of the
04488                                                          tristate disable front porch for the DQ data bus.
04489                                                          This parameter is also very dependent on the
04490                                                          RW_DLY and WR_DLY parameters and care must be
04491                                                          taken when programming these parameters to avoid
04492                                                          data bus contention. Valid range [0..2]
04493                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04494                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04495     uint64_t wr_dly                       : 4;  /**< Write->Read CMD Delay (\#mclks):
04496                                                          Determines \#mclk cycles to insert when controller
04497                                                          switches from write to read. This allows programmer
04498                                                          to control the data bus contention.
04499                                                          For RLDRAM-II(BL2): (TBL=1)
04500                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL4): (TBL=2)
04501                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL2 grepl=1x ONLY): (TBL=1)
04502                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL2 grepl>=2x): (TBL=3)
04503                                                             NOTE: When MTYTPE=1(FCRAM-II) BLEN=0(BL2 Mode),
04504                                                             grepl>=2x, writes require redundant bunk writes
04505                                                             which require an additional 2 cycles before slotting
04506                                                             the next read.
04507                                                          WR_DLY = ROUND_UP[((TWL+TBL)*2 - TSKW + FPRCH) / 2] - TRL + 1
04508                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04509                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04510                                                          NOTE: For aggressive(performance optimal) designs,
04511                                                          the WR_DLY 'may' be tuned down(-1) if bus fight
04512                                                          on W->R transitions is not pronounced. */
04513     uint64_t rw_dly                       : 4;  /**< Read->Write CMD Delay (\#mclks):
04514                                                          Determines \#mclk cycles to insert when controller
04515                                                          switches from read to write. This allows programmer
04516                                                          to control the data bus contention.
04517                                                          For RLDRAM-II/FCRAM-II (BL2): (TBL=1)
04518                                                          For FCRAM-II (BL4): (TBL=2)
04519                                                          RW_DLY = ROUND_UP[((TRL+TBL)*2 + TSKW + BPRCH+2)/2] - TWL + 1
04520                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04521                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04522                                                          NOTE: For aggressive(performance optimal) designs,
04523                                                          the RW_DLY 'may' be tuned down(-1) if bus fight
04524                                                          on R->W transitions is not pronounced. */
04525     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;  /**< Silo Latency (\#dclks): On reads, determines how many
04526                                                          additional dclks to wait (on top of tRL+1) before
04527                                                          pulling data out of the padring silos used for time
04528                                                          domain boundary crossing.
04529                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04530                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04531     uint64_t mtype                        : 1;  /**< Memory Type (0=RLDRAM-II/1=Network DRAM-II/FCRAM)
04532                                                          NOTE: N3K-P1 only supports RLDRAM-II
04533                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04534                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04535                                                          NOTE: When MTYPE=1(FCRAM)/BLEN=0(2-burst), only the
04536                                                          "unidirectional DS/QS" mode is supported. (see FCRAM
04537                                                          data sheet EMRS[A6:A5]=SS(Strobe Select) register
04538                                                          definition. [in FCRAM 2-burst mode, we use FCRAM
04539                                                          in a clamshell configuration such that clam0 is
04540                                                          addressed independently of clam1, and DQ is shared
04541                                                          for optimal performance. As such it's imperative that
04542                                                          the QS are conditionally received (and are NOT
04543                                                          free-running), as the N3K receive data capture silos
04544                                                          OR the clam0/1 QS strobes.
04545                                                          NOTE: If this bit is SET, the ASX0/1
04546                                                          ASX_RLD_FCRAM_MODE[MODE] bit(s) should also be SET
04547                                                          in order for the RLD0/1-PHY(s) to support FCRAM devices. */
04548     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
04549     uint64_t ena_p0                       : 1;  /**< Enable DFA RLDRAM Port#0
04550                                                          When enabled, this bit lets N3K be the default
04551                                                          driver for memory port \#0.
04552                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P1, to enable Port#0(2nd port),
04553                                                          Port#1 MUST ALSO be enabled.
04554                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P2, single port mode, a customer is at
04555                                                          liberty to enable either Port#0 or Port#1.
04556                                                          NOTE: Once a port has been disabled, it MUST NEVER
04557                                                          be re-enabled. [the only way to enable a port is
04558                                                          through a chip reset].
04559                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#0 corresponds to the Octeon
04560                                                          RLD0_* pins. */
04561     uint64_t ena_p1                       : 1;  /**< Enable DFA RLDRAM Port#1
04562                                                          When enabled, this bit lets N3K be the default
04563                                                          driver for memory port \#1.
04564                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P1, If the customer wishes to use a
04565                                                          single port, s/he must enable Port#1 (and not Port#0).
04566                                                          NOTE: For N3K-P2, single port mode, a customer is at
04567                                                          liberty to enable either Port#0 or Port#1.
04568                                                          NOTE: Once a port has been disabled, it MUST NEVER
04569                                                          be re-enabled. [the only way to enable a port is
04570                                                          through a chip reset].
04571                                                          NOTE: DFA Memory Port#1 corresponds to the Octeon
04572                                                          RLD1_* pins. */
04573 #else
04574     uint64_t ena_p1                       : 1;
04575     uint64_t ena_p0                       : 1;
04576     uint64_t reserved_2_2                 : 1;
04577     uint64_t mtype                        : 1;
04578     uint64_t sil_lat                      : 2;
04579     uint64_t rw_dly                       : 4;
04580     uint64_t wr_dly                       : 4;
04581     uint64_t fprch                        : 2;
04582     uint64_t bprch                        : 2;
04583     uint64_t blen                         : 1;
04584     uint64_t pbunk                        : 3;
04585     uint64_t r2r_pbunk                    : 1;
04586     uint64_t init_p1                      : 1;
04587     uint64_t init_p0                      : 1;
04588     uint64_t bunk_init                    : 2;
04589     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
04590 #endif
04591     } cn38xxp2;
04592     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg0_s             cn58xx;
04593     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg0_s             cn58xxp1;
04594 };
04595 typedef union cvmx_dfa_memcfg0 cvmx_dfa_memcfg0_t;
04596 
04597 /**
04598  * cvmx_dfa_memcfg1
04599  *
04600  * DFA_MEMCFG1 = RLDRAM Memory Timing Configuration
04601  *
04602  * Description:
04603  */
04604 union cvmx_dfa_memcfg1 {
04605     uint64_t u64;
04606     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg1_s {
04607 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04608     uint64_t reserved_34_63               : 30;
04609     uint64_t ref_intlo                    : 9;  /**< Burst Refresh Interval[8:0] (\#dclks)
04610                                                          For finer refresh interval granularity control.
04611                                                          This field provides an additional level of granularity
04612                                                          for the refresh interval. It specifies the additional
04613                                                          \#dclks [0...511] to be added to the REF_INT[3:0] field.
04614                                                          For RLDRAM-II: For dclk(400MHz=2.5ns):
04615                                                          Example: 64K AREF cycles required within tREF=32ms
04616                                                              trefint = tREF(ms)/(64K cycles/8banks)
04617                                                                          = 32ms/8K = 3.9us = 3900ns
04618                                                              REF_INT[3:0] = ROUND_DOWN[(trefint/dclk)/512]
04619                                                                           = ROUND_DOWN[(3900/2.5)/512]
04620                                                                           = 3
04621                                                              REF_INTLO[8:0] = MOD[(trefint/dclk)/512]
04622                                                                             = MOD[(3900/2.5)/512]
04623                                                                             = 24
04624                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04625                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04626     uint64_t aref_ena                     : 1;  /**< Auto Refresh Cycle Enable
04627                                                          INTERNAL USE ONLY:
04628                                                          NOTE: This mode bit is ONLY intended to be used by
04629                                                          low-level power-on initialization routines in the
04630                                                          event that the hardware initialization routine
04631                                                          does not work. It allows SW to create AREF
04632                                                          commands on the RLDRAM bus directly.
04633                                                          When this bit is set, ALL RLDRAM writes (issued by
04634                                                          a PP through the NCB or CP2) are converted to AREF
04635                                                          commands on the RLDRAM bus. The write-address is
04636                                                          presented on the A[20:0]/BA[2:0] pins (for which
04637                                                          the RLDRAM only interprets BA[2:0]).
04638                                                          When this bit is set, only writes are allowed
04639                                                          and MUST use grepl=0 (1x).
04640                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04641                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04642                                                          NOTE: MRS_ENA and AREF_ENA are mutually exclusive
04643                                                          (SW can set one or the other, but never both!)
04644                                                          NOTE: AREF commands generated using this method target
04645                                                          the 'addressed' bunk. */
04646     uint64_t mrs_ena                      : 1;  /**< Mode Register Set Cycle Enable
04647                                                          INTERNAL USE ONLY:
04648                                                          NOTE: This mode bit is ONLY intended to be used by
04649                                                          low-level power-on initialization routines in the
04650                                                          event that the hardware initialization routine
04651                                                          does not work. It allows SW to create MRS
04652                                                          commands on the RLDRAM bus directly.
04653                                                          When this bit is set, ALL RLDRAM writes (issued by
04654                                                          a PP through the NCB or CP2) are converted to MRS
04655                                                          commands on the RLDRAM bus. The write-address is
04656                                                          presented on the A[20:0]/BA[2:0] pins (for which
04657                                                          the RLDRAM only interprets A[17:0]).
04658                                                          When this bit is set, only writes are allowed
04659                                                          and MUST use grepl=0 (1x).
04660                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04661                                                          during power-on SW initialization.
04662                                                          NOTE: MRS_ENA and AREF_ENA are mutually exclusive
04663                                                          (SW can set one or the other, but never both!)
04664                                                          NOTE: MRS commands generated using this method target
04665                                                          the 'addressed' bunk. */
04666     uint64_t tmrsc                        : 3;  /**< Mode Register Set Cycle Time (represented in \#mclks)
04667                                                               - 000-001: RESERVED
04668                                                               - 010: tMRSC = 2 mclks
04669                                                               - 011: tMRSC = 3 mclks
04670                                                               - ...
04671                                                               - 111: tMRSC = 7 mclks
04672                                                          NOTE: The device tMRSC parameter is a function of CL
04673                                                          (which during HW initialization is not known. Its
04674                                                          recommended to load tMRSC(MAX) value to avoid timing
04675                                                          violations.
04676                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04677                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04678     uint64_t trc                          : 4;  /**< Row Cycle Time (represented in \#mclks)
04679                                                          see also: DFA_MEMRLD[RLCFG] field which must
04680                                                          correspond with tRL/tWL parameter(s).
04681                                                               - 0000-0010: RESERVED
04682                                                               - 0011: tRC = 3 mclks
04683                                                               - 0100: tRC = 4 mclks
04684                                                               - 0101: tRC = 5 mclks
04685                                                               - 0110: tRC = 6 mclks
04686                                                               - 0111: tRC = 7 mclks
04687                                                               - 1000: tRC = 8 mclks
