04688                                                               - 1001: tRC = 9 mclks
04689                                                               - 1010-1111: RESERVED
04690                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04691                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04692     uint64_t twl                          : 4;  /**< Write Latency (represented in \#mclks)
04693                                                          see also: DFA_MEMRLD[RLCFG] field which must
04694                                                          correspond with tRL/tWL parameter(s).
04695                                                               - 0000-0001: RESERVED
04696                                                               - 0010: Write Latency (WL=2.0 mclk)
04697                                                               - 0011: Write Latency (WL=3.0 mclks)
04698                                                               - 0100: Write Latency (WL=4.0 mclks)
04699                                                               - 0101: Write Latency (WL=5.0 mclks)
04700                                                               - 0110: Write Latency (WL=6.0 mclks)
04701                                                               - 0111: Write Latency (WL=7.0 mclks)
04702                                                               - 1000: Write Latency (WL=8.0 mclks)
04703                                                               - 1001: Write Latency (WL=9.0 mclks)
04704                                                               - 1010: Write Latency (WL=10.0 mclks)
04705                                                               - 1011-1111: RESERVED
04706                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04707                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04708     uint64_t trl                          : 4;  /**< Read Latency (represented in \#mclks)
04709                                                          see also: DFA_MEMRLD[RLCFG] field which must
04710                                                          correspond with tRL/tWL parameter(s).
04711                                                               - 0000-0010: RESERVED
04712                                                               - 0011: Read Latency = 3 mclks
04713                                                               - 0100: Read Latency = 4 mclks
04714                                                               - 0101: Read Latency = 5 mclks
04715                                                               - 0110: Read Latency = 6 mclks
04716                                                               - 0111: Read Latency = 7 mclks
04717                                                               - 1000: Read Latency = 8 mclks
04718                                                               - 1001: Read Latency = 9 mclks
04719                                                               - 1010: Read Latency = 10 mclks
04720                                                               - 1011-1111: RESERVED
04721                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04722                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04723     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
04724     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;  /**< Board Skew (represented in \#dclks)
04725                                                          Represents additional board skew of DQ/DQS.
04726                                                              - 00: board-skew = 0 dclk
04727                                                              - 01: board-skew = 1 dclk
04728                                                              - 10: board-skew = 2 dclk
04729                                                              - 11: board-skew = 3 dclk
04730                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04731                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04732     uint64_t ref_int                      : 4;  /**< Refresh Interval (represented in \#of 512 dclk
04733                                                          increments).
04734                                                               - 0000: RESERVED
04735                                                               - 0001: 1 * 512  = 512 dclks
04736                                                               - ...
04737                                                               - 1111: 15 * 512 = 7680 dclks
04738                                                          NOTE: For finer level of granularity, refer to
04739                                                          REF_INTLO[8:0] field.
04740                                                          For RLDRAM-II, each refresh interval will
04741                                                          generate a burst of 8 AREF commands, one to each of
04742                                                          8 explicit banks (referenced using the RLD_BA[2:0]
04743                                                          pins.
04744                                                          Example: For mclk=200MHz/dclk(400MHz=2.5ns):
04745                                                            64K AREF cycles required within tREF=32ms
04746                                                              trefint = tREF(ms)/(64K cycles/8banks)
04747                                                                      = 32ms/8K = 3.9us = 3900ns
04748                                                              REF_INT = ROUND_DOWN[(trefint/dclk)/512]
04749                                                                      = ROUND_DOWN[(3900/2.5)/512]
04750                                                                      = 3
04751                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
04752                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
04753 #else
04754     uint64_t ref_int                      : 4;
04755     uint64_t tskw                         : 2;
04756     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
04757     uint64_t trl                          : 4;
04758     uint64_t twl                          : 4;
04759     uint64_t trc                          : 4;
04760     uint64_t tmrsc                        : 3;
04761     uint64_t mrs_ena                      : 1;
04762     uint64_t aref_ena                     : 1;
04763     uint64_t ref_intlo                    : 9;
04764     uint64_t reserved_34_63               : 30;
04765 #endif
04766     } s;
04767     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg1_s             cn38xx;
04768     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg1_s             cn38xxp2;
04769     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg1_s             cn58xx;
04770     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg1_s             cn58xxp1;
04771 };
04772 typedef union cvmx_dfa_memcfg1 cvmx_dfa_memcfg1_t;
04773 
04774 /**
04775  * cvmx_dfa_memcfg2
04776  *
04777  * DFA_MEMCFG2 = DFA Memory Config Register \#2
04778  * *** NOTE: Pass2 Addition
04779  *
04780  * Description: Additional Memory Configuration CSRs to support FCRAM-II/II+ and Network DRAM-II
04781  */
04782 union cvmx_dfa_memcfg2 {
04783     uint64_t u64;
04784     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg2_s {
04785 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04786     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
04787     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;  /**< DFA DTE Clock Disable
04788                                                          When SET, the DFA clocks for DTE(thread engine)
04789                                                          operation are disabled.
04790                                                          NOTE: When SET, SW MUST NEVER issue ANY operations to
04791                                                          the DFA via the NCB Bus. All DFA Operations must be
04792                                                          issued solely through the CP2 interface.
04793 
04794                                                          NOTE: When DTECLKDIS=1, if CP2 Errors are encountered
04795                                                          (ie: CP2SBE, CP2DBE, CP2PERR), the DFA_MEMFADR CSR
04796                                                          does not reflect the failing address/ctl information. */
04797     uint64_t silrst                       : 1;  /**< LLM-PHY Silo Reset
04798                                                          When a '1' is written (when the previous
04799                                                          value was a '0') causes the the LLM-PHY Silo read/write
04800                                                          pointers to be reset.
04801                                                          NOTE: SW MUST WAIT 400 dclks after the LAST HW Init
04802                                                          sequence was launched (ie: INIT_START 0->1 CSR write),
04803                                                          before the SILRST can be triggered (0->1). */
04804     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;  /**< FCRAM-II Refresh Interval
04805                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED *** */
04806     uint64_t refshort                     : 1;  /**< FCRAM Short Refresh Mode
04807                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED *** */
04808     uint64_t ua_start                     : 2;  /**< FCRAM-II Upper Addres Start
04809                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED *** */
04810     uint64_t maxbnk                       : 1;  /**< Maximum Banks per-device (used by the address mapper
04811                                                          when extracting address bits for the memory bank#.
04812                                                            - 0: 4 banks/device
04813                                                            - 1: 8 banks/device */
04814     uint64_t fcram2p                      : 1;  /**< FCRAM-II+ Mode Enable
04815                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED *** */
04816 #else
04817     uint64_t fcram2p                      : 1;
04818     uint64_t maxbnk                       : 1;
04819     uint64_t ua_start                     : 2;
04820     uint64_t refshort                     : 1;
04821     uint64_t trfc                         : 5;
04822     uint64_t silrst                       : 1;
04823     uint64_t dteclkdis                    : 1;
04824     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
04825 #endif
04826     } s;
04827     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg2_s             cn38xx;
04828     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg2_s             cn38xxp2;
04829     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg2_s             cn58xx;
04830     struct cvmx_dfa_memcfg2_s             cn58xxp1;
04831 };
04832 typedef union cvmx_dfa_memcfg2 cvmx_dfa_memcfg2_t;
04833 
04834 /**
04835  * cvmx_dfa_memfadr
04836  *
04837  * DFA_MEMFADR = RLDRAM Failing Address/Control Register
04838  *
04839  * Description: DFA Memory Failing Address/Control Error Capture information
04840  * This register contains useful information to help in isolating an RLDRAM memory failure.
04841  * NOTE: The first detected SEC/DED/PERR failure is captured in DFA_MEMFADR, however, a DED or PERR (which is
04842  * more severe) will always overwrite a SEC error. The user can 'infer' the source of the interrupt
04843  * via the FSRC field.
04844  * NOTE: If DFA_MEMCFG2[DTECLKDIS]=1, the contents of this register are UNDEFINED.
04845  */
04846 union cvmx_dfa_memfadr {
04847     uint64_t u64;
04848     struct cvmx_dfa_memfadr_s {
04849 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04850     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
04851     uint64_t maddr                        : 24; /**< Memory Address */
04852 #else
04853     uint64_t maddr                        : 24;
04854     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
04855 #endif
04856     } s;
04857     struct cvmx_dfa_memfadr_cn31xx {
04858 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04859     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
04860     uint64_t fdst                         : 9;  /**< Fill-Destination
04861                                                             FSRC[1:0]    | FDST[8:0]
04862                                                             -------------+-------------------------------------
04863                                                              0(NCB-DTE)  | [fillstart,2'b0,WIDX(1),DMODE(1),DTE(4)]
04864                                                              1(NCB-CSR)  | [ncbSRC[8:0]]
04865                                                              3(CP2-PP)   | [2'b0,SIZE(1),INDEX(1),PP(4),FID(1)]
04866                                                            where:
04867                                                                DTE: DFA Thread Engine ID#
04868                                                                PP: Packet Processor ID#
04869                                                                FID: Fill-ID# (unique per PP)
04870                                                                WIDX:  16b SIMPLE Mode (index)
04871                                                                DMODE: (0=16b SIMPLE/1=32b SIMPLE)
04872                                                                SIZE: (0=LW Mode access/1=QW Mode Access)
04873                                                                INDEX: (0=Low LW/1=High LW)
04874                                                          NOTE: QW refers to a 56/64-bit LLM Load/Store (intiated
04875                                                          by a processor core). LW refers to a 32-bit load/store. */
04876     uint64_t fsrc                         : 2;  /**< Fill-Source (0=NCB-DTE/1=NCB-CSR/2=RESERVED/3=PP-CP2) */
04877     uint64_t pnum                         : 1;  /**< Memory Port
04878                                                          NOTE: For O2P, this bit will always return zero. */
04879     uint64_t bnum                         : 3;  /**< Memory Bank
04880                                                          When DFA_DDR2_ADDR[RNK_LO]=1, BNUM[2]=RANK[0].
04881                                                          (RANK[1] can be inferred from MADDR[24:0]) */
04882     uint64_t maddr                        : 25; /**< Memory Address */
04883 #else
04884     uint64_t maddr                        : 25;
04885     uint64_t bnum                         : 3;
04886     uint64_t pnum                         : 1;
04887     uint64_t fsrc                         : 2;
04888     uint64_t fdst                         : 9;
04889     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
04890 #endif
04891     } cn31xx;
04892     struct cvmx_dfa_memfadr_cn38xx {
04893 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04894     uint64_t reserved_39_63               : 25;
04895     uint64_t fdst                         : 9;  /**< Fill-Destination
04896                                                             FSRC[1:0]    | FDST[8:0]
04897                                                             -------------+-------------------------------------
04898                                                              0(NCB-DTE)  | [fillstart,2'b0,WIDX(1),DMODE(1),DTE(4)]
04899                                                              1(NCB-CSR)  | [ncbSRC[8:0]]
04900                                                              3(CP2-PP)   | [2'b0,SIZE(1),INDEX(1),PP(4),FID(1)]
04901                                                            where:
04902                                                                DTE: DFA Thread Engine ID#
04903                                                                PP: Packet Processor ID#
04904                                                                FID: Fill-ID# (unique per PP)
04905                                                                WIDX:  18b SIMPLE Mode (index)
04906                                                                DMODE: (0=18b SIMPLE/1=36b SIMPLE)
04907                                                                SIZE: (0=LW Mode access/1=QW Mode Access)
04908                                                                INDEX: (0=Low LW/1=High LW)
04909                                                          NOTE: QW refers to a 64-bit LLM Load/Store (intiated
04910                                                          by a processor core). LW refers to a 36-bit load/store. */
04911     uint64_t fsrc                         : 2;  /**< Fill-Source (0=NCB-DTE/1=NCB-CSR/2=RESERVED/3=PP-CP2) */
04912     uint64_t pnum                         : 1;  /**< Memory Port
04913                                                          NOTE: the port id's are reversed
04914                                                             PNUM==0 => port#1
04915                                                             PNUM==1 => port#0 */
04916     uint64_t bnum                         : 3;  /**< Memory Bank */
04917     uint64_t maddr                        : 24; /**< Memory Address */
04918 #else
04919     uint64_t maddr                        : 24;
04920     uint64_t bnum                         : 3;
04921     uint64_t pnum                         : 1;
04922     uint64_t fsrc                         : 2;
04923     uint64_t fdst                         : 9;
04924     uint64_t reserved_39_63               : 25;
04925 #endif
04926     } cn38xx;
04927     struct cvmx_dfa_memfadr_cn38xx        cn38xxp2;
04928     struct cvmx_dfa_memfadr_cn38xx        cn58xx;
04929     struct cvmx_dfa_memfadr_cn38xx        cn58xxp1;
04930 };
04931 typedef union cvmx_dfa_memfadr cvmx_dfa_memfadr_t;
04932 
04933 /**
04934  * cvmx_dfa_memfcr
04935  *
04936  * DFA_MEMFCR = FCRAM MRS Register(s) EMRS2[14:0], EMRS1[14:0], MRS[14:0]
04937  * *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED ***
04938  *
04939  * Notes:
04940  * For FCRAM-II please consult your device's data sheet for further details:
04941  * MRS Definition:
04942  *    A[13:8]=0   RESERVED
04943  *    A[7]=0      TEST MODE     (N3K requires test mode 0:"disabled")
04944  *    A[6:4]      CAS LATENCY   (fully programmable - SW must ensure that the value programmed
04945  *                               into DFA_MEM_CFG0[TRL] corresponds with this value).
04946  *    A[3]=0      BURST TYPE    (N3K requires 0:"Sequential" Burst Type)
04947  *    A[2:0]      BURST LENGTH  Burst Length [1:BL2/2:BL4] (N3K only supports BL=2,4)
04948  *
04949  *                                  In BL2 mode(for highest performance), only 1/2 the phsyical
04950  *                                  memory is unique (ie: each bunk stores the same information).
04951  *                                  In BL4 mode(highest capacity), all of the physical memory
04952  *                                  is unique (ie: each bunk is uniquely addressable).
04953  * EMRS Definition:
04954  *    A[13:12]    REFRESH MODE  (N3K Supports only 0:"Conventional" and 1:"Short" auto-refresh modes)
04955  *
04956  *                              (SW must ensure that the value programmed into DFA_MEMCFG2[REFSHORT]
04957  *                              is also reflected in the Refresh Mode encoding).
04958  *    A[11:7]=0   RESERVED
04959  *    A[6:5]=2    STROBE SELECT (N3K supports only 2:"Unidirectional DS/QS" mode - the read capture
04960  *                              silos rely on a conditional QS strobe)
04961  *    A[4:3]      DIC(QS)       QS Drive Strength: fully programmable (consult your FCRAM-II data sheet)
04962  *                                [0: Normal Output Drive/1: Strong Output Drive/2: Weak output Drive]
04963  *    A[2:1]      DIC(DQ)       DQ Drive Strength: fully programmable (consult your FCRAM-II data sheet)
04964  *                                [0: Normal Output Drive/1: Strong Output Drive/2: Weak output Drive]
04965  *    A[0]        DLL           DLL Enable: Programmable [0:DLL Enable/1: DLL Disable]
04966  *
04967  * EMRS2 Definition: (for FCRAM-II+)
04968  *    A[13:11]=0                RESERVED
04969  *    A[10:8]     ODTDS         On Die Termination (DS+/-)
04970  *                                 [0: ODT Disable /1: 15ohm termination /(2-7): RESERVED]
04971  *    A[7:6]=0    MBW           Multi-Bank Write: (N3K requires use of 0:"single bank" mode only)
04972  *    A[5:3]      ODTin         On Die Termination (input pin)
04973  *                                 [0: ODT Disable /1: 15ohm termination /(2-7): RESERVED]
04974  *    A[2:0]      ODTDQ         On Die Termination (DQ)
04975  *                                 [0: ODT Disable /1: 15ohm termination /(2-7): RESERVED]
04976  */
04977 union cvmx_dfa_memfcr {
04978     uint64_t u64;
04979     struct cvmx_dfa_memfcr_s {
04980 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
04981     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
04982     uint64_t emrs2                        : 15; /**< Memory Address[14:0] during EMRS2(for FCRAM-II+)
04983                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED *** */
04984     uint64_t reserved_31_31               : 1;
04985     uint64_t emrs                         : 15; /**< Memory Address[14:0] during EMRS
04986                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED ***
04987                                                            A[0]=1: DLL Enabled) */
04988     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
04989     uint64_t mrs                          : 15; /**< FCRAM Memory Address[14:0] during MRS
04990                                                          *** CN58XX UNSUPPORTED ***
04991                                                            A[6:4]=4  CAS LATENCY=4(default)
04992                                                            A[3]=0    Burst Type(must be 0:Sequential)
04993                                                            A[2:0]=2  Burst Length=4(default) */
04994 #else
04995     uint64_t mrs                          : 15;
04996     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
04997     uint64_t emrs                         : 15;
04998     uint64_t reserved_31_31               : 1;
04999     uint64_t emrs2                        : 15;
05000     uint64_t reserved_47_63               : 17;
05001 #endif
05002     } s;
05003     struct cvmx_dfa_memfcr_s              cn38xx;
05004     struct cvmx_dfa_memfcr_s              cn38xxp2;
05005     struct cvmx_dfa_memfcr_s              cn58xx;
05006     struct cvmx_dfa_memfcr_s              cn58xxp1;
05007 };
05008 typedef union cvmx_dfa_memfcr cvmx_dfa_memfcr_t;
05009 
05010 /**
05011  * cvmx_dfa_memhidat
05012  *
05013  * Description:
05014  * DFA supports NCB-Direct CSR acccesses to DFM Memory space for debug purposes. Unfortunately,
05015  * NCB-Direct accesses
05016  * are limited to QW-size(64bits), whereas the minimum access granularity for DFM Memory space is
05017  * OW(128bits). To
05018  * support writes to DFM Memory space, the Hi-QW of data is sourced from the DFA_MEMHIDAT
05019  * register. Recall, the
05020  * OW(128b) in DDR3 memory space is fixed format:
05021  * OWDATA[127:118]: OWECC[9:0] 10bits of in-band OWECC SEC/DED codeword
05022  * This can be precomputed/written by SW OR
05023  * if DFM_FNTCTL[ECC_WENA]=1, DFM hardware will auto-compute the 10b OWECC and place in the
05024  * OWDATA[127:118] before being written to memory.
05025  * OWDATA[117:0]:   Memory Data (contains fixed MNODE/MONODE arc formats for use by DTEs(thread
05026  * engines).
05027  * Or, a user may choose to treat DFM Memory Space as 'scratch pad' in which case the
05028  * OWDATA[117:0] may contain user-specified information accessible via NCB-Direct CSR mode
05029  * accesses to DFA Memory Space.
05030  * NOTE: To write to the DFA_MEMHIDAT register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the DFA
05031  * with addr[34:32]=3'b111.
05032  * To read the DFA_MEMHIDAT register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the DFA with
05033  * addr[34:32]=3'b111.
05034  * NOTE: If DFA_CONFIG[DTECLKDIS]=1 (DFA-DTE clocks disabled), reads/writes to the DFA_MEMHIDAT
05035  * register do not take effect.
05036  * NOTE: If FUSE[TBD]="DFA DTE disable" is blown, reads/writes to the DFA_MEMHIDAT register do
05037  * not take effect.
05038  * NOTE: PLEASE REMOVE DEFINITION FROM o68/o61 HRM
05039  */
05040 union cvmx_dfa_memhidat {
05041     uint64_t u64;
05042     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s {
05043 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05044     uint64_t hidat                        : 64; /**< This register is unused and can be treated as spare bits. */
05045 #else
05046     uint64_t hidat                        : 64;
05047 #endif
05048     } s;
05049     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn61xx;
05050     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn63xx;
05051     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn63xxp1;
05052     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn66xx;
05053     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn68xx;
05054     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn68xxp1;
05055     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn70xx;
05056     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn70xxp1;
05057     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn73xx;
05058     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn78xx;
05059     struct cvmx_dfa_memhidat_s            cn78xxp1;
05060 };
05061 typedef union cvmx_dfa_memhidat cvmx_dfa_memhidat_t;
05062 
05063 /**
05064  * cvmx_dfa_memrld
05065  *
05066  * DFA_MEMRLD = DFA RLDRAM MRS Register Values
05067  *
05068  * Description:
05069  */
05070 union cvmx_dfa_memrld {
05071     uint64_t u64;
05072     struct cvmx_dfa_memrld_s {
05073 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05074     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
05075     uint64_t mrsdat                       : 23; /**< This field represents the data driven onto the
05076                                                          A[22:0] address lines during MRS(Mode Register Set)
05077                                                          commands (during a HW init sequence). This field
05078                                                          corresponds with the Mode Register Bit Map from
05079                                                          your RLDRAM-II device specific data sheet.
05080                                                             A[17:10]: RESERVED
05081                                                             A[9]:     ODT (on die termination)
05082                                                             A[8]:     Impedance Matching
05083                                                             A[7]:     DLL Reset
05084                                                             A[6]:     UNUSED
05085                                                             A[5]:     Address Mux  (for N3K: MUST BE ZERO)
05086                                                             A[4:3]:   Burst Length (for N3K: MUST BE ZERO)
05087                                                             A[2:0]:   Configuration (see data sheet for
05088                                                                       specific RLDRAM-II device).
05089                                                                - 000-001: CFG=1 [tRC=4/tRL=4/tWL=5]
05090                                                                - 010:     CFG=2 [tRC=6/tRL=6/tWL=7]
05091                                                                - 011:     CFG=3 [tRC=8/tRL=8/tWL=9]
05092                                                                - 100-111: RESERVED
05093                                                           NOTE: For additional density, the RLDRAM-II parts
05094                                                           can be 'clamshelled' (ie: two devices mounted on
05095                                                           different sides of the PCB board), since the BGA
05096                                                           pinout supports 'mirroring'.
05097                                                           To support a clamshell design, SW must preload
05098                                                           the MRSDAT[22:0] with the proper A[22:0] pin mapping
05099                                                           which is dependent on the 'selected' bunk/clam
05100                                                           (see also: DFA_MEMCFG0[BUNK_INIT] field).
05101                                                           NOTE: Care MUST BE TAKEN NOT to write to this register
05102                                                           within 64K eclk cycles of a HW INIT (see: INIT_P0/INIT_P1).
05103                                                           NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05104                                                           during power-on SW initialization. */
05105 #else
05106     uint64_t mrsdat                       : 23;
05107     uint64_t reserved_23_63               : 41;
05108 #endif
05109     } s;
05110     struct cvmx_dfa_memrld_s              cn38xx;
05111     struct cvmx_dfa_memrld_s              cn38xxp2;
05112     struct cvmx_dfa_memrld_s              cn58xx;
05113     struct cvmx_dfa_memrld_s              cn58xxp1;
05114 };
05115 typedef union cvmx_dfa_memrld cvmx_dfa_memrld_t;
05116 
05117 /**
05118  * cvmx_dfa_ncbctl
05119  *
05120  * DFA_NCBCTL = DFA NCB CTL Register
05121  *
05122  * Description:
05123  */
05124 union cvmx_dfa_ncbctl {
05125     uint64_t u64;
05126     struct cvmx_dfa_ncbctl_s {
05127 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05128     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
05129     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 5;  /**< SBD Debug Entry#
05130                                                          For internal use only. (DFA Scoreboard debug)
05131                                                          Selects which one of 32 DFA Scoreboard entries is
05132                                                          latched into the DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3] registers. */
05133     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;  /**< DFA Scoreboard LOCK Strobe
05134                                                          For internal use only. (DFA Scoreboard debug)
05135                                                          When written with a '1', the DFA Scoreboard Debug
05136                                                          registers (DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3]) are all locked down.
05137                                                          This allows SW to lock down the contents of the entire
05138                                                          SBD for a single instant in time. All subsequent reads
05139                                                          of the DFA scoreboard registers will return the data
05140                                                          from that instant in time. */
05141     uint64_t dcmode                       : 1;  /**< DRF-CRQ/DTE Arbiter Mode
05142                                                          DTE-DRF Arbiter (0=FP [LP=CRQ/HP=DTE],1=RR)
05143                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05144                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05145     uint64_t dtmode                       : 1;  /**< DRF-DTE Arbiter Mode
05146                                                          DTE-DRF Arbiter (0=FP [LP=DTE[15],...,HP=DTE[0]],1=RR)
05147                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05148                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05149     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRP Arbiter Mode
05150                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=WQF,DFF,HP=RGF]/1=RR
05151                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05152                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05153     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRQ Arbiter Mode
05154                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=IRF,RWF,PRF,HP=GRF]/1=RR
05155                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05156                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05157     uint64_t imode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-Inbound Arbiter
05158                                                          (0=FP [LP=NRQ,HP=NRP], 1=RR)
05159                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05160                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05161 #else
05162     uint64_t imode                        : 1;
05163     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;
05164     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;
05165     uint64_t dtmode                       : 1;
05166     uint64_t dcmode                       : 1;
05167     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;
05168     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 5;
05169     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
05170 #endif
05171     } s;
05172     struct cvmx_dfa_ncbctl_cn38xx {
05173 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05174     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
05175     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 4;  /**< SBD Debug Entry#
05176                                                          For internal use only. (DFA Scoreboard debug)
05177                                                          Selects which one of 16 DFA Scoreboard entries is
05178                                                          latched into the DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3] registers. */
05179     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;  /**< DFA Scoreboard LOCK Strobe
05180                                                          For internal use only. (DFA Scoreboard debug)
05181                                                          When written with a '1', the DFA Scoreboard Debug
05182                                                          registers (DFA_SBD_DBG[0-3]) are all locked down.
05183                                                          This allows SW to lock down the contents of the entire
05184                                                          SBD for a single instant in time. All subsequent reads
05185                                                          of the DFA scoreboard registers will return the data
05186                                                          from that instant in time. */
05187     uint64_t dcmode                       : 1;  /**< DRF-CRQ/DTE Arbiter Mode
05188                                                          DTE-DRF Arbiter (0=FP [LP=CRQ/HP=DTE],1=RR)
05189                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05190                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05191     uint64_t dtmode                       : 1;  /**< DRF-DTE Arbiter Mode
05192                                                          DTE-DRF Arbiter (0=FP [LP=DTE[15],...,HP=DTE[0]],1=RR)
05193                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05194                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05195     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRP Arbiter Mode
05196                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=WQF,DFF,HP=RGF]/1=RR
05197                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05198                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05199     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-NRQ Arbiter Mode
05200                                                          (0=Fixed Priority [LP=IRF,RWF,PRF,HP=GRF]/1=RR
05201                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05202                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05203     uint64_t imode                        : 1;  /**< NCB-Inbound Arbiter
05204                                                          (0=FP [LP=NRQ,HP=NRP], 1=RR)
05205                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value
05206                                                          during power-on SW initialization. */
05207 #else
05208     uint64_t imode                        : 1;
05209     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;
05210     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;
05211     uint64_t dtmode                       : 1;
05212     uint64_t dcmode                       : 1;
05213     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;
05214     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 4;
05215     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
05216 #endif
05217     } cn38xx;
05218     struct cvmx_dfa_ncbctl_cn38xx         cn38xxp2;
05219     struct cvmx_dfa_ncbctl_s              cn58xx;
05220     struct cvmx_dfa_ncbctl_s              cn58xxp1;
05221 };
05222 typedef union cvmx_dfa_ncbctl cvmx_dfa_ncbctl_t;
05223 
05224 /**
05225  * cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt
05226  */
05227 union cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt {
05228     uint64_t u64;
05229     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt_s {
05230 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05231     uint64_t pfcnt0                       : 64; /**< Performance counter 0. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT0ENA] = 1, the event selected by
05232                                                          DFA_PFC0_CTL[EVSEL] is counted. See also DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT0WCLR] and DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT0RCLR]
05233                                                          for special clear count cases available for software data collection. */
05234 #else
05235     uint64_t pfcnt0                       : 64;
05236 #endif
05237     } s;
05238     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt_s            cn73xx;
05239     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt_s            cn78xx;
05240     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt_s            cn78xxp1;
05241 };
05242 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt cvmx_dfa_pfc0_cnt_t;
05243 
05244 /**
05245  * cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl
05246  */
05247 union cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl {
05248     uint64_t u64;
05249     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl_s {
05250 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05251     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05252     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;  /**< "Performance counter 0 event selector.
05253                                                           // Events [0-31] are based on PMODE(0:per cluster-DTE 1:per graph)
05254                                                          - 0:  \#Total Cycles.
05255                                                          - 1:  \#LDNODE visits.
05256                                                          - 2:  \#SDNODE visits.
05257                                                          - 3:  \#DNODE visits (LD/SD).
05258                                                          - 4:  \#LCNODE visits.
05259                                                          - 5:  \#SCNODE visits.
05260                                                          - 6:  \#CNODE visits (LC/SC).
05261                                                          - 7:  \#LMNODE visits.
05262                                                          - 8:  \#SMNODE visits.
05263                                                          - 9:  \#MNODE visits (LM/SM).
05264                                                           - 10: \#MONODE visits.
05265                                                           - 11: \#CACHE visits (DNODE,CNODE) exc: CNDRD,MPHIDX.
05266                                                           - 12: \#CACHE visits (DNODE,CNODE)+(CNDRD,MPHIDX).
05267                                                           - 13: \#MEMORY visits (MNODE+MONODE).
05268                                                           - 14: \#CNDRDs detected (occur for SCNODE->*MNODE transitions).
05269                                                           - 15: \#MPHIDX detected (occur for ->LMNODE transitions).
05270                                                           - 16: \#RESCANs detected (occur when HASH collision is detected).
05271                                                           - 17: \#GWALK iterations -  stalled--packet data/result buffer.
05272                                                           - 18: \#GWALK iterations - nonstalled.
05273                                                           - 19: \#CLOAD iterations.
05274                                                           - 20: \#MLOAD iterations [NOTE: If PMODE=1 (per-graph) the MLOAD IWORD0.VGID is used to
05275                                                           discern graph number].
05276                                                           - 21: \#RWORD1+ write operations.
05277                                                           - 22: \#cycles cluster is busy.
05278                                                           - 23: \#GWALK instructions.
05279                                                           - 24: \#CLOAD instructions.
05280                                                           - 25: \#MLOAD instructions [NOTE: If PMODE = 1 (per-graph) the MLOAD IWORD0.VGID is used to
05281                                                           discern graph number].
05282                                                           - 26: \#GFREE instructions.
05283                                                           - 27-30: Reserved.
05284                                                           - 31: \# node transitions detected (see DFA_PFC_GCTL[SNODE,ENODE, EDNODE] registers
05285                                                           Events [32-63] are used only for PMODE = 0 (per-cluster HTE mode).
05286                                                           - 32: \#cycles a specific cluster-HTE remains active (valid state).
05287                                                           - 33: \#cycles a specific cluster-HTE waits for memory response data.
05288                                                           - 34: \#cycles a specific cluster-HTE waits in resource stall state (waiting for packet data
05289                                                           or result buffer space).
05290                                                           - 35: \#cycles a specific cluster-HTE waits in resource pending state.
05291                                                           - 36-63: Reserved." */
05292     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05293     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;  /**< Performance counter 0 cluster HTE selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster
05294                                                          HTE), this field is used to select/monitor the cluster's HTE number for all events
05295                                                          associated with performance counter 0. */
05296     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;  /**< Performance counter 0 cluster selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster HTE),
05297                                                          this field is used to select/monitor the cluster number for all events associated with
05298                                                          performance counter 0. */
05299 #else
05300     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;
05301     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;
05302     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05303     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;
05304     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05305 #endif
05306     } s;
05307     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl_s            cn73xx;
05308     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl_s            cn78xx;
05309     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl_s            cn78xxp1;
05310 };
05311 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl cvmx_dfa_pfc0_ctl_t;
05312 
05313 /**
05314  * cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt
05315  */
05316 union cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt {
05317     uint64_t u64;
05318     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt_s {
05319 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05320     uint64_t pfcnt1                       : 64; /**< Performance counter 1. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT1ENA] = 1, the event selected by
05321                                                          DFA_PFC1_CTL[EVSEL] is counted. See also DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT1WCLR] and DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT1RCLR]
05322                                                          for special clear count cases available for software data collection. */
05323 #else
05324     uint64_t pfcnt1                       : 64;
05325 #endif
05326     } s;
05327     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt_s            cn73xx;
05328     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt_s            cn78xx;
05329     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt_s            cn78xxp1;
05330 };
05331 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt cvmx_dfa_pfc1_cnt_t;
05332 
05333 /**
05334  * cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl
05335  */
05336 union cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl {
05337     uint64_t u64;
05338     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl_s {
05339 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05340     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05341     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;  /**< Performance counter 1 event selector.  See events enumerated by DFA_PFC0_CTL[EVSEL]. */
05342     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05343     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;  /**< Performance counter 1 cluster HTE selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster
05344                                                          HTE), this field is used to select/monitor the cluster's DTE number for all events
05345                                                          associated with performance counter 1. */
05346     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;  /**< Performance counter 1 cluster selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster HTE),
05347                                                          this field is used to select/monitor the cluster number for all events associated with
05348                                                          performance counter 1. */
05349 #else
05350     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;
05351     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;
05352     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05353     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;
05354     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05355 #endif
05356     } s;
05357     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl_s            cn73xx;
05358     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl_s            cn78xx;
05359     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl_s            cn78xxp1;
05360 };
05361 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl cvmx_dfa_pfc1_ctl_t;
05362 
05363 /**
05364  * cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt
05365  */
05366 union cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt {
05367     uint64_t u64;
05368     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt_s {
05369 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05370     uint64_t pfcnt2                       : 64; /**< Performance counter 2. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT2ENA] = 1, the event selected by
05371                                                          DFA_PFC2_CTL[EVSEL] is counted. See also DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT2WCLR] and DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT2RCLR]
05372                                                          for special clear count cases available for software data collection. */
05373 #else
05374     uint64_t pfcnt2                       : 64;
05375 #endif
05376     } s;
05377     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt_s            cn73xx;
05378     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt_s            cn78xx;
05379     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt_s            cn78xxp1;
05380 };
05381 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt cvmx_dfa_pfc2_cnt_t;
05382 
05383 /**
05384  * cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl
05385  */
05386 union cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl {
05387     uint64_t u64;
05388     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl_s {
05389 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05390     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05391     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;  /**< Performance counter 2 event selector.  See events enumerated by DFA_PFC0_CTL[EVSEL]. */
05392     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05393     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;  /**< Performance counter 2 cluster HTE selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster
05394                                                          HTE), this field is used to select/monitor the cluster's HTE number for all events
05395                                                          associated with performance counter 2. */
05396     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;  /**< Performance counter 2 cluster selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster HTE),
05397                                                          this field is used to select/monitor the cluster number for all events associated with
05398                                                          performance counter 2. */
05399 #else
05400     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;
05401     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;
05402     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05403     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;
05404     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05405 #endif
05406     } s;
05407     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl_s            cn73xx;
05408     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl_s            cn78xx;
05409     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl_s            cn78xxp1;
05410 };
05411 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl cvmx_dfa_pfc2_ctl_t;
05412 
05413 /**
05414  * cvmx_dfa_pfc3_cnt
05415  */

05417     uint64_t u64;
05418     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc3_cnt_s {
05419 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05420     uint64_t pfcnt3                       : 64; /**< Performance counter 3. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT3ENA] = 1, the event selected by
05421                                                          DFA_PFC3_CTL[EVSEL] is counted. See also DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT3WCLR] and DFA_PFC_GCTL[CNT3RCLR]
05422                                                          for special clear count cases available for software data collection. */
05423 #else
05424     uint64_t pfcnt3                       : 64;
05425 #endif
05426     } s;

05433 /**
05434  * cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl
05435  */
05436 union cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl {
05437     uint64_t u64;
05438     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl_s {
05439 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05440     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05441     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;  /**< Performance counter 3 event selector.  See events enumerated by DFA_PFC0_CTL[EVSEL]. */
05442     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05443     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;  /**< Performance counter 3 cluster HTE selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster
05444                                                          HTE), this field is used to select/monitor the cluster's HTE number for all events
05445                                                          associated with performance counter 3. */
05446     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;  /**< Performance counter 3 cluster selector. When DFA_PFC_GCTL[PMODE] = 0 (per-cluster HTE),
05447                                                          this field is used to select/monitor the cluster number for all events associated with
05448                                                          performance counter 3. */
05449 #else
05450     uint64_t clnum                        : 2;
05451     uint64_t cldte                        : 4;
05452     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
05453     uint64_t evsel                        : 6;
05454     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
05455 #endif
05456     } s;
05457     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl_s            cn73xx;
05458     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl_s            cn78xx;
05459     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl_s            cn78xxp1;
05460 };
05461 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl cvmx_dfa_pfc3_ctl_t;
05462 
05463 /**
05464  * cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl
05465  */
05466 union cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl {
05467     uint64_t u64;
05468     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl_s {
05469 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05470     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
05471     uint64_t vgid                         : 8;  /**< Virtual graph ID. When PMODE = 1 (per-graph selector), this field is used to
05472                                                          select/monitor only those events which are associated with this selected VGID (virtual
05473                                                          graph ID). This field is used globally across all four performance counters. */
05474     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;  /**< Select mode.
05475                                                          0 = Events are selected on a per-cluster HTE number (CLNUM/CLDTE).
05476                                                          DFA_PFCx_CTL[CLNUM,CLDTE] specifies the cluster-HTE for each 1 (of 4) performance
05477                                                          counters.
05478                                                          1 = Events are selected on a per-graph basis (VGID = virtual graph ID).
05479                                                          Only EVSEL = [0...31] can be used in conjunction with
05480                                                          [PMODE] = 1. DFA_PFC_GCTL[VGID] specifies the virtual graph ID used across all four
05481                                                          performance counters. */
05482     uint64_t ednode                       : 2;  /**< Ending DNODE Selector.
05483                                                          When [ENODE]=0/1(*DNODE), this field is used to further specify the ending DNODE
05484                                                          transition  sub-type:
05485                                                          0x0 = ALL DNODE sub-types.
05486                                                          0x1 = ->D2e (explicit DNODE transition node-arc alone transitions to DNODE).
05487                                                          0x2 = ->D2i (implicit DNODE transition:arc-present triggers transition).
05488                                                          0x3 = ->D1r (rescan DNODE transition). */
05489     uint64_t enode                        : 4;  /**< Ending node selector.
05490                                                          When DFA_PFCx_CTL[EVSEL]=Node Transition(31), [ENODE] is used to select ending
05491                                                          node, and the SNODE field is used to select the starting node.
05492                                                          0x0 = LDNODE.
05493                                                          0x1 = SDNODE.
05494                                                          0x2 = LCNODE.
05495                                                          0x3 = SCNODE.
05496                                                          0x4 = LMNODE.
05497                                                          0x5 = SMNODE.
05498                                                          0x6 = MONODE.
05499                                                          0x7 = Reserved.
05500                                                          0x8 = LONODE.
05501                                                          0x9 = SONODE. */
05502     uint64_t snode                        : 4;  /**< Starting node selector.
05503                                                          When DFA_PFCx_CTL[EVSEL]=Node Transition(31), [SNODE] is used to select starting
05504                                                          node, and the ENODE field is used to select the ending node.
05505                                                          0x0 = LDNODE.
05506                                                          0x1 = SDNODE.
05507                                                          0x2 = LCNODE.
05508                                                          0x3 = SCNODE.
05509                                                          0x4 = LMNODE.
05510                                                          0x5 = SMNODE.
05511                                                          0x6 = MONODE.
05512                                                          0x7 = Reserved.
05513                                                          0x8 = LONODE.
05514                                                          0x9 = SONODE. */
05515     uint64_t cnt3rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 3 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR read operations to DFA_PFC3_CNT
05516                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
05517                                                          hardware wraparound. */
05518     uint64_t cnt2rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 2 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR read operations to DFA_PFC2_CNT
05519                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
05520                                                          hardware wraparound. */
05521     uint64_t cnt1rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 1 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR read operations to DFA_PFC1_CNT
05522                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
05523                                                          hardware wraparound. */
05524     uint64_t cnt0rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 0 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR read operations to DFA_PFC0_CNT
05525                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
05526                                                          hardware wraparound. */
05527     uint64_t cnt3wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 3 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR write operations to
05528                                                          DFA_PFC3_CNT clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR write operations to
05529                                                          DFA_PFC3_CNT continue the count from the written value. */
05530     uint64_t cnt2wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 2 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR write operations to
05531                                                          DFA_PFC2_CNT clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR write operations to
05532                                                          DFA_PFC2_CNT continue the count from the written value. */
05533     uint64_t cnt1wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 1 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR write operations to
05534                                                          DFA_PFC1_CNT clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR write operations to
05535                                                          DFA_PFC1_CNT continue the count from the written value. */
05536     uint64_t cnt0wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 0 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR write operations to
05537                                                          DFA_PFC0_CNT clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR write operations to
05538                                                          DFA_PFC0_CNT continue the count from the written value. */
05539     uint64_t cnt3ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 3 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 3 is enabled. */
05540     uint64_t cnt2ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 2 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 2 is enabled. */
05541     uint64_t cnt1ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 1 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 1 is enabled. */
05542     uint64_t cnt0ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 0 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 0 is enabled. */
05543 #else
05544     uint64_t cnt0ena                      : 1;
05545     uint64_t cnt1ena                      : 1;
05546     uint64_t cnt2ena                      : 1;
05547     uint64_t cnt3ena                      : 1;
05548     uint64_t cnt0wclr                     : 1;
05549     uint64_t cnt1wclr                     : 1;
05550     uint64_t cnt2wclr                     : 1;
05551     uint64_t cnt3wclr                     : 1;
05552     uint64_t cnt0rclr                     : 1;
05553     uint64_t cnt1rclr                     : 1;
05554     uint64_t cnt2rclr                     : 1;
05555     uint64_t cnt3rclr                     : 1;
05556     uint64_t snode                        : 4;
05557     uint64_t enode                        : 4;
05558     uint64_t ednode                       : 2;
05559     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;
05560     uint64_t vgid                         : 8;
05561     uint64_t reserved_31_63               : 33;
05562 #endif
05563     } s;
05564     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl_s            cn73xx;
05565     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl_s            cn78xx;
05566     struct cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl_s            cn78xxp1;
05567 };
05568 typedef union cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl cvmx_dfa_pfc_gctl_t;
05569 
05570 /**
05571  * cvmx_dfa_rodt_comp_ctl
05572  *
05573  * DFA_RODT_COMP_CTL = DFA RLD Compensation control (For read "on die termination")
05574  *
05575  */
05576 union cvmx_dfa_rodt_comp_ctl {
05577     uint64_t u64;
05578     struct cvmx_dfa_rodt_comp_ctl_s {
05579 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05580     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
05581     uint64_t enable                       : 1;  /**< Read On Die Termination Enable
05582                                                          (0=disable, 1=enable) */
05583     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
05584     uint64_t nctl                         : 4;  /**< Compensation control bits */
05585     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
05586     uint64_t pctl                         : 5;  /**< Compensation control bits */
05587 #else
05588     uint64_t pctl                         : 5;
05589     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
05590     uint64_t nctl                         : 4;
05591     uint64_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
05592     uint64_t enable                       : 1;
05593     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
05594 #endif
05595     } s;
05596     struct cvmx_dfa_rodt_comp_ctl_s       cn58xx;
05597     struct cvmx_dfa_rodt_comp_ctl_s       cn58xxp1;
05598 };
05599 typedef union cvmx_dfa_rodt_comp_ctl cvmx_dfa_rodt_comp_ctl_t;
05600 
05601 /**
05602  * cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0
05603  *
05604  * DFA_SBD_DBG0 = DFA Scoreboard Debug \#0 Register
05605  *
05606  * Description: When the DFA_NCBCTL[SBDLCK] bit is written '1', the contents of this register are locked down.
05607  * Otherwise, the contents of this register are the 'active' contents of the DFA Scoreboard at the time of the
05608  * CSR read.
05609  * VERIFICATION NOTE: Read data is unsafe. X's(undefined data) can propagate (in the behavioral model)
05610  * on the reads unless the DTE Engine specified by DFA_NCBCTL[SBDNUM] has previously been assigned an
05611  * instruction.
05612  */
05613 union cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0 {
05614     uint64_t u64;
05615     struct cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0_s {
05616 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05617     uint64_t sbd0                         : 64; /**< DFA ScoreBoard \#0 Data
05618                                                          For internal use only! (DFA Scoreboard Debug)
05619                                                          [63:40] rptr[26:3]: Result Base Pointer
05620                                                          [39:24] rwcnt[15:0] Cumulative Result Write Counter
05621                                                          [23]    lastgrdrsp: Last Gather-Rd Response
05622                                                          [22]    wtgrdrsp: Waiting Gather-Rd Response
05623                                                          [21]    wtgrdreq: Waiting for Gather-Rd Issue
05624                                                          [20]    glvld: GLPTR/GLCNT Valid
05625                                                          [19]    cmpmark: Completion Marked Node Detected
05626                                                          [18:17] cmpcode[1:0]: Completion Code
05627                                                                        [0=PDGONE/1=PERR/2=RFULL/3=TERM]
05628                                                          [16]    cmpdet: Completion Detected
05629                                                          [15]    wthdrwrcmtrsp: Waiting for HDR RWrCmtRsp
05630                                                          [14]    wtlastwrcmtrsp: Waiting for LAST RESULT
05631                                                                        RWrCmtRsp
05632                                                          [13]    hdrwrreq: Waiting for HDR RWrReq
05633                                                          [12]    wtrwrreq: Waiting for RWrReq
05634                                                          [11]    wtwqwrreq: Waiting for WQWrReq issue
05635                                                          [10]    lastprdrspeot: Last Packet-Rd Response
05636                                                          [9]     lastprdrsp: Last Packet-Rd Response
05637                                                          [8]     wtprdrsp:  Waiting for PRdRsp EOT
05638                                                          [7]     wtprdreq: Waiting for PRdReq Issue
05639                                                          [6]     lastpdvld: PDPTR/PDLEN Valid
05640                                                          [5]     pdvld: Packet Data Valid
05641                                                          [4]     wqvld: WQVLD
05642                                                          [3]     wqdone: WorkQueue Done condition
05643                                                                        a) WQWrReq issued(for WQPTR<>0) OR
05644                                                                        b) HDR RWrCmtRsp completed)
05645                                                          [2]     rwstf: Resultant write STF/P Mode
05646                                                          [1]     pdldt: Packet-Data LDT mode
05647                                                          [0]     gmode: Gather-Mode */
05648 #else
05649     uint64_t sbd0                         : 64;
05650 #endif
05651     } s;
05652     struct cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0_s            cn31xx;
05653     struct cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0_s            cn38xx;
05654     struct cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0_s            cn38xxp2;
05655     struct cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0_s            cn58xx;
05656     struct cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0_s            cn58xxp1;
05657 };
05658 typedef union cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0 cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg0_t;
05659 
05660 /**
05661  * cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg1
05662  *
05663  * DFA_SBD_DBG1 = DFA Scoreboard Debug \#1 Register
05664  *
05665  * Description: When the DFA_NCBCTL[SBDLCK] bit is written '1', the contents of this register are locked down.
05666  * Otherwise, the contents of this register are the 'active' contents of the DFA Scoreboard at the time of the
05667  * CSR read.
05668  * VERIFICATION NOTE: Read data is unsafe. X's(undefined data) can propagate (in the behavioral model)
05669  * on the reads unless the DTE Engine specified by DFA_NCBCTL[SBDNUM] has previously been assigned an
05670  * instruction.
05671  */
05672 union cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg1 {
05673     uint64_t u64;
05674     struct cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg1_s {
05675 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
05676     uint64_t sbd1                         : 64; /**< DFA ScoreBoard \#1 Data
05677                                                          For internal use only! (DFA Scoreboard Debug)
05678                                                          [63:61] wqptr[35:33]: Work Queue Pointer
05679                                                          [60:52] rptr[35:27]: Result Base Pointer
05680                                                          [51:16] pdptr[35:0]: Packet Data Pointer
05681                                                          [15:0]  pdcnt[15:0]: Packet Data Counter */
05682 #else
05683     uint64_t sbd1                         : 64;
05684 #endif
05685     } s;

05691 };

05701  * CSR read.

05712                                                          [48:16] rwptr[35:3]: Result Write Pointer
05713                                                          [15:0]  prwcnt[15:0]: Pending Result Write Counter */

05726 /**

05729  * DFA_SBD_DBG3 = DFA Scoreboard Debug \#3 Register
05730  *
05731  * Description: When the DFA_NCBCTL[SBDLCK] bit is written '1', the contents of this register are locked down.
05732  * Otherwise, the contents of this register are the 'active' contents of the DFA Scoreboard at the time of the
05733  * CSR read.
05734  * VERIFICATION NOTE: Read data is unsafe. X's(undefined data) can propagate (in the behavioral model)
05735  * on the reads unless the DTE Engine specified by DFA_NCBCTL[SBDNUM] has previously been assigned an
05736  * instruction.

05738 union cvmx_dfa_sbd_dbg3 {

05742     uint64_t sbd3                         : 64; /**< DFA ScoreBoard \#3 Data
05743                                                          [63:49] wqptr[32:18]: Work Queue Pointer
05744                                                          [48:16] glptr[35:3]: Gather List Pointer
05745                                                          [15:0]  glcnt[15:0]: Gather List Counter */
05746 #else

05748 #endif
05749     } s;
